college_info.college_name: MSU Baroda Fees 2026
MSU Baroda Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely worth the time and money with all the industry-ready tools to make us succeed.

detailed_review.Placements: The major roles which are offered in our senior batch are in finance and marketing. Almost 90% batch is being placed, and the placement drive process is still ongoing. 100% of the batch for the internships with an average stipend of Rs 20,000. Top recruiter is Federal Bank. The average package is around 7 LPA, and 16 LPA is the highest.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure with that amount of fee is extraordinary. It has a top-notch library with all the publications needed and required to be studied. We have Wi-Fi on campus and a ground to play. Infrastructure is no less than an understatement.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching method is very unique and well-engaging, where participation in the classroom discussion is encouraged. The curriculum just sits right with the trend and with the regular seminars. The students are made industry-ready. The overall pass percentage is 100%.
detailed_review.Other: The return on investment from this college is impeccable. The minimal investment we are getting an MBA degree from a well-renowned institute with all the best amenities to make us drive for the best.

reviews.course: M.Sc. in Applied Chemistry
reviews.review_title: A Best college to study.

detailed_review.Placements: Each year more than 60% students get directly placed from campus placement, and the rest also get their job with the help of placement cell and the department. The placement cell is getting wider day by day. The role of placement cell is very crucial and good for the students of M.Sc. Applied Chemistry. Also, this placement cell not only works for one department; in MS University, there are respective placement cells in each faculty, so no need to worry just maintain a good academic record and the rest will be good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Awesome building and facilities at laboratory and library. Overall, a good building and a good environment. Free Wi-Fi placement for all students with secure privacy and proxy network. Everyone has their unique username and password for Wi-Fi login. The parking facility in the faculty is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: A best faculty overall. The teachers are helpful and always eager to get the best from students, providing sufficient knowledge in terms of extra knowledge. The level of exams is a little bit harder because they want to use your full potential. The coordinator and teachers are always helpful for every student.
detailed_review.Other: A best institute and a best faculty I have ever studied in. I had completed my B.Sc. from MS University as well, but my experience in M.Sc. Applied Chemistry is much better than B.Sc.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: Filled with technology and discipline.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of board exam students are placed in B.Com Course. The highest package offered is 12LPA, and the lowest package offered is 6LPA, provided in our course. Top requirements for companies like Reliance, Tata, Adani, etc. Top roles like Manager, Accountant, etc., 50% students get a placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: On our campus, they provide many facilities like a computer lab, a Physics lab, toilets, a washroom, clean classrooms, and hostel facilities. In our campus, there is a cricket ground, and many other sports facilities are provided to encourage the students.
detailed_review.Faculty: In commerce faculty, the students and all the staff members are friendly, they help students at any time students want to. In our college, the exams are very hard, so students have to prepare for 40% to pass in exam, and they will be in next year.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I want to become a Chartered Accountant. The classroom should be renewed in our college. Many events are happening in our college recently. In a few days, Navratri will happen in our college.

reviews.course: B.A. in Shastri (Jyotishshastra)
reviews.review_title: College is very average.

detailed_review.Placements: No students get direct placement from this college of MSU Baroda. No packages available for students in the Maharaja Shivajirao University of Baroda. Companies cannot visit because college do not allow them.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a basic infrastructure in the college. There is only classroom and principal's hobbies at this college, not other facilities like a Wi-Fi, labs, and library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers have a very basic knowledge of the course, and no one can be directly helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable about that teaching quality. Students are not interested in attending the regular classes because of the teachers.
detailed_review.Other: I did not have an idea about this course while choosing the course.

reviews.course: B.A. LL.B. (Hons.)
reviews.review_title: Law at MSU, academics, and after hours.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements at Faculty of Law, MSU, aren't very strong overall, but good opportunities can be secured if you've consistently worked on building your CV through internships and extracurricular activities. Many students opt for litigation by working under advocates though breaking into this field often requires strong professional connections. Recently, one of my seniors secured a placement with a package of around 4 LPA which is encouraging. Still, most students prefer preparing for government exams like judiciary or UPSC after completing their degree.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is poorly planned. During heavy rains, water often collects around campus, making it difficult to move around and affecting overall experience. Wi-Fi is available at hostels and college 24/7. Hostel fee is Rs. 10k per year, and food is average. Quality varies from hostel to hostel as contractor is different for each hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Programme is structured into 10 semesters, with exams conducted every six months. Each semester includes a 30-mark internal MCQ test and a 70-mark external theory exam. Curriculum is academically rigorous yet enriching, combining legal theory with practical application. Papers cover a broad spectrum of subjects, including Corporate Law, Arbitration, Information Technology Law, Intellectual Property Rights, Law and Social Transformation, and emerging disciplines like Gender Studies and Feminist Jurisprudence. Teaching methodology is interactive, focusing on real-world application over rote learning. Many faculty members have cleared NET and are pursuing or have completed PhDs.
detailed_review.Other: MSU offers a vibrant co-curricular scene with annual fests like Atrangi (cultural fest) and Lux et Veritas (law fest), both organized by student-led committees with month-long dedication and planning. Library facilities are excellent, most required books and journals are available in faculty library, and Hansa Mehta Library on main campus fill any remaining gaps. Annual sports events are also organized, including chess, badminton, running, and group sports. Student-run clubs like Vox Legis (magazine club) are active and engaging, while others like Moot and Eco clubs exist but are relatively less active.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com. Hons.)
reviews.review_title: MSU Baroda college is good.

detailed_review.Placements: MSU Baroda is a very good college for B.Com (honors). Subjects of this course are very helpful for further studies. Many students get high package from this college. Many managers and accountants roles are provided by Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has very good infrastructure. College has many rooms like 10 to 12 rooms, with different names. There is free Wi-Fi at the college. There are good benches and fans in the classroom.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers at this college are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. This college difficulty is medium like in the internal exams. But in the external exam difficulty is high. This college's difficulty is high because of the great placement.

reviews.course: Diploma in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's good for civil courses; they provide enough knowledge.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 40% of students were placed in our course. 1.4 Lacs is the lowest, and the average is 2 LPA, while 4 LPA is the highest package. Nirma, Larsen, Toubro, Ghadi, Kent, Alambic, Voltra, Nyra, etc., are recruiting companies for our course. Top roles offered include draftsman, site engineer, assistant engineer, surveyor, supervisor, and various other positions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for our course or department is good and includes available Wi-Fi, big classrooms, a drawing lab, a library, etc. The quality of food is good, but not that much better; there are different types of food available in our canteen. Students receive free medicine and treatment, and we have extensive grounds and facilities that include a volleyball court, basketball court, swimming pool, and gymnasium.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, well-qualified, and knowledgeable; the teaching quality is the best. The course curriculum is relevant; they prepare students for the industry, but it could be better. It is not that hard; you can pass the semester exam if you put in some amount of hard work; more than 35% is the pass percentage.
detailed_review.Other: Events and connectivity are lacking; they should organize various programs, including dance and singing activities. They are not providing any college trips, which should be offered.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: MSU review for B.Com students.

detailed_review.Placements: MSU is a very good college. I love the environment placement given in the college, the 5th or 6th sem campus interview is very helpful for placement. My college placement is average. While I didn't land my dream job, I'm optimistic about the opportunities ahead. I'll continue to develop my skills and work towards achieving my career goals.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are very far from the college, and transportation facilities are not available, so this is a little problem that you can solve by using local transport. I'm pursuing B.Com in this college, and I'm staying in the hostel. The experience is enriching, with new friends and learning opportunities. The hostel life is fun, and academics keep me engaged.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are great, and exam management is also strict. The exam is always taken on time, but there is a lack of connection with students in college, so you have to stay updated all the time on the MSU website or be connected with a faculty representative. College exams are approaching. I'm studying hard, reviewing notes and practicing questions. Staying focused and managing time effectively are key to doing well. Wish me luck.
detailed_review.Other: There is an issue with the marksheet distribution; it takes a lot of time to give out the marksheets.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: MSU is pretty and proper.

detailed_review.Placements: Well, MSU is a government college, so 80% of students around the city are here, even people from outside the city, state, and country come here to study. However, placements are not guaranteed, so we have to find internships on our own, but the degree of colleges is very well known.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The building is well-maintained. The canteen facility and food served are also good. The library is free for students. Labs are also there. If students are interested in sports, then there's a pavilion where they can enroll. Our college provides a football court, a badminton court, a swimming pool, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are actually helpful. If we prepare well, we can actually pass it easily, but the gaps between internal and external exams are not so reliable. There should be at least a 45-day gap between them, but they only provide around 20 days, which needs to be fixed.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course as I'm interested in business studies. The theoretical knowledge is good, but the practical part should be improved. Events are held every month, so we won't get bored. The campus crowd is also okay. Scholarships are also provided according to criteria.

reviews.course: B.A. (Hons.) in Economics
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with faculty members. Good infrastructure and course curriculum.

detailed_review.Placements: The training and placement cell is good in the department. Top recruiting company that came last year for hiring was HDFC Bank. The course curriculum is structured in such a way that our batch is according to the new education policy. Everyone has to get an internship in the 3rd year of college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities provided by the department are good. The classes are spacious and it also provides a library. Facilities provided in the hostel in just above average. Mess and canteen provide food at a very minimal rate. The sports and games section is the best at this college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is structured in such a good way that everyone feels like learning something new every day. Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. They do help students. The difficulty level of the exams is not too hard to pass. The course curriculum is much relevant and it does make a student industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because it gives so much insight into various subjects like banking, financial markets, international trade, and many more. The department does organise sports days and celebrates other festivals.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: Well-equipped campus, supportive faculty, and industry-relevant curriculum with decent placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Somewhere around 70%-80% of students got placed. The highest package is 10 LPA, the lowest package is 3.5 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA-4.5 LPA. Companies including Tech Mahindra, Kotak Mahindra, and Deloitte visit for recruitment. Around 80% of students got internships in companies like ONGC, Adani, and SBI. Roles include accountant, auditor, financial analyst, and tax consultant.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: MSU has a well-rounded academic environment with a strong infrastructure and comprehensive hostel accommodation. Mess food is overall okay as there have been some complaints regarding the quality of food. Vibrant sports and cultural activities along with reliable health care facilities are available.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are excellent and qualified teaching staff. The course curriculum is relevant and practical aligning professional and academic pathways. Fairly rigorous as the pass rate is around 60%-70% requiring consistent efforts. The curriculum makes the students industry-ready due to its strong syllabus and practical exposure.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: I am moderately satisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are sometimes good and sometimes not, depending on the field you are in. If you are in BBA, you will get more placements compared to B.Com, as B.Com is not considered a highly valuable degree in India. Therefore, the number of placements after B.Com is very low.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College infrastructure is good but not excellent. It is known for its ancient campus theme; it looks good initially, but over time it becomes boring. In contrast, Parul and Navrachna have excellent campuses, and although MSU's campus is very peaceful, I love the greenery.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good, especially during exams when the management is top-notch. The teachers are also friendly and supportive. Occasionally, problems arise, but that's common in every university. Despite MSU having the highest number of students, it manages everything very well, which is truly impressive.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Architecture (B.Arch.)
reviews.review_title: Good placement due to very old and famous college.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year students get admission with high merit. About 50 to 60 students are placed in this course but the competition among the students is strong. After this course, you can get a license and start a firm and also work as an architect in any firm.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is also not well good and it is a too old building. The hostel campus is nice and big also the canteen is good. In the girl's hostel, there are two canteens and a hall with different names.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members teach with experience of more than 15 years but I feel like they only teach during working hours after that they don't help us. The teaching quality is good but if u can study on your own then this college is nice otherwise the students can't survive in this college. The course is well distributed for every teacher but the timetable of course is tough. We have to travel from one college to another college for a lecture like the subjects of architecture are taken in our department but other civil subjects are taken in another college.
detailed_review.Other: If you like to explore yourself then this course is nice. The event called reflection in this college is very famous and students get to learn so many things from this event you can make contacts with big firms and architects. Also, this college feels is only 10000 per year.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: The university is good, but needs to work on management.

detailed_review.Placements: The batch contains over 80% of students from around the area. As it's a government college, it doesn't provide any internships or job packages, for that, one has to find them themselves. I can't say about roles in my course as if you want any internship, you have to do side courses like CA, Tally, computing, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: I can't say much about hostels as I don't live there, but as per my friend who lives there, she has stated that hostels for girls are safe and good. There are computer labs for students on campus. As for the library, it's free for students, so overall facilities are good.
detailed_review.Faculty: About exam management, actually, you don't get much time to prepare. Students should have at least 45 days between external and internal exams, but they only give around 20 days for that. Study materials are also provided late, so these are inconvenient things about the college.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: It is the best college for a better future opportunity.

detailed_review.Placements: The college provides very high placement and it includes mutli national company so any people can get easily job and faster growth than other university and there are fix campus in year some industry like Tata remains to come in a campus can give a job to MSU Baroda boasts a strong placement record with a significant portion of students securing job opportunities in various sectors. The university career and counselling cell actively supports students with placement activities, including organizing campus drives and offering guidance. Top recruiters include TCS Teach Mahindra ICICI Prudential Life Insurance and QX Global Group.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My course is B.Com and the fee of the college is very low and any one can afford it and university can give a scoler ship to help the students the hostel of university is 2 girl hostel and boys hostel so the comfort is high and also safe Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda (MSU) offers a large hostel campus in Vadodara, with 12 boys' hostels and 4 girls' hostels. The hostels often referred to as halls, are situated in a central location near the city's railway and bus station, as well as local amenities like malls.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college has amazing and skilled faculty for the 4 exams. In a sem test used to assess a person's knowledge skills or abilities. It measures a test-taker's understanding or aptitude in a specific subject or area. Exams are designed to evaluate a person's capabilities and are often used for educational assessment or to obtain qualifications.
detailed_review.Other: The area of university is very big.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: It provides good education at a low cost.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, 40% of students get a job from our campus placements. Infosys, Tata, and some banks like BOB, SBI Bank, Punjab Bank, etc., visit our college. Every year our college invites new companies. The highest package is 5 LPA, and the lowest package is 1.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is very good. We have a ground for football and cricket. Our college offers sports facilities for those who are national and state-level players. Wi-Fi is also available for free for all students. The canteen is also cheap and good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and polite to every student. If students come regularly, then they don't want any other extra classes to pass or score well in exams. The course is low, and exams are sometimes difficult. If we study well, then we will score well in our exams. It has staff members 24 hours.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: Good facility and students come here.

detailed_review.Placements: The course gives so much companies to offer and gives us upto 24,000 plus salaries placed job. So, this course gives maximum number of students employment and gives companies their employees easily, and we want this type of course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms were air-conditioned and lecturers were so intelligent. It provided best furniture tables for studies and pamphlet facilities near to canteen. There were xerox machines and cafes. Mess of the college was so good. Hostel was so comfortable and easy for outsiders and they stayed properly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were so knowledgeable. They solve all the problems of students. They give more than wanted knowledge. They help and also give importance to exams, and arrange the examination center that helps with ongoing exams. They also help the outside students so they come easily.
detailed_review.Other: Campus crowd was so good. All good families and students were there. This course offered so much knowledge and good salaries in companies that's why all students want to do this course. More than 6,000 students were studying this course at this college.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Education (B.Ed.)
reviews.review_title: I am not dissatisfied, but it was a good experience.

detailed_review.Placements:
50% of students were placed. The lowest salary offered is Rs. 10,000 per month. The highest salary offered is Rs. 30,000 per month. Amrit Vidhyalay and Nalanda Vidhyalaya are the highest-paying schools. 100% of students got internships in more than 10+ schools in Vadodara. 
Roles offered are facilitators, as a social worker, a learner, a caretaker, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are two buildings for the B.Ed course. One is old and the second is new. The new one is in good condition, and the washrooms are clean but the old one is quite dirty and needs renovation. Water tank is broken and the washrooms are dirty in the old building. I didn't enroll for the hostel so I don't have any content for hostel review.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are amazing! They genuinely care, and are super knowledgeable persons. They teach valuable life lessons beyond academics. The curriculum is relevant and well-structured, covering everything we need to know. Semester exams are balanced. Not too tough or easy, testing our understanding without excessive pressure. Passing marks at 35% seems fair, ensuring we learn without being overwhelmed. The system feels well-balanced, and I'm grateful for our teachers' hard work and dedication. They go above and beyond to help us understand and grow, making them truly the best. Their effort and care make a real difference.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to be a teacher so I chose this course. All the things are good. Events are always planned atlast moment. Also, the certificate of the Sports Day is not given to us. Extracurricular activities are held every Wednesday, except exam time. Scholarships are given. Fees are nominal and one can afford it.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Commerce (B.Com.)
reviews.review_title: I'm satisfied. It is the best, one could get for lower fees.

detailed_review.Placements: Over 60% of students have been placed recently with the lowest package of 3 LPA, the highest package of 9 LPA, and the average package of 4.5 LPA. The top recruiters are TCS, Tech Mahindra, ICICI Prudential Life Insurance, QX Global Group, and Kotak Mahindra Bank. Around 58% of students got internships. Top roles include tax auditor, corporate treasurer, financial planner, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: B.Com has 4 buildings main building, general building, girls building, and padra building. Facilities include Wi-Fi, library, canteen, hospital, and a pavilion for sports. Everything is good, I'll say above average if not the best. Good opportunities for sports enthusiasts.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very helpful and qualified. The course includes a detailed curriculum with many interesting topics that help to be industry-ready. The exams aren't that difficult, you can pass if you study a week before. The passing percentage is 36%.
detailed_review.Other: Multiple events are happening across campus, but the events of faculty of commerce, especially B.Com are organized by student leaders and doesn't hold much charm, but worth watching once. The management can improve delays in admission and results for first year, it gets better in second year.

reviews.course: B.E. in Textile Technology
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the alumni and binding of the college with companies.

detailed_review.Placements: There is 100% placement in our course. All you need to just follow the education system. The highest is 8-12 LPA which is offered in the textile branch, the lowest package is 3.5 LPA, and the average is 5 LPA. In other branches varies maximum package of college is 24 LPA in CSE and metallurgy branch Companies like Adani, Aditya Birla, Reliance, and Arvind Raymond came here for placement for internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is well. It needs to improve because it is 150 + years old college the biggest hostel campus in West Gujarat, you will easily get the seats just by communicating. There is a mess and canteen facility We have a big university ground where we have a gym, swimming pool, volleyball, badminton, basketball, tennis, hockey, kho, kabaddi, handball, cricket, football courts and ground and a big running track. The university has its own it's health center near the hostel, free of cost. There is a girls' hostel with full safety. There are library facilities too.
detailed_review.Faculty: The college has qualified teachers. They are from IIT and IIMS with experience. The curriculum makes students ready for the industrial and external world, just make participation in your field. Exams are that much harder as it is needed and necessary, what teachers teach and need they ask in the examinations.
detailed_review.Other: There are so many clubs here, and functions. You just come and explore. If you are willing to take admission to Baroda. Keep learning and exploring.

admission.title: MSU Baroda Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: MSU Baroda admission 2025 is both merit and entrance-based. The university offers various courses to candidates at the UG and PG levels. These include- BBA, BCom, MPharma, MPT, MD, etc. The university also offers courses at the Diploma level. All these courses are offered across its 21 institutes. Candidates can visit the official website of the MSU Baroda to apply for any of the courses. Admissions to all the courses are conducted through an online mode.

faqs.answer: The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda accept JEE score for admission to B.Tech and B.Pharma. The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda is a good rated college. There are seventeen courses under B.Tech program at The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda. faqs.question: Which entrance exam scores does MSU Baroda accept for admission to MBA?
faqs.answer: MSU Baroda accepts scores from Common Management Admission Test (CMAT) and Common Admission Test (CAT) for admission to MBA programs. The cut-off trend for CMAT percentile is 80-90, which is a score of 150 or higher. Please note that the eligibility criteria for admission to MSU Baroda’s MBA programme is a minimum of 50% aggregate in undergraduate exams or equivalent from a recognised university with relevant subjects. For selection to a regular MBA, candidates will also be required to undergo the ACPC counseling process. The Best I can suggest is always keep yourself updated by visiting university site.

faqs.question: How many students can do B.Tech at MSU Baroda?
faqs.answer: MSU Baroda offers B.Tech courses under a wide range of specializations. There are a total of 17 specializations under B.Tech, each having a different seat intake. The total annual intake for B.Tech at MSU Baroda is 570 seats, comprising of all seventeen courses. There are multiple branch availability like Civil Eng, Chemical Eng, Trasnport Eng, Computer Eng etc. Special courses like Textile Engineering or technology branches are also available.

faqs.question: Does MSU Baroda offer scholarships?
faqs.answer: Yes, the University offers several merit and need-based scholarships to deserving students. One of the popular scholarships offered by MSU Baroda is DSW Scholarship. The main objectives of the Directorate are to coordinate different activities of Sports, Literary, Cultural, Moral Education, and Placement and Counselling and so on. The objective of this financial assistance is to guarantee the welfare of student community. It will work as a bridge between students and the administration of The Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara. The responsibility of the Directorate is to guide and give assistance to students to overcome their problems and on the other hand not to compromise on the Rules and Regulations of the Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara. This scholarship will help student’s whose family’s financial condition is such that the total household income (including income of all family members living jointly in the same house) does not exceed a sum of INR 3.5 lakh. Apart from this, the aspirant has secured at least 50% aggregate in the last qualification as per course requirement.

faqs.question: What is the MSU Baroda Gujarat NEET PG cutoff?
faqs.answer: The MSU Baroda Gujarat NEET PG Cutoff was released for admission to the MD and MS course for all categories and rounds for the HS and AI quota. For the General category candidates under the Home State quota, the cutoff in the last round ranged from 146 to 52239 , wherein MD in Radio Diagnosis was the toughest MD specialisation, and the easiest specialisation was MD in Bio-Chemistry.

faqs.question: What is the MSU Baroda NATA cutoff?
faqs.answer: The MSU Baroda NATA Cutoff was released for admission to the BArch course. The NATA Cutoff 2024 was 31005 for the General category candidates under the All India quota. For the Gender candidates in the Home State quota, the BArch cutoff 2024 was 11076 . For the OBC AI candidates, students faced a last round cutoff of 31402, and for the OBC HS students, the last round cutoff was 11233 . For more information, students can click here .

faqs.question: What is the MSU Baroda Gujarat NEET Cutoff?
faqs.answer: The MSU Baroda Gujarat NEET Cutoff is released for admission to the MBBS course at Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda. The University accepts the NEET Cutoff rank, followed by Gujarat NEET counselling process for admission to the Bachelor of Medicine and Bachelor of Surgery programme. The responsibility of the Directorate is to guide and give assistance to students to overcome their problems and on the other hand not to compromise on the Rules and Regulations of the Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda, Vadodara. This scholarship will help student’s whose family’s financial condition is such that the total household income (including income of all family members living jointly in the same house) does not exceed a sum of INR 3.5 lakh. Apart from this, the aspirant has secured at least 50% aggregate in the last qualification as per course requirement. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

ranking_section.title: MSU BarodaNIRF Ranking 2025
ranking_section.description: Over the years, MSU Baroda has earned commendable rankings across different domains in the NIRF 2025. This signifies the institution's esteemed reputation and proficiency in various aspects, assigning it an overall good score. It can be seen that the MSU Baroda's rankings in 'Engineering' category have displayed a fluctuating trend as per the ranks of the previous years. In 2025, MSU Baroda's rank is #201 , the same as last year's rank in the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF ranking. The rankin Over the years, MSU Baroda has earned commendable rankings across different domains in the NIRF 2025. This signifies the institution's esteemed reputation and proficiency in various aspects, assigning it an overall good score. It can be seen that the MSU Baroda's rankings in 'Engineering' category have displayed a fluctuating trend as per the ranks of the previous years. In 2025, MSU Baroda's rank is #201 , the same as last year's rank in the 'Engineering' category by the NIRF ranking. The rankings of the institute in the 'Pharmacy' category have demonstrated a decreasing trend when compared to last year's rankings. In 2025, MSU Baroda fell 2 ranks to #46 rank in the 'Pharmacy' category by the NIRF ranking. This is the second consecutive year that the institute has slipped in the rankings. The rankings of the institute in the 'State Public University' category have displayed a stable trend when evaluated against previous year's ranking. In 2025, MSU Baroda's rank is #51 , the same as last year's rank in the 'State Public University' category by the NIRF ranking. Explore the MSU Baroda latest rankings by other ranking bodies and their categories below: According to the NIRF ranking 2025, MSU Baroda received #201-300 rank in the 'Engineering' category. It holds a comparable status to the most prestigious universities such as Aditya University, and Ajeenkya DY Patil University for NIRF rankings under the 'Engineering' category. facilities.description: The library at Maharaja Sayajirao University of Baroda is known as Smt. Hansa Mehta Library.It has a single largest Reading Room of 10,600 sq. ft. which can accommodate about 1100 readers at a time.Library subscribes to more than 512 journals.The library has over 8 Lakh books/ periodicals and above 1300 dissertations/thesis.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The University has 12 boys and 4 girls hostels.All the students residing in the hostels are provided with minimum facilities like a bed, a cupboard, a table and a chair in the room individually. All the hostels are equipped with automatic gas fired hot water boilers facility, which provides hot water during the winter season. Hostels are also equipped with a dining hall and a common hall.

college_info.college_name: University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University was founded in 2005. It is a public institute and is located in Rohtak, Haryana. University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University courses are offered to students at the UG and PG levels. The institute is approved by AICTE and offers courses in Full Time mode. University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University offers a total of 19 courses in stream such as Engineering. Some of the popular courses offered at the institute are B.E. / B.Tech and M.E./M.Tech and the total seat intake for the available courses is 750. These courses are offered to students across several specialisations such as Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Biotechnology Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering and Electrical Engineering. Further, the fee for all these courses ranges between INR 12,688 to 2,66,200 and the average median salary is around INR 7,67,059. Apart from this, the University Institute of Engineering and Technology, Maharshi Dayanand University campus has a state-of-the-art infrastructure with all the advanced facilities.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Computer Science Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college is overall good.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 50% of students get placed through the placement cell and others through off-campus placement drives. The highest package offered is 28 LPA by Google and the average package is 3-4 LPA. Top recruiting companies like Josh, Virpo, and Infosys. Students get internships in Infosys or Deloitte companies. Top roles offered are Data Analytics, AI Engineer, and Web Developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Personal guidance is provided to students by teachers, and regarding infrastructure, it might be the best thing I liked about my college. Classrooms are well cleaned and tidy, with digital projectors available. The library has a lot of space for students and also has various guidebooks. The hostels are good not that much good, but I can say the food provided in the canteen or mess is delicious. There is also a medical center available just outside the hostel department. There are various games available for students to participate and play at the national level.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful to the students; if any student does not get their point during teaching, they can also ask them in their staff room. They are well graduated. Some of the teachers are Ph.D. holders. The course builds the students ready for jobs and helps them gain experience in our surroundings. The semester exams are not that difficult. The exam pattern is divided into four sections, and each question consists of 15 marks, totaling 75 marks. The passing percentage is 30%.
detailed_review.Other: I like to explore in the AI field. Also, I'm from a teaching family background. Fests are likely to happen two times within a month. The availability of students in fests or events is in large numbers.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure, but a little less satisfied with placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are decent, and many known companies visit the campus. The placement cell is very friendly. Many students remain unemployed because they often reappear, except for 10-12 students who are toppers. I suggest the last year's sample ppr.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very beautiful, and the classrooms are large. Hostel rooms are big enough for 2 students, and the washrooms are cleaned daily. Hostels are big and nice, and the mess food is delicious in the girls' hostel. Girls' hostel closing times are 8 pm in summer and 7 pm in winter.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are so nice to students, except for some teachers. The curriculum is perfect, and they gave enough time to study for exams. I am satisfied with the preparatory holidays they give and the time for submission of the assignment. Faculty is understanding of students.
detailed_review.Other: The campus is so beautiful, and there is so much greenery there. For entertainment, many fests are organised by the university itself.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is an average college and not value for money. The food is bad and placements are a little fine.

detailed_review.Placements: A very low amount of students get placed by the university. There are very less amount of students get internships or placements from the university, so we need to do work on our own. We should also get internships on our own. Mostly, small companies visit the college, but this university is improving. If we want we can try for it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is not working properly. The food is not that good and clean. The hostel is fine. Medical facilities are good. Sports are good. There is not that fair competition in games. It has very large playgrounds. It also has a swimming pool and gym. Overall, this college is not good. The mess food is bad. It does not give fruit to students. The library is so good, big, and comfortable place to study.
detailed_review.Faculty: Exam papers are slightly tough and subjects are interesting. There are no good teachers. They give real education. Teachers are bad and they do not take classes properly. They are not making us study in an interesting manner. Overall, it is a below-average college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is very big and students get change.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately all the students in our college get placed. Many big companies come to our college to take students. Students from 7th semester are eligible to sit for placements. This year, the highest package offered in our college was 2.4 crores, and approximately 1,700 students got placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are also good. We get electricity, hot and cold water, free Wi-Fi everywhere on the campus. We have guest houses for accommodation of parents or any relatives, it is paid and should be booked, food quality in mess is good, but not good like all.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty-to-student ratio is good, the faculty are very friendly, and they clarify each and every doubt of students. My favourite professors are Nirjhar Hang Sir and Amit Shaw Sir. Their explanation during the class is really awesome, and they are friendly with all the students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Staff are very well educated.

detailed_review.Placements: In last year, which is 4th year, students start practicing internship, and later on they get placed in well-to-do companies. There are many companies that visit our campus, like Infosys, Amazon, Google, Microsoft, etc. And they place a number of offers. I will talk about my branch, which is CSE. The highest package offered was 55 Lacs. There are about 90-93% of students getting in campus placements. My plans after the degree are to get placed in a good company and later do some business.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very nice. They offer help to every student possible. The faculty-to-student ratio is around 1:150. But there are tutorial classes as well where students can ask as many doubts as they can, and the ratio is 1:25. Overall, it's very easy to communicate. To be honest, till now every faculty I have met is amazing, sweet, generous, and very educated. There are many exams, mainly MSTs, tests, and sessional. Sessionals are comparatively easy, but MST and EST are tough. Majority of the students pass the exams, and very few get stuck. Curriculum mostly gets changed every year to match what's going on in upcoming years. There are very useful sessions that not only help us in academics but also in daily problems. Exams take place frequently here. Timings are 2 hours for MST,  3 hours for EST, and 15 minutes for sessional. The difficulty level is moderate.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am totally dissatisfied with the placement of this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are not very high, as 40% to 50% of students get placed. The highest package is around 3 Lakhs to 4 Lakhs, and the average is 2.5 Lakhs. Top companies that visit the campus include Wipro, Tata, and Amazon. It is difficult for mechanical students to get placed, and only CSE branch students can expect placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this college is very nice. There is a central library, which is very big, and the labs are well-equipped. However, the classrooms are not so good. If we talk about hostel life, it is amazing. The hostel is affordable and reliable, and the mess food is also good. The variety in the mess food is decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: When we talk about the faculty, some faculty members are nice to us as they are well-disciplined and helpful, but some faculty members are rude and indifferent to students. The course curriculum is relevant, but a little more effort is necessary. Semester exams are easy to moderate.
detailed_review.Other: Events and fests are held in University there's so much crowd in fests .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Faculty of my college is good enough for this course.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement begins from 7th semester. Companies like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and Cognizant visit regularly. The highest package was up to 10 LPA, and the average packages were about 3-5 LPA. Roles offered include developer, analyst, and support engineer. About 70 to 75% students get placed. A plan to work in tech industries, gain experience, and later pursue higher studies or specialisation certification.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The curriculum stitching method and the examination structures are very good at this college. The curriculum covers overall essential subjects like C programming, algorithms, operating systems, computer networks, and DBMS, which are core in the field of Computer Science. It also includes Java.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty-to-student ratio is about 1:6, and the faculty members are so friendly and easy to ask anything. I like the faculty members of my college, whom is Shikha Singh and Kiran sir, because they are very good teachers and make everything easier for students. There are four types of exams in one semester, first is mid-semester exam, second is internal-practical, 3rd one is theory exams, and the last one is external practical and Viva. The theory exam is based on G-scheme.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life at my college is lively with fests like TakeSurge and Ecstasy. The reason why I chose this course was that it offers a balanced opportunity between theory and practical knowledge.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Firstly, the infrastructure of Janak Puri campus is outstanding.

detailed_review.Placements: By the 7th semester, the students will be eligible for the campus placement. Companies like Wipro, TCS, Hike, ZopSmart, etc., visited and made almost 10-20% offers in total. Highest package for the last year was 14 LPA. Around 50% students have been placed till now this year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is very supportive and knowledgeable. My course is 4 years and has 8 semesters, whereas the first and second semesters don't have many tech-related subjects. In 1st semester, only C programming was taught, and in second semester, C++ was taught, and in 3rd sem, DSA and other tech subjects came. If we talk about marking scheme, 25 marks are internal, which includes attendance, internal exam, and practical marks, and 75 marks of the final exam (external exam). Syllabus covers core concepts and specialized subjects as well. Theoretical aspects were well-structured, but practical exposure was somewhat limited. I think more internships and industry collaborations could make the curriculum more impactful.
detailed_review.Other: Fest of our college is always amazing, and other events are also there like Diwali fest, Holi fest, and dandiya nights. I opted for this course because of its strong theoretical foundation and relevance in Computer Science field, and I have a strong interest in Computer Science.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Why I chose this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Maharshi Dayanand University offers campus placement with a dedicated career counselling and placement cell, facilitating placement activities. Reports indicate modern placement rates across various courses, including MBA, B.Tech, and BCA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Maharshi Dayanand University provides a good hostel facility. Hostels in Maharshi Dayanand University are divided into courses and senior and junior. Many of the hostels have single rooms, but for freshers, they may be sharing a room with other students, having one room with one bed, one table, one chair, and one fan.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the faculty in Maharshi Dayanand University, Ajmer are good, but what I like the most is UIET case. I am a student of UIET, which is the biggest faculty in Maharshi Dayanand University, and the faculty of marks is also good. Exam at Marathi Dayanand University is not so difficult, it is average.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Teaching staff is very friendly and supportive here.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is not that good. Companies visit college for interviews. But only a few students get selected. You have to prepare yourself very well for interviews. Some students also got good placements. But percentage of getting placement from college is only 30-40%.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is very good and friendly. Exams are conducted every 6 months. Exam levels differ from subject to subject. Checking of exams is a bit strict because exams are checked in MDU. So many students also reappear in many subjects. Library timings are same as college timings, which is 4 pm. There is a subject named IOT for students, which is very helpful. We make projects in IOT, which helps us to learn about so many new things. Exams are not very difficult overall, we can say exams are moderate. You will also get a concession in your 1st semester fee according to your 12th marks.
detailed_review.Other: Campus life is very good here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I liked the playground area of the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Students become eligible for placement after 5th semester. Placement is provided by college. Top recruits include TCS, Amazon, HCL, and Tisco. They visit college campuses for recruitment. Highest package cracked in college is 30 LPA, average is 7 LPA, and lowest is 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Faculty: Course curriculum is very good as the college follows new education policy. Faculty members in the college are not very highly trained, and they are not very professional. They only know their syllabus. There are three exams in a semester, the first one is sessional 1,  second is sessional 2, and third is final semester exam.
detailed_review.Other: There are several fests held in college. I had chosen this course because I love tech and I want to become a cybersecurity analyst.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life inside the campus.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are pretty good, but that is mostly for Computer Science. We have a few campuses, nonetheless, we are satisfied with the efforts put in by the placement coordinator, but I chose something different and started my journey for civil services. I did my civil engineering from here.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities provided in the hostel are pretty good. The room is good and huge, which I used to share with one of my friends. During winters, we used to get hot water accessibility, and the meal was also good, decided by all hostelers, and we used to get food.
detailed_review.Faculty: I cannot remember the student to faculty ratio, but with certain speculation, I can say it is pretty good. I liked the teaching of our surveying faculty, mr Ravinder Faldakoti sir. There used to be 2 semester exams, and 4 mid sessional exams are conducted in our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college provides a disciplined and academically focused environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college students usually become eligible for campus placements from the 5th semester onwards. That is when the placement cell starts shortlisting students, arranging pre-placement talks, and preparing us for interviews with mock tests and resume-building sessions. Some companies that visited our campus recently are Wipro, TCS, and HDFC Bank. The highest package offered in the last placement season was around 8 LPA.
detailed_review.Faculty: Honesty, the faculty-to-student ratio in our college is quite decent. Classes are not overcrowded. We usually have one internal and one final exam every semester. Plus, there are small tests or assignments in between. The fee is too high, and I felt the overall cost of living and studying there was not affordable for me and my family. There are occasional quizzes, but some subjects, like Business Law or Economics, can be a bit tricky if we do not prepare well.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I liked that it covered a wide range of subjects from business management, marketing, finance, HR, and entrepreneurship. It organises sports fest in March-April, Diwali fest in November and Star Night in April.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This course is very relevant to my personal and professional growth.

detailed_review.Placements: Students of the final year are eligible for placements in their respective departments. Basically, many companies visit the college from surrounding areas like Wipro, Infosys, etc. At least 50 companies visit my college. The highest package offered in placements is 22 LPA by Google.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty-to-student ratio is 1:10. Faculty members are very frank and caring towards students. We can approach the faculty members at their desks any time. I like Gundeep Tanwar Sir the most, who is the HOD of my department. He is a person with a very different and dashing personality. I would rate the course curriculum as very good in terms of relevance and comprehensiveness. The course curriculum has prepared me well for real-world applications.
detailed_review.Other: One of the key reasons I chose the B.Tech in computer science program is the inclusion of core subjects like data science, algorithms, OS, etc. My overall experience with campus life has been amazing.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Facilities are amazing across the college.

detailed_review.Placements: The average package offered in the college is 4 LPA, which is decent for such a large crowd. From the 7th semester, students are eligible for placements. Many renowned companies visit the college for placements. Last year, the highest package offered was 10 LPA. I am trying to explore my options as of now, but I will be pursuing an MBA.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty members are really nice and helpful if we approach them. The faculty-to-student ratio is 1:10. I am in the first year, so I won't be able to tell which faculty is best, but till now my experience has been good. Exams are easy to clear. Even if we study sincerely one day before the exam, we will do well. But some students fail to clear the exams due to irregularity and lenient behavior.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the computer science course because I enjoy coding and learning about tech, and I aspire to run a business, which pretty much explains my choice towards this branch. Another reason is that I went through the curriculum and found out most subjects are new and will help me move further.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has a great infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies start coming from the 6th semester onwards and take a few good students with them for internships. They also get a PPO if their performance remains good in the company. The actual placement starts from the 7th semester onwards. Some very good companies came like Apple, Robrix, Microsoft, JP Morgan Chase, etc. The highest package offered is 55 LPA. The average package offered is 9 LPA in the computer science course.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty-to-student ratio is decent. There is one faculty for an average of 60 students. Maninder mam was the best faculty. She taught us C+ language in 1st year. PS Rana sir was also very good. He taught us Python and Machine Learning during summer vacation. Sometimes it got tough to get attention from the faculty members, as there were a lot of students (around 1,000) in the computer science branch alone. It also impacted the placements quite a bit. I think the course is a bit outdated. There is no point in including subjects like Chemistry, metallurgy, environmental studies, etc. Instead of adding more courses, I opted for (in my case, computer science) subjects like system design, UI design, design patterns, etc., which would have been much better.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Labs and practical are good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement begins from the 7th semester. Companies like TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and Cognizant visit regularly. The highest package is up to 10 LPA, and the average packages are about 3 LPA - 5 LPA. Roles offered include developer, analyst, and support engineer. About 70 to 75% of students get placed. A plan to work in tech industries, gain experience, and later pursue higher studies or specialisation certification.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty-to-student ratio is about 1:6. Faculty members are so friendly and easy to ask anything. I like the faculty members of my college like Shikha Singh and other is Kiran sir because they are very good teachers and make everything easier for students. There are four types of exams in one semester, first is mid semester exam, second is internal practical, 3rd one is theory exams. The last one is external practical and viva. The curriculum stitching method and the examination structures are very good at this college. The curriculum covers overall essential subjects like C programming, algorithms, operating system, computer network, and DBMS which are core in the field of computer science.
detailed_review.Other: The reason why I chose this course is that it offers a balanced opportunity same's between theory and practical knowledge. It also includes Java, C+, and Python which are useful for real-word programming.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My campus is surrounded by beautiful scenery.

detailed_review.Placements: Some student branches do get placed through campus drives mostly in startup companies. The highest package usually goes to a student with strong skills and internships but on average, the package is around 3 LPA - 5 LPA. Placement cell is active and does bring in companies for recruitment. But it also depends on your skills and effort. College also offers soft skill training and placement preparation sessions which are helpful. For branches like mechanical and civil placements are limited, and many to choose from government exam off-campus jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: My campus is surrounded by beautiful Aravali hills which enhance its beauty. There are many places to hangout.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty ratio is 1:10. Faculty members are very frank and caring towards the students. We can approach the faculty members at their cabinets any time. I like Gundeep Tanwar sir the most who is the HOD of my department, he is a person with a very different and dashing personality. I would rate the course curriculum as very good in terms of relevance and comprehensiveness. One of the key reasons I chose this B.Tech computer science program is that the inclusion of core subjects like data science, algorithms, OS, DBMS, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Hostel life is a challenge and fun.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is also good in our college. Many companies have visited colleges like TCS and early Microsoft, Mahindra mode. The 300 companies have visited the college on campus, and placements are also available in college from 3rd year students who are making a project for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus has to block the names Himalaya block and Pamir block. There are two departments for students of different years, a student and a sunblock. There is admin office for some basic fees or to take admission, and exception. There are two hostels for boys and girls, and a cafeteria and canteen for different fast food, coffee, and many fruits.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members of our college are too good at teaching, they do not make a difference between any student and solve our doubts completely. Now I have some subjects like programming for Data Science and AIML aptitude classes to be ready for GATE exams and spoken English.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Placement that shapes careers.

detailed_review.Placements: There is not very good campus placement. Some companies like Daffodils provide campus placements. There is not a large crowd of students, so the placement opportunities are limited. However, some students crack placements and got offers with approximately 6 LPA. Many apply off-campus and secure good, high-paying jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facility is very good here, and mess facilities are good too. There is a hostel for both boys and girls, one hostel for boys and 10 hostels for girls. So, there is no problem in accommodation for those students who come from other states and other places.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are some teachers who are too good at teaching and punctual, always taking care of students and their studies, always taking classes with a proper marking scheme and exam. But some teachers are not so good, never take classes properly, and are so rude. The relation between faculty members and students is average.

faqs.question: What is UIET, Maharshi Dayanand University HSTES Cutoff?
faqs.answer: UIET, Maharshi Dayanand University HSTES cutoff 2025 was released for the first round. The cutoff was released for admission to BTech specialisations, for different categories belonging to the All India and Home State quota. Among the General Home State category candidates, the closing ranks in round 1 was ranged between 123405 and 349382 . Among the OBC Home State category candidates, the closing ranks varied between 175729 and 806027 . Among the EWS Home State category, the cutoff ranks varied between 143437 and 750163 . For candidates belonging to the General All India category, the closing ranks varied between 165563 and 649370 . faqs.answer: The Haryana State Technical Education Society released the HSTES counselling schedule on the website, techadmissionshry.gov.in. HSTES 2025 counselling was held in two rounds, namely Round 1 and Round 2.

faqs.question: What is the cutoff of OBC category students for admission to UIET Rohtak?
faqs.answer: UIET Rohtak has released the round 1 of cutoff list. The cutoff has been released for different categories of candidates belonging to AI and HS quota. For candidates belonging to the OBC Home State category, the cutoff ranks varied between 175729 and 806027 . The cutoff among the OBC AI category was released for various BTech specialisations, out of which BTech in Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning was the most difficult specialisation to get admission into. For candidates belonging to the OBC All India quora, the range of cutoff was between 196218 and 943674 . Among the candidates belonging to the OBC AI category, the most difficult specialisation to get admission was BTech in CSE.

college_info.college_name: Cummins College: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Established in 1991, Cummins College of Engineering for Women, Pune is a private institute in Pune, Maharashtra. Also known as Cummins College, the institute is approved by the AICTE. At the UG and PG levels, the institute offers 13 courses across 6 specialisations in Full Time mode. The popular Cummins College programs include B.E. / B.Tech and M.E./M.Tech. Cummins College courses are provided in several streams including Engineering, etc. The institute has a total seat intake of 768 students. The fees at Cummins College ranges between INR 1,61,740 and 5,77,388 for the different courses. Cummins College placements are vibrant, with the average median salary standing at around INR 8,08,333. The institute has a well-laid infrastructure with multiple facilities.
