reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Super campus life with full of enjoyable events.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college training and placements block, there is a block where we get knowledge on the written test of the companies, and Rs. 15,000 is paid for the training and placements. Companies like Cognizant, Infosys, and HCL Tech come to our college. In our college, 40 percent of the students are placed, and the rest of the students are searching for jobs, and some have gone on to higher studies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is average, and classrooms are well-equipped, and Wi-fi is provided throughout the campus. We can use the Wi-Fi, and libraries are also well-equipped, but the maintenance of the classrooms and labs is average, not up to the mark. The environment of the college is very good with greenery. Besides our college, Arundhati Institute is there, where we can get all the medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum of our course is not up to date as many of the courses are not relevant and are not in the system or industry. Exams in the college are held three times, that is, mid-1, mid-2, and semester. Faculty of our course is not bad, like some are very knowledgeable and some faculty do not have knowledge, but they try to explain something to us by studying.
detailed_review.Other: Campus is worth it for the students for all of college life, enjoyment, and the environment between the college and the students. But coming to the academics, it is somewhat like a downgrade. But the faculty help us by giving a lead code, sessions, workshops, etc. Like events are going on in the college every month, two events are compulsory in the college, so we can enjoy ourselves. Overall, the campus is very beautiful, and academics are somewhat low, placements are very high, and they train us very well. Coming to the extracurricular activities, they are well encouraged.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Average tier 2 college, we can't expect everyone to be fun and knowledgeable it's a mid college.

detailed_review.Placements: The average salary is 4 LPA so we can't expect much from college. They take us through placement training but that won't be of any help for sure. We come to this college just to do time pass but we can improve our skills by joining clubs and stuff.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: It's pretty decent not too high nor too low but it's decent. For what we are paying, it's a little low. But the infrastructure is not that bad when compared to the management and faculty. This college portrays itself as the best while it's not in real.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some of them don't even know what they are teaching but they come to teach us. Teachers will be strict. Attendance and condonation are strictly maintained. But even after attending classes and all we won't learn anything at all because they won't know in the first place.
detailed_review.Other: It depends on what we choose actually but we must try for off-campus jobs because the campus placements offer only few range of jobs very few actually.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with college environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in college are excellent for the ongoing batch. The highest package is about 8 LPA - 10 LPA, where the lowest package is about 2.5 LPA - 3 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Cognizant, HCL Tech, Infosys, Capgemini, etc. Almost 70 percent of the students are placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities and infrastructure are good. We have a spacious library, and sports places where we can also concentrate on the sports. Classrooms are spacious with a projector. Hostel facility is provided in the premises with quality food and security.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable with great support. The teaching quality is good which helps us in understanding the hard concepts. The course curriculum is relevant to the students based on the industry level. Semester exams are not that difficult.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Hostel facility is good. College courses, placements, faculty, and exams are moderate.

detailed_review.Placements: Companies like Lumen, Virtusa, Cognizant, and HCL are arriving at our college. Bulk hiring companies are only a few. We are waiting to be placed but we are not getting a chance because of the companies that only hire in single digits. If the bulk hiring companies are more than we can easily get placed in.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facility is good. Breakfast, lunch, and snacks are okay but dinner will be bad. Canteen food is not at all good sometimes they serve rotten food. This college is too good for sports it encourages people who are interested in sports and extracurricular activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Courses and subjects are good. Pass percentage and the semester exams are good. Teachers do not have much knowledge of the subject. Pass percentage is high. Exams are moderate we can pass so easily and courses help students. They are repeated and related most of the time.
detailed_review.Other: A large number of clubs. Good for sports and extracurricular activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Cyber Security)
reviews.review_title: Decent college experience with good infrastructure and with average placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 20-30 percent of students from our course were placed through campus placements. The placements cell supports students with training sessions, mock interviews, and aptitude preparation. Some of the major recruiters for our college include Virtusa, Infosys, HCL, and a few startup companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure at MLR Institute of Technology is good. Classrooms are equipped with projectors. The hostel facilities are decent and well-maintained. The quality of food in the mess is average. The college encourages sports and extra-curricular activities with grounds and indoor game facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty for the Cybersecurity course is average. There is limited industry exposure, specifically in advanced cybersecurity domains. Some concepts are taught well, but students often need to depend on self-learning, online courses, and certificates to gain deeper practical knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: The course provides an average value for money, considering the infrastructure. While the fees are on the higher side, students who actively participate in training, programs, certificates, and projects can make good use of the resources provided by the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: All are good and can join the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Students with 8.0 percent and above are placed. The highest package so far is 12 LPA. Internship is not based on the percentage. The roles are based on the company's requirements. Top recruiting companies are Infosys, Cognizant, Accenture, HCL, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel has great facilities. They provide good food and water services. Library and classroom access for hostel students has more benefits. Wi-Fi facility will be provided, and the maintenance is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very talented and qualified. They are capable of the course that they have chosen. The quality of teaching is good. The doubts will be clarified. The semester exams are conducted every 5 months. We will have 2 mids with 2 internals and 1 external. The faculty will be available during study hours to clarify doubts.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely not satisfied with the training and placements for our batch.

detailed_review.Placements: Till now around 200 students have been placed from our course, and 15 members have been placed. Till now, the highest package in our course is 7 LPA, and the lowest is 3.6 LPA. Top companies yet to come, and till now in Lumen Technologies, Virtusa, Infosys, and JMAN companies, some students placed from our course. As per my knowledge, internship opportunities are less. Role offered is SED.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: When coming to Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and library everything is fine but sometimes Wi-Fi issues may arises sometimes not all the time. I think that should be solved. Classrooms are also very good and have good ventilation. But due to dust, sometimes benches are filled with dust so that should also be solved. About hostel, I don't know because I am a day scholar but my friends told me that hostel is not that much good, which means the quality of food is not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: When coming to faculty, I will rate 3 out of 5 in some areas, of course, they are helpful and knowledgeable. Course curriculum is good but I think it should also be implemented practically, including some subjects that are very important for our placements. Semester exams are quite moderate to difficult in our college.
detailed_review.Other: I am very interested in AIML that's the reason I chose this course. The things that should be improved for the course are that the theory should be implemented practically in labs for some subjects. Coming to fests, events, etc., everything is good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: It has good infrastructure and surroundings. But faculty members and placements are not satisfied.

detailed_review.Placements: I am in my 4th year (2026 passing out batch). About 30-40% of students are placed in our course. The highest package is 9.2 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Infosys and HCL Tech. 40% of students got internships. Top roles offered are AI, robotics, and machine learning engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has good infrastructure and facilities like a big ground, canteen, library, labs, and classrooms. Wi-Fi is also provided for the faculty. Coming to hostel facilities, the quality of food is good. But the only problem is that there are no attached washrooms. Medical facilities are free. There is good encouragement for sports and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Honestly in my opinion, teaching quality is not that good. Not all faculty members are good at teaching. But some are really very good at teaching and help us. Course curriculum is relevant because the present generation is full of AI, robotics, and machine learning. Semester exams are not very much difficult because this is an autonomous college. Overall, the pass percentage is 70%.
detailed_review.Other: Basically I am interested in computer science so I decided to take computer science. There are many specializations in which most opportunities and ongoing future are CSE-AIML in the present generation. Best things about this course are gaining more knowledge about AI, robotics, and machine learning. Extracurricular activities like events, fests, and sports are best in this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: College gives knowledge and good friends while others do not provide this environment.

detailed_review.Placements: 30% of students have been placed till now. The highest package is 52 LPA, and the lowest package is 2.5 LPA. Cognizant can recruit more students. Data analyst and tester roles can be offered to more companies. Most likely, the top companies are hiring based on communication skills and logic, as communication is good then you can be placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good facilities are provided to students in the labs, such as LAN connectors and Wi-Fi. Hostel food is very good compared to outside. Sports and games should be provided in very good condition. Indoor stadium is present. Games such as cricket, volleyball, and kho-kho are present.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are helpful. Exams are strictly conducted. Course is relevantly conducted. Semester exams should be strictly conducted by the examination branch. Our course is artificial intelligence so based on this course, our study is going to be practical based on these working projects.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because artificial intelligence is becoming more technological in the world, and AI is ruling the world.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Enjoyable events and academics in our college.

detailed_review.Placements: In our college, the highest placement is 58 Lacs per annum. The lowest package in our college is 3.6 Lacs. Training and placements are also available in our college, for which 15,000 INR is taken. Maximum companies will come to our college to offer jobs, and many students are placed in our college. However, those who do not have communication skills do not get jobs, and many are placed in the IT industry only.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in our college is very good, and classrooms are well maintained. Wi-Fi is not provided in the classrooms, but the labs are well furnished, and Wi-Fi is available for our work. The library is also very well equipped. However, the hostel is not good because it is not sufficient for the four-person rooms, and the quality of the food is not very great. The taste is acceptable, but the hygiene is not maintained very well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are not so good, but they teach what they know. They don't even try to explain and explore the subjects. The curriculum is up-to-date, and the college provides us RTRP projects. Many major projects for our skill development and industry-ready subjects are available, and exams are very easy. We can pass the exams by reading just before the exam.
detailed_review.Other: Events in our college are conducted regularly and are very well managed and maintained. The campus crowd is somewhat not good, but the connectivity between the students and the teachers is very good. The campus surroundings are filled with greenery, and scholarships are provided by the government. External activities are also well encouraged, and sports are promoted as well.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Super placements college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are very good, and we also have training for Rs. 15,000. We have training in aptitude, mathematical reasoning, and verbs and coding also. And I got a job at Infosys, which is a very good company. Our college is providing good jobs to the students, and a good number of companies attend the college to give jobs. The highest package of the year is 25 LPA, and the lowest is 3 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in our branch is very good, and the classrooms are also very neat and well-maintained. The Wi-fi is not provided in the classrooms, and the labs are very well-equipped. Internet facilities are also available in the labs, and the corridors are also very good. The cleaning of the washrooms is also done very well. I live in a college hostel only. The hostel is very well maintained, and the food is also somewhat good, as we can accept the taste and also the hygiene is maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our exams are very well conducted because our branch has some special courses like Python for Data Science, etc., which is very old for the Data Science department, and the curriculum is up to date for industry purposes, like we will learn Python for Data Science and also Python using a database. Faculty are also very good in our branch.
detailed_review.Other: Our college is value for money. It has sports and external activities. The campus is surrounded by greenery, and connectivity is also very good in the campus. The crowd on the campus is somewhat mass and somewhat class. Fests and events on the campus are very beautiful.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is an overhyped college. I would not recommend this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Few students get placed here, and yearly placements are decreasing. It is an overhyped college, not as good as it is said to be outside. Students are very stressed, and many have backlogs. They tell us to study very hard to get placed. Few MNCs come to our college for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: When it rains, the college looks like a swimming pool. Wi-Fi facility is very slow, and systems are also very slow, so it needs frequent repair. Ethernet cables are not working, but the indoor system is good with marbles. Corridors are also good, but the water storage system needs to be improved.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many teachers are jolly and strict. Many of them do not have proper knowledge. They only refer to ChatGPT or textbooks, but we expected more from them. Many teachers are rude and shout unnecessarily. They take strict action unnecessarily, but everything is good.
detailed_review.Other: The best thing about my course is good friends, but not everyone. There is no unity at all. Few fests are organised, and we do not get permission most of the time for fests.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: I absolutely enjoyed the campus life and the atmosphere in the college.

detailed_review.Placements: About 30 students got placed in my course. The highest package offered till now is 12 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.2 LPA. There are no specific company recruitments for our course. Companies that come reach all the CSE and its allied branches. Only 5 percent of students got internships from our course. The top role offered is a software engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college hostel is provided for the three campuses. It provides good security. The food in the hostel is good. Even snacks are provided in the evening. The fee structure is much more than the way we live there. It is only suitable for first-year students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are good and qualified in the college. Every department is monitored by a head. The course curriculum helps students gain industry experience related to the branch they choose. Semester exams are a little difficult, and one should work hard to score a good percentage.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Information Technology
reviews.review_title: A college that gives correct planning for your career.

detailed_review.Placements: College placements are good, but so many are not getting placements because of their communication skills, and so our college provides training and placements for them. We have to pay some amount of fees, and they also prepare us for aptitude, reasoning and technical purposes, and I am very thankful to the placements department, and I got an internship in the 3rd year only. According to the previous statements, I can say that more companies visit the college to give placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in our college is very good, and the libraries are well-equipped, and they give books to us for a period of time, and also our classrooms are very well-equipped, and Wi-fi is provided in our classrooms. So our branch contains a separate Wi-fi to connect, and also the labs of our branch are very well and good and every system will work. The CSIT branch is like heaven for every student in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: According to the curriculum of the CSIT department, I can say that the curriculum is out dated. We have to follow JNTU rules, and also, we cannot call them industry-ready courses. Faculty of our branch is very well, and also they teach industry-related things. But the syllabus does not have the current updated content in it.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSIT department because of EAMCAT rank. After that, I realised that the CSIT department is very good for me, like Computer Science and Information Technology, which helped me to get an internship. There are so many events in our college that are very enjoyable and technical, and also very good. The campus crowd is not good because there are so many fights between the students, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: The college is paced with enjoyment and study.

detailed_review.Placements: 60 percent of students are placed in 2025, and in 2026 placements are going on till now 200 and accounting, placement support will be there and training and placements also there but student has to pay 15000, so that after paying, they will train us for placements, and internships have to be researched by students only.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure of the college is very good, with a lot of greenery and a good vibe. The classrooms are good, but no Wi-Fi in classrooms. Labs are well-equipped and Wi-Fi facilities are also available in the labs, but sometimes there is no internet. Library has a good count of books, and students can take the books by scanning their ID card, and if the time exceeds, then a fine will be imposed on the student.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is good and some faculty are like they do not even put effort into explaining that they do not have any knowledge, they teach the students. Coming to the syllabus its like up to date, and in our curriculum, real time projects are also there to learn skills, and NPTEL courses are there to build skills in the curriculum. Exams are like mid 1, mid 2, and sem for every semester which are like easy to hard papers.
detailed_review.Other: Events are held every month and technical events, enjoyment events, and every type of event are held in our college. Campus is very good and the courses in our college are very good. In our branch, mainly the interaction sessions between industry experts are very good. Sports are very well encouraged.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Industry-aligned faculty, labs, coding challenges, and guest seminars for hands-on learning.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm a 3rd year student from the Data Science department. In my seniors batch about 80 percent of students got placed in core/IT roles. The highest package reaching 55 LPA and the average near 35 LPA. Our campus also hosted multiple guest talks and coding bootcamps to boost skills.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel campus is peaceful with a homely atmosphere and lush trees around. It provides a secure environment with 24/7 Wi-Fi, round-the-clock security surveillance, reliable water and electricity supply, and a mess offering unlimited meals. Labs are well-equipped with consistent lab hours.
detailed_review.Faculty: The campus hosts qualified teachers with strong industry ties offering regular practical labs, technical classes, and seminars. There are twice-weekly technical interviews, coding contests, and coding challenges that supplement learning and seminars often with industry guest speakers.
detailed_review.Other: Festivals and celebrations are vibrant with Navratri, Ganesh Chaturthi, the Kite festival, and Krishna Janmashtami, and other events enriching campus life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied and good placements, has well-qualified teachers, and has many facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: The college provides good placements, about 50 to 75% of students get placed, and the average package is around 3-4 LPA. The highest package is 55 LPA, and the lowest package is 2 Lacs per annum. The top recruiting companies in our college are Microsoft, Amazon, etc. Mostly, 60-70% of the students get placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college has good infrastructure, including a separate library, an indoor stadium, and well-maintained classrooms. Coming to the hostel, the food provided is of good quality, and there are no issues regarding it. The rooms are well-maintained and hygienic.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified and clears every doubt, and the course curriculum is relevant and very useful for the students coming to the difficult level of semester exams. 50% of the questions can be answered moderately, and coming to the pass percentage, it is around 75% according to my knowledge.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of MLR Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The MLR Institute of Technology is one of the best colleges in Hyderabad in terms of education and placements. It also gives equal priority to sports for students' refreshment. This college is one of the best in placements as well. In previous years, almost 80-90% of students get placed from this college. The companies are Virtusa, IBM, HCI, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In MLR Institute of Technology, there is the best infrastructure in the college and hostel. In the college, labs, Wi-Fi, classrooms, and libraries are available and perform well. In the hostel, the quality of food is good. They have a strong and healthy timetable for students. Medical facilities are also available because there is a hospital for any health issues.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has the best teaching faculty. Teachers have strong knowledge on every topic. They always help students, so the teaching quality is perfect. Our college also provides more advanced courses to make students industry-ready. The pass percentage of the college is 90%.
detailed_review.Other: In our college, there are a number of courses. I chose computer based on my interest. The best thing is that for every branch, there are different faculty, blocks, labs, and everything. In terms of extracurricular activities, MET has a number of events and fests, so we never feel bored during the entire college life.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good campus facilities and decent placement opportunities. Definitely recommended to go for it.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-85% of the students in our course were placed, with several well-known companies participating in the campus drive. The companies include TCS, Wipro, HCL, Cognizant, Capgemini, and Accenture. The highest package offered was around 58 LPA, the lowest package was about 3.5 LPA, and the average package remained in the 4-9 LPA range. Nearly 60-70% of students also received internship opportunities through the college, mostly with top companies and Startups. Very recently, 92 girls have been selected for Infosys.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college provides decent and perfect infrastructure with well-maintained classrooms, labs, and a good library facility. Wi-fi connectivity is reliable, and the hostel offers clean rooms and regular mess facilities. There is no doubt about the hostel mess. It's too good. Medical support at Arundathi Hospital and huge sports amenities are also available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very experienced and supportive, and they explain concepts clearly. The curriculum is updated and helps students become industry-ready. Semester exams are moderately difficult, but students can score well with regular study. Perfect choice.
detailed_review.Other: This course offers good career opportunities and a curriculum that suits my interests. The campus atmosphere is very friendly with many events like ECSTACY, HELENIC, NAVARAT NAVELI, etc. It also includes Technical fests like MUN, ZIGNASA, Robotics Innovation, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: The good college with good infrastructure and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are good. Many students from our batch got selected. Many top companies like Infosys, Cognizant, Virtusa, and HCL visit our college. Many students get selected for the internship. The placement team helps the students in cracking the placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel was good with high security. High Wi-Fi and 24/7 hot water. The food was good. There is a hospital under our management. They provide a free hospital facility. There are many indoor and outdoor games for the students. There is a gym facility for both boys and girls.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many teachers have a Ph.D. The teaching and curriculum were good. Every branch has the related courses according to its curriculum. The semester exams were good. The pass percentage would be around 90. Our teachers help the students to gain a higher percentage.
detailed_review.Other: I have taken Computer Science and Engineering with a specialisation in Artificial Intelligence, and it is currently a trend in society. I gained knowledge in this field. The events and fest will be too good. The students will enjoy it a lot.

faqs.question: What entrance exam scores are accepted by MLR Institute of Technology for admission?

faqs.question: How can I get seat at MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: To secure a seat at MLR Institute of Technology, students can check the following steps presented below:

faqs.question: How do I get admission to MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: To apply for the various course at MLR Institute of Technology, candidates need to meet the last educational qualification set by the institute. Students can check the detailed admission process below: STEP 1: MLRIT Application Process 2025 Candidates looking for various course admission must apply offline. Aspirants need to visit the official website to download the application. Fill up the application form and submit the same along with the necessary documents. STEP 2: Selection Rounds Students will be selected based on the entrance exam of TS EAMCET, TS ECET/GATE, TS PGECET/TSICET/merit-based as per respective courses. STEP 3: Merit List and Admission Confirmation Once selection rounds are over, the institute releases a merit list. To allot and confirm the seat candidates are required to pay the application fee at the admission receipt centre.

faqs.question: TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in how many rounds?
faqs.answer: The TS EAMCET Counselling 2025 will be conducted in three phases, namely Phase 1, Phase 2, and the Final Phase, for admission into BE/BTech/BPharma courses by the Telangana State Council of Higher Education (TSCHE) and will be managed by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University Hyderabad (JNTUH). Further, TS EAMCET (now TS EAPCET) Spot Round will also be conducted for Private Unaided Engineering Colleges.

faqs.question: Who is eligible for BTech course at MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: To apply for the BTech course at MLR Institute of Technology, candidates must meet the eligibility criteria set by the college. The minimum qualification for admission to the first year BTech course is 50% aggregate in the Class 12 conducted by the board of intermediate education, Govt. of Telangana or any other examination recognised as equivalent to Mathematics, Physics and Chemistry as optional subjects.

faqs.question: Does MLRIT accept JEE Mains score for the BTech course?
faqs.answer: No, MLR Institute of Technology do not accept JEE Mains score for the BTech course. The selection criteria for the course is TS EAMCET, TS ECET. For more detailed on eligibility students can check the points mentioned below:

faqs.question: How can I get admission to MBA at MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: For admission to an MBA course, students need to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria in the first place. MLR Institute of Technology accepts a valid score on the TSICET exam. This exam is particularly conducted for admission of students to PG courses. Apart from this, the total tuition fee for the MBA course is INR 1.2 lakh.

faqs.question: What is the seat intake for MBA at MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: The seat intake for the Master of Business Administration (MBA) programme at MLR Institute of Technology is 120. The programme is offered at the PG level and has a duration of two years. Candidates must have a graduation degree with 50% marks and must appear and qualify for admission. The selection criteria for this course is TSICET.

faqs.question: Is there any entrance exam for admission to M.Tech at MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: For admission to the M.Tech course at MLR Institute of Technology, students need to fulfil the minimum eligibility criteria in the first place. The selection criteria for this course are entrance-based and candidates must pass BE/BTech/AMIE with a 50% aggregate or equivalent conducted by the University. Candidates who have not completed BE/BTech/AMIE with a 50% aggregate are not eligible for admission.

faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee for the M.Tech programme at MLR Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: The fee for the M.Tech programme at Silver Oak College of Humanities and Social Science is INR 1.2 lakh. The fee covers various academic expenses like hostel and one-time fees, and other relevant charges. It is important to note that the fee structure is subject to change, and candidates are advised to refer to the official website of the university for the latest and most accurate fee structure.

faqs.question: What is the last date to apply for MLR Institute of Technology admission?
faqs.answer: MLR Institute of Technology admission is open online. Till now, no schedule has been released by the institute. Since the application portal is live, candidates can apply online for their preferred course. MLRIT offers  more than ten courses (including specialisations) in various streams such as Pharmacy, Engineering, Management, etc.

faqs.question: Can I get into MLRIT with 60 percentile in TSICET?
faqs.answer: MLRIT admissions 2024 are based on TSICET scores, followed by counselling round. Candidates seeking admission to the MBA/MCA courses with a 60 percentile in TSICET can easily get admission at MLRIT. Based on the TSI CET exam results, the MLRIT cutoff 2024 will be determined. Candidates must score 50 out of 200 to be eligible for the TS ICET, which has a 25% qualifying mark for OBC and General categories. However, no minimum marks are defined for SC/ST candidates. faqs.question: Is MLR Institute of Technology hard to get?
faqs.answer: It may be quite difficult to gain admission into MLR Institute of Technology mainly because the institution is accredited to Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University, and has been autonomous since the year 2015. The other minimum cut off requirement is 50 % for the 10+2 examination and the major entry test is TS EAMCET. For instance, the closing ranks for the general category in the B.Tech in Computer Science Engineering course were approximately 20,256 in the year, 2023. Hence though not one of the toughest to crack, a good rank in TS EAMCET is very important.

data.title: MLR Institute of Technology Placement Report 2025
summary: The placements are going on at MLRIT for the Class of 2025. As of now, 64 recruiters have visited the campus and offered 329 job offers to the students of the batch 2025 of MBA , BTech , and MTech courses . The highest package offered during MLRIT placements in 2025 stands at INR 33 LPA . Earlier, the highest package offered to the 2024 batch was INR 28.5 LPA. Further, the participating recruiters offered 674 job offers to the students of the 2024 batch . The top recruiters of MLR Institute of Technology placements included Inovalon, Zscaler, Amadeus Labs, Flipkart, Lumen, Accenture, Deloitte, Amazon, Capgemini, Tech Mahindra, Intellipaat, Virtusa, Wiley Edge, etc.
The key highlights of MLRIT placements for the Class of 2024 and 2025 are tabulated below:
Note : The placements are going on for the Class of 2025. The above-mentioned placement details for 2025 may vary once the final placement report is out.

college_info.college_name: MLR Institute of Technology Photos & Videos

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description:
The Central Library has an area of 1275 Sq.Mt. The reading space is 400 Sq.Mt which can seat over 500 students. The institute has a duplex library which is spacious and voluminous enough to accommodate more than 4700 titles, 34271 volumes. More than 114 National and 72 International Journals.

Digital library is equipped with 30 Systems connected to dedicate Internet Server. Digital Library is well stocked with NPTEL material covering most of the important subjects and to access E-journals, E-books, and E-learning. The library has DELNET (Inter library loan) for resource sharing and it is fully computerized with the bar-code system.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: The college has comprehensive hostel facilities for the students. Exclusively, two blocks are provided for boys with 1000 capacity and two blocks for girls with 1000 capacity. A Total of 2000 students can avail hostel facility with in campus FREE medical support and WIFI. The study hours in the hostel are from 6 p.m to 7.30 p.m for girls and 6.30pm to 8.00pm for boys daily.

data.description: MLR Institute of Technology has more than 200 highly experienced faculty members in the departments of Aeronautical Engineering, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning, Computer Science & Engineering, Computer Science and Information Technology, CSE– Data Science, CSE AI & ML, CSE-Cyber Security, Electrical and Electronics Engineering, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Freshman Engineering, Information Technology, and Master of Business Administration. Most of the faculty members are degree and PhD holders. Below are some of the names among the 200 faculty members:

highlights.summary:
NIT - Narula Institute of Technology is an autonomous Engineering and Management Institute under the aegis of JIS Group Educational Initiative. The institute is recognised by the UGC and is approved by the AICTE. Further, Narula Institute of Technology is also affiliated with MAKAUT. Additionally, NIT is also accredited by NAAC with an A grade and NBA.
Narula Institute of Technology provides various undergraduate, postgraduate, and diploma programmes. The courses provided by the institute include BTech, BCA, BBA, BBA HM, MCA, MTech, and Diploma in various specialisations. Moreover, the top recruiters of the institute include Accenture, Juspay, Zscaler, ITC Infotech, Tejas Network, Deloitte, SLK Software, TCS, Pinnacle Infotech, Accenture, Amazon HCL, Cognizant, IBM, etc. Candidates can check out the major highlights of Narula Institute of Technology below:
Accenture, Juspay, Zscaler, ITC Infotech, Tejas Network, Deloitte, SLK Software, TCS, Pinnacle Infotech, Accenture, Amazon HCL, Cognizant, IBM, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: College is overall good for engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: 50–60 percent of students are placed, the college offers companies like Cognizant, TCS, Capgemini, Infosys, LTI, Mindtree, etc., the top role offered is software engineer, the highest package is 9 LPA, and overall placement is good if the student is serious from the first day of college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All things of the course are good, classrooms, washrooms, labs, and library are very well maintained, Wi-Fi is provided, the campus is not very big but enjoyable, many events happen every year, and the hostel is average, enough for a student to stay and study.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty and course curriculum are good, all the important subjects required for the course are included and enjoyable, faculty members teach students to provide their best, overall best, and exams happen in a good environment.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied because of the infrastructure, faculty and events.

detailed_review.Placements: 65% of students are placed in this course. The highest package is 6 LPA, the lowest package is 3 LPA, and the average package is 4 LPA. The top recruiting companies for this course are TCS, Amazon, Flipkart, etc. 85% of students got internships from this course in various companies like TCS, Infosys and also in-campus internship. Roles like HR, marketing executive, data analyst, etc., are offered in this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have a huge library with thousands of books and free Wi-Fi. We have labs for all B.Tech courses. The building is air-conditioned. Food quality in the canteen and hostel is above average, with good, affordable prices. Medical facilities are good. The college is very much involved in events, sports and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very knowledgeable and helpful. They are quite interactive. The course curriculum is relevant. Semester exams in this college are not that difficult to pass, as the teachers provide proper materials before the exams, and the evaluation is done based on both practical and theoretical aspects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: If students are preparing for competitive exams, then I suggest taking admission to this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Only 60-70 percent of students got placed last year with a package of 4 LPA. The highest package offered is around 6 LPA, and the lowest package offered is 1.8 LPA, last year in the information technology branch. Top recruiting companies for our course are Accenture, Tech Mahindra, Capgemini, Bitwise, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite good, and labs are quite equipped. Hostel wardens are too bad. They are not giving the food to other state students. They are misbehaving with students. The canteen food is too good and at a low price. Canteen members are behaving very well with everyone.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and knowledgeable. But the lab assistants only speak the Bengali language. Semester exams are too difficult, and the pass percentage is good.
detailed_review.Other: I am from the information technology branch. It is one of the oldest branches on this campus, so I chose it. Cultural fests are organised. There are no scholarships for students from other states. Different cultural events are always organised on the college campus. Different hackathons are organised too.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Business Administration (BBA)
reviews.review_title: This is a very good college, and the campus life is enjoyable.

detailed_review.Placements: This college is excellent for placements, with a very supportive college management and system. The packages are very good. The highest package is 42 LPA. The B.Tech department offers many courses, and the college provides good placement opportunities.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is excellent. The library and book issue process are very easy. The library has MacBooks and labs for Mechanical Engineering. Many departments, including Electrical, Management, Computer, and other Engineering departments, are well-equipped. The college overall is good. Classrooms are modern and the rooms are well-equipped with air conditioning. Every classroom is AC and has tables and modular furniture. The college has a very nice campus life to enjoy.
detailed_review.Faculty: Semester exams are of normal to hard difficulty depending on the student.
detailed_review.Other: BBA is a very good course, and many events and scholarships are provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Review of Narula Institute of Technology. It is excellent.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement percentage of our college is on average 88–89 percent. The average package offered is 3.5 to 4.5 LPA. The highest package is around 40 LPA. Top recruiters include TCS, Capgemini, Cognizant, Juspay, IBM, Mindtree, and many more.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a great campus. Labs have all the required equipment. Classrooms are very clean. The environment in our college is very student-friendly. The college hostel is clean and well-managed. Canteen food is delicious, and we have an NCC unit in our college. We have football and cricket teams, and basketball, badminton, and chess are also popular among students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our faculty members are well-educated, with good teaching skills and a helpful attitude. They care about students a lot. Our semester exams are not very hard, and a 4 CGPA is required to pass. We have a mandatory one-slot exam, which is easy to medium in difficulty.
detailed_review.Other: At our college, many courses such as Computer Science and Engineering, Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning. Along with Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science), Information Technology, Electronics and Communication Engineering, Mechanical Engineering. Electrical Engineering, Civil Engineering, Computer Science and Technology, Computer Science and Business Studies, Electronics and Computer Science, and others.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: It is a good college. Teachers are good. But if you love CS then it's good.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has good placement but internship is so bad. You need to put your efforts that's all. You need to work if you don't put your time here. If you put 100% your efforts, then no one can stop you in life. I think this is the best college in Kolkata in the private sector and that's it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi doesn't work anytime. Labs, classroom, and library are too good. Overall, you can feel good here. I think if someone doesn't ask you donation, then it's the best college. I think you can consider it as a future college.
detailed_review.Faculty: All teachers are good. Some teachers even speak Hindi, English, and Bengali. They are so talented but few teachers are not good. Pass percentage is 5%. I think you don't think about the teacher, just put your efforts. You can get marks easily and learn coding also as a side job.
detailed_review.Other: Hackathon is too good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: This is the best college to take admission in, as the facilities are very good.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements for our course saw a strong rate, with 70% to 80% of students getting placed in companies such as TCS, Juspay, Accenture, IBM, Cognizant, and Tech Mahindra, where they secured roles like Associate Engineer and others, with salaries ranging from a high of 12 LPA to a low of 2.8 LPA, and notably, 50% to 60% of these students were placed in major firms like IBM and Accenture.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The labs are awesome and well-maintained, and the campus has Wi-Fi. The classrooms are modern and well-organized, and they have an LCD panel. The library is very clean and awesome, and you can borrow books from it at any time. The hostel quality is also good, though the food in the hostel is average. The college has medical facilities and offers all types of sports, in addition to some indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: I can confidently say that our course has the best faculty members ever; the teachers are very helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. This course curriculum is absolutely relevant. The semester exams at our college are of a medium difficulty, with a 40% pass percentage.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course for its opportunities in both core industries and IT industries. The best part is that you can learn much more than you would in other courses. Events and fests are always a part of Narula, and scholarships are available.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Narula Institute of Technology is a very good private institute.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students are placed, some are placed at Big 4, but you cannot ignore that you will need a Master’s, aka MCA, to grab a good placement. Overall placement is good, including other branches. The top placement is about 48 LPA this year, and many of them got placed with good CTC.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college provides free Wi-Fi and a clean environment. Classes are good, and they teach on a blackboard. Labs are good and air-conditioned. There is a library too, where you can take books for up to 1 month. The college has a playground where many play football.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are pretty good. They teach well and solve any doubts if you have any. The course makes students industry-ready, but you have to grab the knowledge on your own. Semester exams are not that tough; if you prepare for them 1 month before, you can make it with a good CGPA.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am not able to do B.Tech, as I am from a different stream. The curriculum is pretty much the same. Coming to events, they are held annually, and you will not dare to miss them.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a nice college for studying and getting a placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement is good, but I think it is better but unfortunately all the seniors said placement is good. They said it should be good if the package is good. The package is like 9 LPA - 10 LPA average. 80% of students get this type of placement if they have a great knowledge.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college provides nice hostels. Many features are available for cooling water and no rain. Many more extra features are available. Classes are good but I play more than 6 lakhs. We have no AC room for study. The library is not good, no AC available. It's crowded and not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college has nice faculty members but it is not applicable for all. It would be one-sided like if any teacher likes some students then they take extra care for those students, rather than being like it flew in and sat across. Semester exam is like 70 marks, and it easy because guards are not hard.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Considering this college is not bad.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement at this college is generally good. The majority of students receive job offers through on-campus drives, with 60-70% of eligible students placed every year. The average package is around 3-3.5 LPA, while the highest can reach 9-10 LPA. Companies such as TCS, Capgemini, and HCL regularly participate in these drives, offering analyst and developer roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is not bad. The outside appearance is good, but the interior facilities of the classrooms and labs are not good. AC, Wi-Fi, and smart boards are also limited. The library contains various books related to academics. Hostel facilities are the same as those of other colleges; the food is manageable. Getting exposure in sports is very hard since the college doesn't have playgrounds.
detailed_review.Faculty: One negative aspect of this college is the faculty, who are not well qualified and teach using their notes, which are insufficient for students. The course curriculum is the same as in colleges across India and is not relevant for current times. This makes it difficult for students to become industry-ready.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: A brief review of Narula Institute of Technology & one of the best private colleges in West Bengal.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scenario in all private colleges in West Bengal is more or less the same. The majority of students get placed in service-based companies, including TCS, Wipro, Infosys, HCL, Accenture, Cognizant, Capgemini, and Tech Mahindra. These companies offer packages ranging from 3.6 to 6 LPA. Only a handful of product-based companies visit these private colleges and cherry-pick 2-3 students per college. It is the reality of all private colleges, not just our college. If you want to crack a high-paying job, you will have to do it off-campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has decent infrastructure compared to other government colleges in West Bengal. However, there are a few problems. There is no AC in classrooms or labs (except the computer labs), so it gets hot in the summer. The ground is quite small, barely enough to host one sporting event. All labs have equipment, but some of the apparatus is old. The college looks good from the inside, especially the ground floor, but the lack of AC is a big issue during the summer. The hostel has very limited seats, and rooms accommodate 2, 3, or 4 people. The food is just barely edible.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty at Narula Institute of Technology are all well-qualified, but that doesn't mean they are good teachers. Many faculty members in the college literally don't care about their students. They just come with their notebooks, read some topics from their notes, and leave the class. Some teachers just come to fill the chalkboard and explain nothing. However, there are also some faculty members who try their best to explain each and every topic to their students. The course curriculum is irrelevant in all colleges for getting a job. Exams are easy.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this college because it was the best option among all the others I got. The best perk is that it is an autonomous college, so there is no strict attendance policy, and the exams are very easy, making it easier to get a high CGPA. I chose IT because I couldn't get into CSE. I didn't choose any specialization because I wanted to do a non-specialized course. I wish they would install AC in all classrooms because it gets hot and humid during the April-June season. I also want the college to bring in better companies (PBC companies).

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college to start you career with.

detailed_review.Placements: According to college records, the average placement percentage in our batch is between 65-75%. In our course, the highest package is 8 LPA - 9 LPA, the lowest is 3.5 LPA - 4 LPA, and average is close to 6 LPA. In our course, the top recruiting companies are TCS, Accenture, Infosys, and Tech Mahindra. The students getting internships are 70-80% and they are recruited by TCS, Accenture, and Infosys mainly. The top roles offered are junior software developer and SDE 1.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: For our department, there are dedicated Wi-Fi routers, labs are used by many other departments (shared labs). There is a dedicated classroom for our department but it changes every semester. There is also a library with a collection of more than 11000 books and a public room for reading. Hostel infrastructure is average (do not expect much), the food is decent (chicken is on Sunday), and after 10:00 PM the gate of the hostel closes. Medical facilities are there. Sports are conducted in college grounds during annual sports, and games are conducted in the premises of college campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, they show the things that students have doubts. They are very much qualified (some teachers have more than 20 years of teaching experience at this college). They are very much knowledgeable. This course curriculum is relevant as you will learn about the core fundamentals of electronics which makes you proficient in both software and hardware industries. The exams are somewhat difficult (if you learn the concepts, you are ready for the exam). The pass percentage is about 75-85%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Affordable and decent college with good teachers, stable placements, and growing infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60-70 percent of students got placed. The highest package is around 8 LPA to 10 LPA, and average is around 3 LPA to 4.5 LPA. Companies like TCS Infosys and Wipro visited for recruitment. Many students secured internships through off campus efforts in startups and tech firms. Roles included software developer web developer support engineer and analyst. Placement depends highly on individual skill and effort.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available across campus. Classrooms and labs are decent, though labs could be better equipped. Library is useful with enough resources. Hostels are okay, basic but livable. Mess food is average but hygienic. Medical help is available. Sports and common areas are accessible and regularly used.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are helpful and qualified, though teaching quality varies by faculty. The curriculum is decent but leans more towards theory than industry trends. It's not completely industry-ready but it builds strong fundamentals. Semester exams are moderate if you are consistent, pass percentage is usually 75-85%, depending on the subject and effort.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to build a strong base in tech. Best parts include affordable education and good peer learning. Wish there were more practical exposure and updated tools. Campus has a calm vibe. Events are enjoyable, and scholarships help financially weaker students. Connectivity is fine, and the crowd is lively.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: It is an average college and an average college life.

detailed_review.Placements: An average college where more than half of the students get placed, but mostly with an average package. If you want a good salary, you have to work hard and try to get it from outside the campus. The same goes for internships. You need to put in extra effort and secure them off-campus. Building strong skills and networking early can significantly improve your chances.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college campus has a free Wi-Fi facility. The infrastructure is average. You can't get a hostel inside the campus; it is located outside but managed by the college faculty. Free Wi-Fi is also available in the hostel. The food is just okay, not very good. Overall, the campus provides the basic necessities, but there is room for improvement in living conditions and facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are okay, like average, not top notch, most of the teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable in their respective subjects. They are supportive when it comes to clearing doubts. The course curriculum is moderately relevant. It covers the basic foundation needed in the industry. Semester exams are not very difficult if you attend classes regularly and study consistently. Questions are mostly based on classroom lectures and past papers. The pass percentage is quite high, usually around 85-90%, so it's manageable for most students.
detailed_review.Other: The best thing about the campus is that if you're surrounded by competitive and motivated students, you naturally grow and improve yourself. Although they claim to have a gym on the campus, it's either not available for students or remains closed most of the time. Even the student lift is often out of service, which can be convenient. On the brighter side, the college organizes enjoyable fests, offers scholarships, and provides various extracurricular activities you can participate in. With the right mindset and involvement, you can make the most of what the campus offers despite its limitations.

reviews.course: Bachelor of Computer Application (BCA)
reviews.review_title: Our college has the most beautiful campus and good placements from 2021 to 2025.

detailed_review.Placements: In my college, 95% of students get placed in our course. The package offered in my course is 4.27 LPA. TCS, Wipro, Accenture, Deloitte, IBM, etc., are companies where students got internships from my course. 80% of students got internships from my course in TCS, Wipro, Deloitte, Accenture, etc. Top roles like web developer and software developer are offered. Not only that, everyone can make themselves freelance and work for themselves.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are many facilities like sports and other activities like singing, drama, dance, and also study. There are many labs. It has Wi-Fi, beautiful classrooms, and a library. In the hostel, all facilities are too good. Many types of food are available in the mess and the canteen. There are also medical facilities. It has sports, which are students' favourites like football, cricket, kabaddi, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are so helpful. They are very qualified and knowledgeable. They teach us very well. When we have any queries, we go to our teachers and they solve our queries. The course curriculum is relevant, and it makes students industry-ready. In this college, semester exam papers are hard, and some papers are medium to easy. In this college, the pass percentage is too good, and it is 99%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I like to do coding and in the future. I want to be a web developer. In my course, coding is so interesting, and it is a futuristic thing that can shape future technology. I think every student after 12th has to choose this path to make a better future. It is a futuristic technology that can improve our technology in the future. Our college organises many events in my college, like Navodaya Pariksha party, teachers' day celebration, farewell, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college can be considered if you want to focus on off-campus. Average on-campus placements.

detailed_review.Placements: As I have not completed my course yet, I cannot give a full review. However, looking at the senior placements, they are considered below average. The highest package was 65 LPA from Amazon, and companies like Deloitte and Accenture do visit our college. According to the college, 80% of students are placed. Students should focus on off-campus placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities inside the college are good, but the campus is not that large. There are AC labs, a library with nice seating arrangements, and spacious three separate rooms for studying. The classrooms are also roomy. Since I do not reside in the hostel, I cannot comment on it specifically. However, friends mentioned that student safety is maintained, and the quality of food is pretty decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are very helpful and supportive, with a lot of teaching experience. They provide all the necessary notes through online PDFs before exams for study purposes. Yes, this helps make students industry-ready. The difficulty level of semester exams is above average; they are pretty tough but not impossible to pass. The pass percentage is above 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of future job opportunities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Lateral Entry)
reviews.review_title: College has qualified teachers who can guide students. The infrastructure is really good.

detailed_review.Placements: There are several students from several states who take admission to this college. The highest package offered this year (2025) is 42 LPA from the CSE department. Top recruiting company is Accenture, mainly for the CSE department as well as others. Students can get internships easily.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: High-speed Wi-Fi is available at the college. The classroom and library are neat and clean, as well as the labs are too good. There is a big playground for outdoor games and also facilities for indoor games. The cafeteria is too good and students can also chill out there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Before every semester college take two mock tests to improve the knowledge of students. It is really helpful for us. Semester exams are not that difficult, just you have to concentrate on the class lectures and real properly, you can easily get a good score.
detailed_review.Other: I chose B.Tech in computer science and engineering course. I like this course so much, and I wish that I could improve myself.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Quite good based on all.

detailed_review.Placements: This is the best course offered by the college. So, the placement rate is quite better. Maximum of the students got placed if they studied well. A specific placement cell helps to get the offer. Even now, some MNCs are coming to provide internship opportunities. So, it is quite good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are available here like drinking water, parking, Wi-Fi, AC labs, and library. You get all the facilities. It has 5 floors. On every floor, you will get washrooms and a drinking water point. There is a cafeteria in which you can spend your free time and also have a study zone beside library.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are friendly and they will help you whenever you need. The curriculum and exam structure are a little bit outdated but okay. Every college is now following this pattern. Besides the main curriculum, you can give NPTEL examination which will help you build knowledge on that course and also help to build confidence.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I would recommend anyone to take admission at this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement scenario of CSE department is quite good. The average package is around 6 LPA, and the highest is about 33 LPA. But you have to maintain your CGPA atleast above 8.0 to expect great placement and get yourself prepared for the interview and aptitude.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs, classroom, and library quality are more than enough good but Wi-Fi is not that great. Canteen food is really good. Environment is nice and clean too. Our college has clean and hygienic environment. We have great faculty members for studies and good environment to study and focus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The qualification of teachers is top notch but their teaching style is not up to expectations and can be improved. Exam and curriculum are great and organised in a very controlled environment. It is conducted in a very strict environment and in a very unbiased way.
detailed_review.Other: It has excellent campus life, and lots of other activities can be performed along with studies.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Overall nice college to pursue B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: Many students are placed in the core branch. The highest package so far is 55 LPA, and the top recruiting companies are TCS, Cognizant, and Accenture. About 80% of students secured internships from this course. The institute offers various roles such as Manager, PA, and HR.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite good, with many labs and classrooms, and every student has access to a computer. The library is a quiet and good place to study. The hostel is also comfortable, featuring nice food and lodging. There are canteen and medical facilities, along with recreational activities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful, and students can approach them anytime. They are supportive and knowledgeable. This course is relevant and prepares students for the industry. Semester exams are moderate, and the pass percentage is quite good. Overall, it’s a positive experience.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I wanted to pursue computer science.

faqs.question: Can I take admission in NIT Narula Institute of Technology, without JEE in B.Tech?
faqs.answer: NIRF ranking of Narula Institute of Technology is between 200 to 250 it oscillates in this range the average placement I would say of B.Tech is good not very good if you compare with Jadavpur or NITs.  You can take admission in Narula Institute of Technology without JEE by giving WBJEE direct admission is not possible it is a government-registered college you can take admission only by appearing in WBJEE and getting a decent rank-clearing exam according to your category. you can check the required marks to get admission on Shiksha itself.

faqs.question: What is the appliGATEion fee for the B.Tech programme at NIT Narula Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: Each candidate category for the B.Tech degree at NIT Narula Institute of Technology carries a number of charges. For SC, ST, and PWD applicants, the application usually costs approximately Rs. 500; for general category candidates, it costs approximately Rs. 1000. Applicants can obtain comprehensive cost details right away by visiting the official institute website or the admissions handbook. You must submit your application by the deadline together with the application fee in order for the admissions process to go smoothly and for it to be taken into consideration. It is recommended that applicants stay informed about any adjustments or changes to the fee structure through the institute's official channels to avoid misconceptions throughout the application process.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility criteria to get into B.Tech in CSE at NIT Narula Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: To get admission to the B.Tech in CSE engineering you must have at least 45 % marks in 12 grade you must have appeared for JEE MAIN, CEE AMPI, or CEE AMPI the age of the B.Tech programme is min17 to 23. You must also be at least 17-23 years .you have at least 30% marks in English and my suggestion you take the admission in NIT.

faqs.question: Which is the best course at NIT Narula Institute of Technology?
faqs.answer: CSE (Computer Science and engineering)is the best courece at Narula Institute of Technology.The pass percentage is 100%. Overall teachers are good, infrastructure is small and placement is average. 4th-year students are eligible for placement. Companies with low and average packages and mass recruiters come here like TCS, Accenture, Capgemini, etc. And 95 % students got placement after completing the course. Also best package is given to the students in this course according to senior of NIT

faqs.answer: Yes, it is a good college for BTech Narula Institute of Technology, is a premier educational institute in Kolkata and a part of JIS Educational Initiatives. It stands among the top private engineering colleges in West Bengal. Today, most of its eligible programs are NBA accredited, reflecting its commitment to quality education. It has an amazing infrastructure with good and supportive faculty members, but as every coin has two sides, some are not that good. college_info.college_name: National Engineering College: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: National Engineering College is a private institute, established in 1984 in Tamil Nadu. National Engineering College is approved by AICTE and offers a total of 19 courses at UG and PG levels in 9 specialisations such as Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Civil Engineering, Computer Science Engineering, Control Systems and Electrical Engineering. Furthermore, it offer courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech and MCA in Full Time mode. National Engineering College fee structure includes a total tuition fee ranging from INR 35,000 to 2,00,000. National Engineering College has an annual seat intake of 714 for all the programmes. It offers courses, in streams such as Engineering and IT & Software. As per the recent National Engineering College placement records, the average median salary at the Institute is around INR 3,77,784. The institute has a safe and well-equipped campus with all the advanced facilities.
