NIT Andhra Pradesh Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Campus infrastructure is very good. Hostels and mess are best.

detailed_review.Placements: 70% of students got placed. The highest package is 15 LPA. Average package is 6.3 LPA. The lowest package is 5 LPA. Recruiting companies are Larsen & Toubro, Reliance Industries, Hindalco, JSW Steel, and Raam Group. 80% of students got internships. Coding and editing are very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Lab is good. Modern facilities are available. Hostel rooms are 4-seaters. There are 3 fans with full light. Mess is good, and canteen is available 6 days and Sunday is off. Medical facilities are available 24X7, and sports are good. College is free upto one lakh medical treatment for one year. Students are 1st priorities for system. Almost 30 clubs are available, and library is very good. Student life is perfect.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are Ph.D. pass out and full of knowledge. All are average, some are top. Exams are average. Teachers and seniors are very helpful. Normally, language barriers exist but English is most commonly used language. Mess staffs are supportive, and friendships are most common.
detailed_review.Other: Mechanical engineering was chosen because of ISRO and railway. Some government jobs are hired. It provides modern facilities and automatic system. 1 technical and 1 cultural fest are conducted. Campus is very good with new infrastructure. South connectivity is good, and railway system is good. Many state and central government scholarships are available.  There is no ragging issue.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you think you can self-study, join here.

detailed_review.Placements: The chances of getting an internship are very low. The highest package is around 12 LPA-15 LPA. The least is around 3 LPA. The average is around 5 LPA-6 LPA. In our last batch, the overall percentage of EEE students placed is around 65 percent. Most of the students are recruited by BHEL. Instead of relying on a college on campus. It's better to be prepared beforehand. My opinion is that it is better to go for GATE.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi, classrooms, labs, and library are good. Except for the faculty, everything else here is good. There are 2 grounds. A gym, a dispensary, a sports complex, and a vehicle for helping handicapped people to reach classrooms. Coming to the hostel, there are separate blocks for boys and girls, which are far enough apart. Around 10 blocks for boys and 6 blocks for girls. There are facilities like a geyser and Wi-Fi on each floor. Watchman for each block. Cupboard in each room (one for every individual), a study table, and a chair.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful. But most of the teachers who are rich in knowledge won't be scheduled to deliver the lectures. They are busy with some other post regarding college. So the faculty is okayish. Somehow, we have to manage with YouTube lectures.
detailed_review.Other: The events are okay. And regd fest ( I enjoyed only once regd all the 5 seems). The campus crowd mostly consists of the Telugu community. As the college is in Andhra Pradesh. The scholarship section is okay. But they were some sort of lazy. The extracurricular activities include sports, nothing much to discuss. There is a group of students participating in an inter-NIT competition.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely, a very good college for placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80-90 percent of students got placed. The highest package ranges from 10-12 LPA, and the lowest package ranges from 2.52-3 LPA. The average package ranges from nearly 4.52-5 LPA. Top recruiting companies, such as TCS, Wipro, Infosys, and several local tech startups, hire students. The common roles offered are software developer, support engineer, data analyst, and intrum training positions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has a good computer lab, spacious classrooms, and a library with enough books for study. The campus is also very neat and well-maintained. Classrooms have a projector for teaching, smart boards, and green boards. Labs have a required system for software.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers support us well. They give confidence and explain topics clearly. They help students when needed. Their teaching quality is good, and their behaviour is also good. The course curriculum is relevant to current industrial needs, and it covers important subjects, practical labs, and project work. Students who follow the courses properly in skills get entry-level jobs. They provide extra practice and internships, which help in becoming fully industry-ready. Samiksha's semester exams are moderate but not too hard. The pass percentage is usually around 72-85% depending on the subject and the batch of students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am interested in technology and wanted to build a career in the IT field. I get the chance to learn skills that are useful for jobs and real-life applications. I feel the course should improve by adding more industry-based training, updated tools, placement workshops, and hands-on sessions. Udaas event helps students get a better experience.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is best for your future build-up.

detailed_review.Placements: About 74% of students get placed in this college, with 44 LPA being the highest package at that time. The lowest is 5 LPA, and the average package for placed students is around 8 LPA, with top companies like MNC, Infosys, and L&T. About 95% of students receive internship opportunities as part of the recruitment process.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is excellent for computer science programming, with numerous computer systems provided and well-known technicians available. Wi-Fi is accessible, and classrooms are digital. The library is fully air-conditioned and has a wide selection of books. The quality of food in the mess is very good. The medical facility is available for students with a van who take it to drop at the door.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very humble towards students and also grateful that students have that kind of teacher. Their way of teaching is very good they all are good thinkers and educated. Semester exams are not very tough you can pass the exam by studying one night before. The course will be relevant.
detailed_review.Other: This college is in my home state, which is why I chose it. The environment here is good, though some things need improvement, such as reducing the syllabus or taking the time to cover it properly, as it feels too rushed. Events and fests occur regularly each month, and scholarships are available, like NSP. The surrounding environment are good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Andhra Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: 75% of students get placed in this course. The highest package this year is 35 LPA and the lowest package is 6 LPA. The average package is 8.5 LPA. Some recruiting companies like TCS, Amazon, Ola, etc., visit the college for placements. Many students got internships in various companies like Microsoft, ISRO, etc. Some roles offered after this course are software engineer, VLSI engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are large classrooms which are capable of fitting 90-100 students at a time. Classrooms are fitted with smart TVs, blackboards, and whiteboards. It provides various laboratories for work. Hostels are very neat and new. Wi-Fi is available in the hostel with good connectivity. The food is hygienic, healthy, and tasty. A 24x7 medical facility is available. A various number of grounds are available for sports. A canteen is also there on the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very knowledgeable. They are qualified assistant professors. They help us with various topics about the course and also help us in any project work we will do. The course curriculum is very relevant to the present technology in the world. Students will be well-prepared to face the industry after this course. Semester exams are average to moderate in toughness. Students will be able to understand the topic in the course after exams. Most of the students pass this course.
detailed_review.Other: The college environment is very good. There are two fests per year. There are various scholarships. Many events are also held regularly here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Andhra Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Last year, the placement percentage was around 86%. The highest package is 44 LPA, and the minimum package is 8 LPA. Mostly, around 70% of students get internships in their companies depending upon the respective branch. Mostly, my branch students mainly concentrate on the GATE and government exams, and people with computer skills shift to software jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The library is very nice and new. It contains all books, different publications, and newspapers. The Wi-Fi connection is extraordinary. The quality of the food is above average. The canteen food is good and somewhat expensive. The hygiene is good. Sports and games tournaments are conducted in different NITs every year. Mother Theresa Health Center is available at the college, but all facilities are not provided.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very knowledgeable and experienced. Mostly, the college runs on adhoc faculty. From this academic year, the course curriculum has changed which is the R24 course curriculum. In semester exams, the pass percentage depends upon the department-wise. Mostly, papers are moderate and tough, but not that much easy.
detailed_review.Other: Every year two fests are conducted, one is technical and the other is cultural. The campus crowd is not that much because every year intake is 480 only. Scholarships are provided by the central government and respective the state government based on their prevailing norms.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has a good infrastructure and is value for money.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in NIT Andhra Pradesh are pretty decent for the electrical branch. The highest package is 18 LPA, and the lowest package is 3.5 LPA. The average package is 7.5 LPA. The percentage of students who get placed is decreasing yearly in campus placements. Top recruiting companies like Amazon and TCS visit the college for placements. Internships are available for 3rd-year students, and they can do summer internships in whatever topic they are interested in, and the college will support them.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: For every course, there will be a smart board in the class, so that faculty members can explain things easily. There are a total of 10 labs in our department. For every semester, students have to perform two labs. In the library, there is a separate section for our course and also for others. Wi-Fi is provided in the library. The menu of mess is good. The quality of the food is not bad. In hostels, there are many facilities like geysers, free Wi-Fi, tables and chairs but there is no washing machines. In sports, all games are available and they will conduct tournaments frequently.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members here are highly qualified and many of them completed their M.Tech from IITs. They will always encourage students to participate in expos and field trips to gain more knowledge. The courses here are very relevant and prepare students to perform practical applications in laboratories, etc. Semester exams are not very difficult if we study and not many students fail in exams.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because of my interest in electronics. Here in our college, the department provides many facilities for students. For every semester, there will be a fest to celebrate and showcase our talent. Connectivity with seniors is good. Scholarships are available like NSP, etc. There are extracurricular activities like field trips, industrial tours, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It has a nice campus, and it will be more beautiful in the upcoming years.

detailed_review.Placements: I think in the previous year, 70-75% of students got placed. The average package is 6 LPA. The lowest package is 4 LPA. The highest package is 44 LPA in the computer science and engineering department. In my branch, the average package is 6.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very nice. There are two laboratories on campus. Electrical engineering labs have almost all the equipment. There is AC in the lab, and it also has a good network connection. Some classrooms do not have AC, but the remaining classrooms have AC. There is a good network connection in both the hostels and classrooms. There is one library which is full of books. We can issue books through registration or by machines. The taste of the food in the canteen is very nice. Mess food is okay. There are three playgrounds.
detailed_review.Faculty: Almost all teachers are PhD holders from NIT or IIT. Teachers are very helpful. They are recruiting more teachers for teaching. The course curriculum is very relevant, and it is designed according to industrial scope. Mid-semester exams and end-semester exams are held by the exam department. Internal exams are conducted by their respective departments. Sometimes exams are hard. There is a relative grading system.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I like it and it has scope in the future. The main fest is named Vulcanzy and there are other fests like Techkriya, etc., are organised here. At night campus feels very nice. One side of the outside of campus is the village and there are price fields outside of campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am satisfied with the college.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 75-80% of students get placed. The average package is around 7 LPA - 8 LPA. Circuit branches have a little higher average package. The highest package is around 44 LPA, and the lowest may go upto 5 LPA. Companies like Wipro, TCS, etc., come for placements. Internships are available for interested students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel facilities are good. There is Wi-Fi facility in hostel. All the hostel rooms and washrooms are cleaned daily. Hostels are maintained neat. College also has indoor and outdoor sports facilities and a gym. Hostel food is average, sometimes good sometimes average. There is also a separate block for medical facilities. All the staff are friendly in manner.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the teachers are helpful and friendly, except a few. Most of them have good knowledge of the subject. At present, there is not sufficient staff, extra teaching staff will be recruited by next year. Curriculum is changed in the academic year 2024-25, making very important changes. It is quite good. Exams difficult is average to above average, and they maintain NIT standards in exams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a good NIT for students who want to pursue B.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: Approximately 75% of the students get placements in NIT Andhra Pradesh. Generally, TCS and Infosys visit the college to hire students with good salary packages. A lot of companies offer a salary package of more than 7 LPA. An internship is provided for all eligible students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is very good, but it is under construction as many areas of the college are vacant. The college head made some desire building which is helpful for us. A lot of facilities are provided by the hostel authority, like a cooler, lift, washing machines, etc.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well-educated and well-mannered. They are very kind and polite. They show a humble nature towards students and respect people. They make us achieve very much in our lives. Semester exams are not as hard, and it all depends on students' thinking capability. About 30% is the pass percentage. About 75% of attendance is mandatory.
detailed_review.Other: This course is important for me because it is likewise hope for me to build my own house. I am interested in architecture during the fest here. The crowd is more. I think the college should improve some facilities related to sports.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Metallurgical and Materials Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely dissatisfied with placements in 2024, but it has decent infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: From this core department, we can't expect more placements, but we got many admissions to IITs through the GATE examination. If you aren't interested in core placements or further studies, you can opt for IT jobs if you have the required skills for the placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Decent infrastructure and facilities when compared with other colleges. As it was a newly established institute, we have decent infrastructure, with new hostel blocks when compared with other institutes. The quality of food available in the mess is not so good, but it was okay.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching staff are qualified and helpful. Teaching quality is decent. A new curriculum was introduced this year, which was quite helpful for upcoming batches. It makes students industry-ready from their first year itself. Difficulty of semester exams lies in between moderate and difficult. Pass percentage is 35%.
detailed_review.Other: We have 2 fests every year. One is a cultural fest called VULCANZY, and the other is a technical fest called TECHRIYA.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The review of NIT Andhra Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: About 70% of students from our branch are getting placed every year and every year competition is increasing and the companies coming are Mahindra, Tata, Royal Enfield and other top companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostels are very neat and they maintain the hostels very properly and they provide Wi-Fi in the hostel and the classes are very small and they provide many sports facilities like inter NIT sports and the canteen called Dokka Settama will be there in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful during the exam time and they tell us how to prepare for the exam and most of the faculty are highly qualified in most prestigious colleges and the exam papers are given by the faculty who are coming to our class only.
detailed_review.Other: It is good not to prefer this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: New college and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed is around 60% this year due to the recession, but last year it was around 85%. The highest, lowest, and average packages are 44.5 LPA, 4.5 LPA, and 7.5 LPA, respectively. The top recruiting companies are Career, L&T, Tata Elxsi, Accenture, TCS, ZScaler, Unacademy, and many more. The college doesn't provide on-campus internship opportunities. The roles offered are in Teaching, Management, and EdTech domains.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available to us are excellent. Since the college is newly constructed, the construction is up-to-date and gives a good vibe. Classrooms and the library are up to the mark, with all the facilities like smart boards in classrooms, AC in the library, etc. Wi-Fi is also decent. The quality of the facilities at the hostel is above average, but the food available in the mess is below average. There is a medical center and a gymnasium. Outdoor and indoor sports complexes are also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. The teaching quality was good for most of the teachers. The course curriculum for some of the courses is industry-relevant. The semester exams are not that difficult and can be cracked with a week of preparation. The pass percentage is 33%.
detailed_review.Other: I code ECE since it's an evergreen course with applications in both software and hardware. Vulcanzy is the annual fest. Connectivity to the college is not that great.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely disappointed with the placements in 2024, and no proper director is the greatest flaw.

detailed_review.Placements: There are no proper placements; only around 40% are placed, and it's necessary to take action by the central government, as there is no proper direction to bring in companies. On average, those 30% of students who got 6 lakh per annum to 8 LPA should opt for other government exams rather than depending on campus placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are good, and maintenance is very good. Mess food will be better; you have to adjust for it. Canteen food tastes good, but the quantity for the amount is very less. Medical facilities are good enough, and sports and games are conducted actively. However, most games cannot be seen by most of them as they are conducted during lecture times.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum of exams will be sent two days before exams with proper details. The exams will be tough enough that you have to know all the applications on the topic. For the difficulty, we can rate it 8/10. Teachers clarify doubts properly without annoying, respond, and are available in their cabins. There will be 80% pass percentage.
detailed_review.Other: I am in the 2022-2026 batch. The Vulcanize fest and the flash mob are the best ones that I have seen in college. Other events like festivals are conducted, but mostly they are unknown.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: If you want to save your future, then please avoid this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement scenario is the worst in this institute; even the institute did not disclose information about placements. The college website shows fake data, and even CSE department students are unplaced. There is no permanent director.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the mess, it is impossible to find hygienic and edible food. Students eat in the mess just because the canteen in this college is more expensive than a restaurant. Every year, the same people get contracts through corruption. I think the situation of Wi-Fi and network in the jungle is better than this college. Every semester, students pay extra fees but get nothing from the institute.
detailed_review.Faculty: Mostly teachers are adhoc faculty, and they have no sense of teaching. I think even a 12th-grade student has better knowledge than them. All teachers just read PPTs, and they are always ready to exploit the students. The worst thing is that most of the teachers are recruited from a local private engineering college named Sasi Engineering College. The courses taught in this college are totally outdated and have no practical application; they are simply a waste of time. The biggest problem is that if you have below 80% attendance, they simply give you a repeat, even in medical conditions and emergencies, even at above 70%. Just think, they are spoiling the future of students.
detailed_review.Other: I think a village fair is better than the fest of this college. There is no scope for extracurricular activities; even inter-NIT students face problems due to attendance. One student even got a repeat because he went to an inter-NIT event.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is for those who only want a degree and have other career options after graduation.

detailed_review.Placements: Average packages in Mechanical Engineering are around 6 LPA. If you want good packages in mechanical core, don't join this college. Some of the top students got 7-10 LPA in software roles. L&T, Deloitte, and HP are a few companies which offered some placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are newly constructed and are near the bus and railway station. The classrooms are new. Construction of the classrooms and hostels was completed in the year 2021. Wi-Fi is available in the hostels and the mess. Wi-Fi is not available in the classrooms. Once in a month, the Wi-Fi won't work. Library has standard books and is not very huge.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is student friendly. The course has an organized syllabus. Half of the faculty members are qualified and experienced. Some of them are not at all trustable. For competitive exams, you should prepare from other sources. For semester exams, the faculty notes are more than enough. It is very easy to pass all the subjects.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of NIT Andhra Pradesh - National Institute of Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: The students who were placed in my course are around 40. The highest, least, and the lowest are 26, 5, and 7 LPA respectively. The top recruiting companies are Z-Scalar, Tata, Infosys, NVIDIA, etc. The students who got internships from my course are around 60 percent. The roles offered are software engineering, data science, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities in the course are good; we have AC in our labs, and we have systems with i7 processors. The library has a vast amount of books, and the quality of the facilities in my hostel is good. We have individual rooms for each person, and the quality of the mess food is good, but the overall quality of the food is not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were helpful; they clarify every single doubt. They have the knowledge to explain me. The teaching is qualified enough. The curriculum is relevant; it even covers the GATE subjects. The difficulty of the semester exam is too hard, and the pass percentage is around 80 percent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My engineering life at NIT Andhra Pradesh.

detailed_review.Placements: The students placed in my CSE course are 60 percent; the highest package offered is 44 LPA by Nvidia, with the average package being 6 LPA and the lowest package being 5 LPA. The top recruiting companies include Infosys, Nvidia, etc. The percentage of students who got internships is 60 percent, with internships secured at companies like PepsiCo.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities in our labs is are good, the classrooms are good and we have projectors in my classroom and we have a waste amount of books in my library and the facilities in my hostel is good we get hot water in our hostel and the food quality is good but the taste is average.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were helpful; they cleared our doubts in every class. They are qualified to teach us, and the curriculum is comprehensive, covering even the GATE subjects. However, the semester exams are too challenging, resulting in a pass percentage of around 80 percent in my CSE course.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College infrastructure is good, but the distance from the hostel to classes and labs is long.

detailed_review.Placements: The academic year is not over yet, but more than 50 percent of CSE students were placed. The highest package was from Nvidia. The next highest is Zscaler at 26 LPA, and 4 students got placed in it. PepsiCo hired 20 students for an internship of 50,000 per month and an FTE of 10.7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel infrastructure is good. Food quality is average. The course infrastructure for CSE is great; it covers the main CSE fundamentals and a few subjects that may help in further studies. Outing timings for hostels: local outings are from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. through the back gate.
detailed_review.Faculty: Semester exams are difficult and thought-provoking. Teachers are helpful and well-qualified. There will be 2 minor exams, 1 midterm exam, and 1 end exam for 2x10, 30, and 50 marks. Courses in the third year help the most, like web development, and AI and ML help with project work.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My B.Tech life in NIT Tadepalligudem.

detailed_review.Placements: The percentage of students placed in the CSE course is around 80; the highest package is 26.5 LPA offered by Zscalar Company; the average package is 7 LPA; and the least package is 5 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Nvidia, Infosys, etc.; the percentage of students placed for internships is around 50 percent; the top role offered is software engineering.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are good in our labs; we have i7 processors, integrated systems, and air conditioning in our labs; we have a lot of books in our library; the facilities of the hostels are good; we get hot water too; and the food quality is good, but the taste is average, and sometimes it's the worst.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers were good and they had knowledge to teach us; the quality of the teaching is good; the course curriculum is very relevant; it covers GATE subjects too; the difficulty of the semester exams is too hard; and the pass percentage is around 80.

admission.title: NIT Andhra Pradesh Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: NIT Andhra Pradesh admission 2025 is entrance-based. It  offers BTech, MTech, MBA, MS, and PhD courses in various specialisations. NIT Tadepalligudem placements 2020 recorded a total number of 346 students that registered for on-campus placements. Out of 346 students, 210 got placed in reputed companies which makes a 60.6% placement rate of NIT AP . The lowest package of NIT AP was INR 3.6 LPA and the highest package of NIT AP was INR 16 LPA .

faqs.question: What is the total tuition fee of the BTech programme at NIT Andhra Pradesh?
faqs.answer: For NIT Andhra Pradesh, the total tuition fee for the B.Tech course is INR 166,664, for students whose family income is between 1 lakh to 5 lakh. For below 1 lakh family income, the fees are charged less than 1 lakh for B.Tech admission at NIT Andhra Pradesh.

faqs.question: How expensive is studying at NIT Andhra Pradesh?
faqs.answer: The fee structure of NIT Andhra Pradesh is not very expensive and is affordable for the students. The fee structure for the NIT Andhra Pradesh course ranges between INR 75,000- INR 5 lakh. The multiple components of the fee structure include tuition, security deposit, and hostel fee.

faqs.question: How do I get a seat at NIT Andhra Pradesh?
faqs.answer: NIT Andhra Pradesh provides various programmes and specialisations to students. These courses are available in different streams. For obtaining NIT Andhra Pradesh admission, candidates are selected on the basis of entrance tests. For further details, candidates may visit the official website and learn more regarding the eligibility details for their preferred course choice. Accepted exams include JEE Main, GATE, UGC NET, CAT, CMAT, MAT, GMAT, etc.

faqs.question: What is the fee for B.Tech in Electrical Engineering at National Institute of Technology, Tadepalligudem?
faqs.answer: The total tuition fee structure for Bachelor of Technology in Electrical Engineering at National Institute of Technology Tadepalligudem is INR 5.00 Lakh (for 4 years). Hostel Fees: INR 2.48 Lakh Hostel fee is calculated on the basis of 1st semester. Actual amount may vary. Meal Plan is included in mentioned fee. faqs.question: How do I get admission to NIT Andhra Pradesh?
faqs.answer: To get admission at National Institute of Technology Andhra Pradesh students must have to qualify national entrance exams. For admission to its BTech programme, the NIT Narasarapet accepts the JEE Main scores, followed by the Joint Seat Allocation Authority ( JoSAA ) counselling. For admission to its M.Tech programme, NIT in Andhra Pradesh accepts the GATE scores. Furthermore, the NIT Andhra Pradesh MBA admission accepts national-level entrance exams such as CAT , MAT, GMAT , and others

data.title: NIT Andhra Pradesh Placements Report 2024
summary: The highest package offered stood at INR 44.1 LPA in 2024 placements. More than 174 recruiters visited the campus for placements. A total of offered 361 job offers were given to the students of the batch 2024. The placement rate was 74.55. Google, Amazon, Infosys, Wipro, IBM, Samsung, TCS, Accenture, etc. were some of the top recruiters.

The highest package offered was INR 47 LPA in 2023. The highest package was INR 47.3 LPA in 2022. The average package offered during the NIT Andhra Pradesh placements of 2023 was INR 8.13 LPA and INR 6.32 LPA in 2022. The placement rates recorded during both the seasons were 88.75% and 95.69%. The placement process at NIT Andhra Pradesh includes a pre-placement training and skill development program for the students.

college_info.college_name: PES College of Engineering: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Founded in 1962, PES College of Engineering is a public institute. It is located in Karnataka. The institute is accredited with AICTE. PES College of Engineering provides UG and PG courses in Full Time mode. It provides 33 courses across specialisations such as Aeronautical Engineering, Automobile Engineering, Ceramic Engineering, Civil Engineering and Computer Science. Some of the courses offered at this institute include B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM, M.Sc. and MCA. PES College of Engineering fees ranges between INR 84,270 to 7,44,444. The student intake for these courses is 1444. PES College of Engineering offers these course across fields such as Engineering, Business & Management Studies, IT & Software and Science. The median salary offered to students is INR 4,56,818. PES College of Engineering offers all the campus facilities to students.

college_info.college_name: PESCE Fees 2026
PES College of Engineering Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My journey with PESCE family.

detailed_review.Placements: As our college is an autonomous college affiliated with VTU. We have many campus placements as there will be more companies coming to our college to pick students for their companies. Our college has a very good placement history in the core and IT sectors too. But they will train us very well to make sure that we get placed in a good company by training us.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college infrastructure is the best. We have good hostel facilities and security system for students. We have Free Wi-Fi supply for students in the hostel. Our labs are well maintained and have well advanced equipment for the purpose of studies and practice. We have a good library facility too. Our library has a very good collection of books.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our college faculty members are very student-friendly. They treat and guide us like their own children. They explain again and again if we do not understand a topic. If we do not get it even after the repeated explanation, they will explain it to us in 1 to 1 interaction in the staffroom. Exams are conducted and verified in our college itself, so the papers will be set by our faculty members themselves, as our college is an autonomous college.
detailed_review.Other: Our college celebrates its fest once every year. We have a bus facility in our college for the sake of transportation of the students.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: People are good in my college, but the faculty members are very poor at explaining.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is very low, and those who get placed get placed at 3.5 to 5 LPA. The best packages go for like 8 to 10 LPA, which is not so good. Infosys, Accenture, Capgemini, Cognizant, and TCS are the main companies involved. There is a very low percentage of students who get real internships; most of them get them in their last year, just because. The students who get internships are the ones who get it based on their skills and themselves through the connections they make at events. SDE, UI/UX Developer, and Data Science will be offered when we graduate.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is Wi-Fi, labs, and a library, but they are not much use because they are just to clear your syllabus. However, there is a new lab with Mac machines, which are good, and we have done iOS classes there. The food is average for morning and afternoon, but very bad for night. Only 2 chapatis in the afternoon. The canteen is open till 5.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are not effective in my department; they are qualified but can't teach well. Most of them just speak in Kannada and then leave. However, we get notes for everything before exams, and getting a good score in the exam is very easy, so exams are good. The course doesn't make you placement-ready; not all of it.
detailed_review.Other: There are good events, and you can build a good network here; that is for sure.

reviews.course: B.E. in Information Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Life in PES College of Engineering, Mandya.

detailed_review.Placements: As in any college, the number of placements has decreased in our college too, still there are a few who are getting placed in good companies like Capgemini. Many are placed in TCS and many more. Placement department is conducting new programs like Super 100, iOS training, and many more programs to train students for placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Department is good the intake is 60 per year in ISE, and facilities are also good. Wi-Fi facility is provided throughout our campus, little problem with it in the hostel. Library is also good, we can take 3 books from there at a time. Canteen is average. Hostel is not so good for non-native students because most of the dishes are local food itself, and the rooms are average.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful about the curriculum and exams. Some of them have a good knowledge of the topics and beyond the curriculum also they help us in building projects and conduct training for students. Semester exams are a bit difficult because a lot of questions are asked which are objective and correction is done very strictly.
detailed_review.Other: Events like Pesco and Kannada Kalotsava are held. It will be a grand celebration, but unfortunately this year they do not do Pesco for some reason.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college has good placements and is well-maintained.

detailed_review.Placements: I think it may be 100%. The highest package is 40 LPA, and the lowest is 2 LPA. The top recruiting companies include Infosys, MNCs, etc. Around 70% get placed in internships. The top roles offered are in Robotics, VLSI, and Embedded Systems. Students who get placed in this course have high-paying jobs.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities in our department are good. The classrooms are well-maintained. Labs are well-established. The hostel is also good, but the food is not as much as I want. The sports facilities are very good. The canteen on campus is well-maintained. We also have medical facilities in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty is very helpful and well-qualified. The teaching quality is good. The course is very important for future technologies and students ready for industrial work. The exams are not very difficult, and if we study well, we can get good placements through this college.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course to get placed in VLSI companies that make semiconductor chips.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am thankful to our college for allowing us to participate in technical events.

detailed_review.Placements: The top role offered in our college is software development. Recently, the highest package is 21 LPA. The average salary package is about 5 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course are Tricon, IBM, Capgemini, Accenture, and Cognizant. Around 80% of students got placed in our college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is quite old but it is improving now. In washrooms, the cleanliness is bad. The canteen facility is also not good. The hostel facility is worth the money but the food is quite bad in the afternoon time. There are no medical facilities in the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Professors are well-qualified, but initially, they teach well. When the exams are near, they will go to speed and start to use PPT to finish the syllabus. The academic part is not helpful to become industry-ready as each semester's duration is less. 80% is the pass percentage in each semester.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the course as it offers both software and hardware knowledge. But I am struggling now, so I thought of shifting my interest towards software. Like other colleges, fests and other technical-related activities are conducted every year. I wish they could give more training for industry.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best college for average students.

detailed_review.Placements: 99% of students were placed last year. The average package is 3.4 LPA. Mass recruiters are TCS, Infosys, Tech Mahindra, and Accenture. Big companies like JP Morgan come rarely and IBM offers good placements. The students here are very diligent, smart, and very kind to the juniors.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel offers Wi-Fi, which is 30GB/month, you can use it however you want. The classrooms are decent and library is well and open during college hours. Hostel facilities are good. Quality of food in mess and canteen is too good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very knowledgeable, helpful, and qualified as well which is a good thing for the college. The course curriculum is relevant and it doesn't make the students industry-ready. It makes the students aware of the industry standards, which is quite good. The semester exams are stress-free.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I had a wide interest in tech. Events and fests are not regular in the college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Happy to be in this college I hope that I get placed in good company.

detailed_review.Placements: They provide placement classes for 1st semester so that everyone can get better internships and placements in their last year. They also help us with communication skills and character building that is necessary for our interviews and the criteria needed for it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Well-maintained hostel and canteens. The food prepared is very hygienic and worth the price. When it comes to classrooms, they are well maintained with smart boards in each classroom. AC is also available in the labs. Library is very well-maintained with lots of useful books. It gives us a peaceful environment to concentrate on reading.
detailed_review.Faculty: We have experienced faculty members and we come across 8 semesters where all the branches come across EC, EEE, IoT, physics, chemistry, and principal of C program. We have 2 internals and one-semester exam that has been conducted each semester. Faculty members help us in clearing the doubts and providing special classes for the weaker ones.
detailed_review.Other: They conduct 2-3 fests that go on for 3-7 days Kannda, Kalotsava, Pesco, freshers day, etc.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: 2024 pass out from PES College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: About 105 companies took part in the recruitment drive of PS College of engineering. From it 75 percentage of companies were MNC and remaining were start ups. All the placement preparations including mock interviews we made prepared by the placement crew.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Policies like insurance were arranged by the college and it was renewed every year by them. Social responsible clubs and students union, representative selection were encouraged by the college management. Classrooms are highly ventilated and spacious has the capacity to hold 200 students at a time.
detailed_review.Faculty: More passionate teachers with higher qualifications in the respective subjects. They are multi-taskers and hard workers and can do multiple tasks at a time. And teachers were more strict in handling the attendance records. Taking too much leave results in penalties for writing examinations.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely satisfied with the college's greenery.

detailed_review.Placements: Seniors have been placed in several companies like L&T. The highest package is around 9 LPA. It depends upon students to apply for internships for a company. The overall support is provided by the department. Top roles offered is Electrical Circuit Design Engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have 5 to 6 lab rooms, and of course, a library where we can study and borrow books for reference. Moreover, the hostel is good and we can accommodate compared to others. Food is also good. For sports, we can participate in any activity. Everything is good here.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable. Their teaching quality is good. Semester exams at our college depend on the difficulty of the paper. If it is easy, we can score higher, if it is difficult, our marks will be less. It makes students to be industry-ready.
detailed_review.Other: We got admitted here through CET, by hook or crook. We came to this college because of this course. There is nothing to improve in this college, everything is fine. College organizes many fests, like Jnana Cauvery, Kannada Kalasotsava, and many more.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good faculty members, when it comes to fees collection, they will be bit rude.

detailed_review.Placements: 80% of students will get placed in our college. Top recruiting companies are Intel, Qualcom, and many others. 70 percent of students will get internships every year. The college campus is good, and I suggest others to join too. Now VLSI is booming, so that training is going on.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good infrastructure. Our college is full of greenery. The people working love greenery could join our college. Faculty members are really good. During internals time, they will support below-average students to score good marks, and they support other activities like NSS and sports too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful, qualified, and knowledgeable too. Yes, the course curriculum is relevant, it makes students industry-ready. Also, the students should go through the hackathons and events where they will get more practical knowledge than in class what they are teaching.
detailed_review.Other: I choose this course because in this course, we can enter to the core companies like in the semiconductor field soo.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: Average ratings for placement, infrastructure, and the overall course.

detailed_review.Placements: Industrial experience and other exposure were happened thrice in a year. Around 89% of students from the department of MCA succeeded by the placement drives. The highest salary package offered on campus drives was 17.5 LPA.
detailed_review.Faculty: Sometimes teachers gave special attention to students who were lower in their academic performance. Other than that all students went through the common lectures. We were appreciated by teachers when we did something newer than the others.
detailed_review.Other: Funds were arranged by the management to organize any festivals, fests, or events within the institutions. They gave responsibilities to the students to organize such events successfully and we approached teachers in case we had any trouble.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Excellence in academic coaching.

detailed_review.Placements: The internships are arranged by the staff community based on the students' interests. They won't force the students, but they never fail to provide opportunities. The Department of Mechanical Engineering got the maximum chances in the field of designing and testing, with the initial package of Rs. 4,80,000 per year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel circumstances are easy to accept for the freshers and the newcomers. We can approach the hostel in charge without any hesitation for all kinds of needs. The bus is fully air-conditioned, with two drivers who are experienced in the field of driving.
detailed_review.Faculty: Because of the faculty members who were working here, I was able to get first rank in the overall Department of Mechanical Engineering, 2023. They were helpful to us in timely needs. They never get bored answering our questions and clarifying our doubts every time.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of PES EC campus. It's the best college.

detailed_review.Placements: I'm studying B.Tech in EC at the PES campus in Bengaluru. It is a very nice campus. Course is very good. Most of the students get placed. The highest salary package offered is around 60 LPA. The lowest salary package is around 5 LPA. Every student gets internship opportunities. Top recruiting company so far is Apple.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is good. Classrooms are also very good. They are well-furnished with digital learning available. Hostel is very nice and rooms are provided with all the necessary facilities. Food in the hostel mess is very nice and better than any other college. We can definitely like the food here. Wi-Fi is best and always constant.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and knowledgeable. All the faculty members are very much experienced. The education system at PES is one of the best in Bengaluru. Exam patterns and evaluation methods are very good. Exams are a bit difficult and perfect. Everything is perfect for sure.
detailed_review.Other: I like coding, so I chose the Computer Science and Engineering course. Fests and college events are really nice.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the college, but one has to work hard on their own to secure high packages.

detailed_review.Placements: I am Sail Sagar from the ECE branch. Having joined this college this year, I feel capable of answering this question. Placements are average. The highest salary package offered is 25 LPA and the lowest salary package offered ranges from 3 LPA-4 LPA. Top recruiting companies include Infosys, Wipro, TCS, Japanese company (exact name unknown), Air Force Software, and many more. This year, one student secured an internship at DE SHAW (off-campus), and two seniors are interning at Air Force Software Development (on-campus),and many more. ECE is the best-performing branch of this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has well-developed infrastructure and practical laboratories are well-equipped, including the Chemistry lab, Physics lab, MATLAB lab, and CAED lab. All are well-maintained and we also have smart classes and well-equipped library. Hostel facilities are nice as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are helpful and coordinate with students whenever one requires their assistance. They are well-qualified, with most holding Master's degrees and some having PhDs. Their teaching methodology is also good. Course curriculum is neither outdated nor completely up-to-date, but placement classes are provided from the first year itself, along with seminars and more. Semester exams are not very difficult if we study regularly.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because ECE is the best-performing branch of this college. ECE provides opportunities to get into both software and core jobs. We have an event named PESCO, it is very well organised. Extracurricular activities like dancing, sports, etc.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really good infrastructure and facilities .

detailed_review.Placements: Above the CGPA of 8 will have a better opportunity to get placed. The highest package is 25lpa and the lowest will be 3lpa. The companies can be Bosch, Accenture, and many other startups. Around 89% of students get internships every year from the ECE branch. The students can get the position of software developer, or data analyst, and in core companies, they get more opportunities according to their knowledge.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Good classrooms and labs, a vast library, and also 24x7 Wi-Fi available in any corner of the campus. The quality of food available in the canteen is average. Medical assistance is available all the time. Sports grounds are very vast and beautiful anyone in need or anyone who needs to practice anytime, ground will be available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and give the assistance at anytime. Since the course mainly focuses on hardware people can also get into software according to their interest. Faculty members give knowledge in both ways. The exams will be at a moderate level. The faculty members are highly qualified, with many holding PhDs in their respective fields. Most professors are approachable and encourage discussions, but a few rely heavily on theoretical teaching rather than practical applications.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: PES - People who somehow struggled with their JEE Main exam.

detailed_review.Placements: Most people in college end up taking CS, but a small percentage also take AIML and EC. They recently closed the mechanical branch. The highest salary package offered last year was around 60 LPA, which is a big deal. The average salary package offered is above 10 LPA, so I think it's pretty solid. Almost every student gets internships. Many IT companies including Apple, Amazon, and Flipkart come to our campus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a good area named MRD Bloack for extra-curricular activities. We have one of the best gyms in Bangalore. Our college has multiple well-made badminton courts, pool tables, arts, carrom, etc. The mess food might not be the best, but it's good on certain days. We have exceptional medical facilities. There is a full-fledged hospital on our campus which provides free checkups for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers might be a little hard to bear, but a few teachers named Faisal, Prajwala, Swati, and more are genuinely amazing people and care about students' education. The curriculum does feel a little stiff and lengthy at first, but soon we realise, it is helpful for placements. The 1st year is almost like a school.
detailed_review.Other: Honestly, in this day and age, everyone wants CS so that's my main reason, what I like about it is the time I get to spend on my laptop instead of books, AI makes it a lot easier to understand things. But it would have been nice if we got to choose our class timings and which classes to take. A lot of things in our college feel a little forced. Events here are amazing including our main event named Maaya.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering (Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning)
reviews.review_title: Feedback about PES College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students who get placed in the 5th or 6th semester get high packages, and those who get placed after that get a bit lower packages. But in this college you should definitely have a good CGPA; then only can you sit for placements. Exams are very tough.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We do have all world-class infrastructure and all sports facilities except swimming pools. Wi-Fi is good. The first-year campus doesn't have AC, but from the second year on, all campuses have AC. Hostels do not have AC options. The food and hostel are good. You will have options to change from veg to non-veg every month, i.e., you will have 2 messes, and in the end, you can book which mess you want.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty and curriculum are very good. Exams are very tough; you feel so much stress about it. There will be 2 semesters, and you will have 2 mid semesters for each semester; i.e., each year you will have 4 mid semesters and 2 semesters. All classes that you attend will be present in the pesuacademy, which is a website of the college.
detailed_review.Other: The one who thinks to enjoy the whole B.Tech life, I'm sorry, this college is not for you. If you want to go out with a good package, if you are serious about your career, then you can consider this college.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: PES College of Engineering review.

detailed_review.Placements: In our year, there were a total of 120 students in the computer science and engineering branch. About 80 percent of the students were placed. The highest package offered was 14 lakhs per annum, and the average package was around 5 lakhs per annum. The top recruiting companies were Infosys, Accenture, and CoreEl Technologies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure for our course is top-notch. Classrooms are spacious and well-equipped, and each student gets their own Wi-Fi credentials. Labs are kept spotlessly clean and are air-conditioned. The library is a quiet and peaceful place to study. The hostel infrastructure is also first-rate.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers have a lot of experience, often 20 years or more, in their particular subject area. The curriculum includes industry-relevant subjects and real-time running subjects. The teachers really know their subjects and explain them in depth so that we can understand them clearly.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good college for average students with good placements in 2021-2023.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are decent here and there are many opportunities offered by some companies . You must meet there CGPA criteria to sit in their placements. Generally here, the average package offered is 6.5 LPA and many mass recruiters come here for placement and it's quite good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is wifi available giving a speed of 2-3 mbps, which is quite bad; normal internet would give a speed of 30 mbps. The library is good and classrooms are decent. The facilities at the hostel are Wi-Fi, a heater room, a TV room and a medical facility.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty are patient and well educated, whereas they are also helpful and provide notes for you to study and also encourage you to study. The semester exams are not hard; you must study well before 4-5 days of the exam. You would easily be a 9 pointer and it will also be good for you to focus on your other studies.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I had an interest in the ECE branch and also loved semiconductors. My course should improve some curriculum and there are not many fests organized in college; just there are 3-4 fests in 1 semester.

reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Decent infrastructure and good placement.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements here are decent, but in the recent two years, due to recession, companies are not coming as much, and placements have not been that good. In the last two years, a guy got placed at 24 LPA in Japan through on-campus placements, and some also secured paid internship offers from companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel is good, but the mess doesn’t have much North Indian food. There are North Indian people here, but they don’t get what they want; the dishes available are mostly South Indian. However, if you want your campus to be nice, it is great, filled with greenery and fresh air.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty here is amazing and very helpful. The HODs are good; they assist everyone a lot. The only catch is that most of them speak Kannada, so people coming from North India may face some issues in communicating, but the teaching is good, and the teachers also speak in English.
detailed_review.Other: There are fests organized. For this year, three fests are scheduled to be organized in 2024-2025, along with many sports events. The seniors here are good and act as great motivators.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility to get admission in PES College of Engineering for UG/PG courses?
faqs.answer:
PES College of Engineering has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility B.E. / B.Tech Candidate must have passed Diploma in Engineering M.E./M.Tech Candidates must have passed qualifying examination or equivalent examination as prescribed by the Competent Authority and obtained an aggregate minimum of 50% marks (45% of marks in case of SC, ST and Category-I candidates) taken together in all the subjects of all the years/ semesters of the Degree Examination from any recognised institute/university.
Final year students can also apply on provisional basis.
Candidates must have valid GATE score. MBA/PGDM Candidates must have passed Bachelor's degree of minimum of 3 years duration examination or equivalent and obtained an aggregate minimum of 50% marks (45% of marks in case of SC, ST and Category-I of Karnataka candidates).
Final year students can also apply on provisional basis. MCA Candidate must have passed any recognised BCA / Bachelor degree in Computer Science Engineering or equivalent degree and obtained an aggregate minimum of 50% marks (45% of marks in case of SC, ST and Category-I of Karnataka candidates) taken together in all the subjects in all the years of the Degree Examination from any recognised institute/university.
OR
Candidate must have passed B.Sc. / B.Com / B.A. with Mathematics at 10 + 2 level or at Graduation level (with additional bridge courses as per the norms of the concerned University) and obtained an aggregate minimum of 50% marks (45% of marks in case of SC, ST and Category-I of Karnataka candidates) taken together in all the subjects in all the years of the Degree Examination from any recognised institute/university.
Final year students can also apply on provisional basis. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

faqs.answer: Courses offerred by PES College of Engineering are approved by eminent Government bodies like AICTE. The combined seats available for courses offered at PES College of Engineering goes up to 1204. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

college_info.college_name: DY Patil University, Navi Mumbai: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Ranking

highlights.summary:
DY Patil Deemed to be University, Navi Mumbai was established in 2002. It is accredited by NAAC & NABH. DY Patil Deemed to be University, has two campuses in Mumbai and Pune within Maharashtra. The institute offers courses of undergraduate, postgraduate, diploma, certificate and research levels. The institute offers these courses through its various schools which include the School of Architecture, Ayurveda, Biotechnology, Bioinformatics and Physiotherapy, among others.
Students of DY Patil Deemed to be University can also apply for scholarships which are offered on merit basis. According to data available on the official website, the highest package offered during DY Patil Navi Mumbai Engineering placements 2022 stood at INR 15 LPA. Candidates check the highlights of DY Patil Deemed to be University, Navi Mumbai in the following table:
Merit, Merit-cum-means-based and National Scholarships
For more information about Padmashree Dr. D.Y. Patil Vidyapeeth, Navi Mumbai Fest check out the below videos:

college_info_program.intro: The BTech, BDS and MBA are some of the top courses offered by DY Patil Navi Mumbai. For admissions, it is required to satisfy course-specific eligibility and selection conditions. Sudents must score between 45% - 60% aggregate to get admission in BTech. On the other hand, for BDS admissions, students need to score 50% aggregate. Students can check the popular programmes offered at DY Patil Navi Mumbai in the table provided below:
