PCCOE Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not a bad college. They focus more on technical knowledge, a strict college, and good infrastructure

detailed_review.Placements: 40 percent of students got placed this year. The highest for ENTC is 6 LPA, the lowest is 1 LPA, and the average is 4 LPA. The top recruiting companies are TCS and Wipro. Almost 90 percent of students got internships in companies like Forbes Marshall, TCS, and Wipro. The leftover students are interns in the college itself.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Sufficient facilities are available. As I am a local, I don't know much about the hotel. We have good facilities for badminton, basketball, and volleyball. We have two big playground trainers who have good knowledge of two physiotherapists. There is no facility for indoor games.
detailed_review.Faculty: A few teachers are not experienced, but a few are good teaching quality is good, and they are supportive. Some are strict, the exams are good, like papers are of 30 marks, they give a question bank, mostly questions are from the question bank itself, and the syllabus is specially designed in consideration of current industry requirements.
detailed_review.Other: The best about the course is the good, practical knowledge, and events are good because of the good sponsor.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering, Pune, Maharashtra.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is pretty good in terms of students here, but not good in placements, as other students from PCU University also sit in the college campus placements. Due to this, the college has been blocked by many companies, and that's what I think is a major no for this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is pretty good, as compared to other Pune colleges. It's not too big, but a pretty okay size, also good grounds and facilities and also the classrooms are well maintained, not very high class but very good as compared to its competition.
detailed_review.Faculty: There is not a huge difference in the difficulty level on exams and in college, but the exams are almost easy and use relatively grading, which is not good, as any student or any person tries as much as he/she can, they still won't be able to get good grades. Also, this hurts in campus placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good college, bad placement, and no college life.

detailed_review.Placements: The college is pretty good in terms of students here, but not good in placements, as other students from PCU University also sit in the college campus placements. Due to this, the college has been blocked by many companies, and that's what I think is a major no for this college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is pretty good compared to other Pune colleges. It's not too big but a pretty okay size, also good grounds and facilities, and also the classrooms are well maintained, not very high class but very good as compared to its competition.
detailed_review.Faculty: There is not a huge difference in the difficulty level on exams and in college, but the exams are almost easy and use relative grading, which is not good, as any student or any person tries as much as he/she can, they still won't be able to get good grades. Also, this hurts in campus placements.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: In our college, we have an Information Technology branch.

detailed_review.Placements: I am currently in my 3rd year, and I am actually receiving internship offers, and we have to prepare according to them. To get internships or placements, we have to work hard, even though we are in our house. Whatever you are smart, you should know about the companies that will hire you.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the special IT Department is very good. The campus is so well-maintained and particularly green, clean, and well-maintained, and especially the IT Department building is so well-maintained and clean. Talking about the new engineering building, it is there for library and computer engineering, particularly computer engineering will be given to the new building.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are very good and supportive, and if there is a problem, like teachers targeting, they will help you, and you can complain against the teachers. If there is a problem, but if you cannot do studies, then they will also target you.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Good Placements and supportive faculty members.

detailed_review.Placements:
Good Placements 
TCS, Infosys, uber
4-5 avg package
AI ML engineer, Cloud Engineer, Software Developed
Various big mass recruiters companies are generally selects the students, The Training and placements offices are also good, Their is various tests of aptitude, dsa also.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Everything is good, Wi-Fi available 
classrooms are nice
mess canteen are good, medical facilities also available
Wi-Fi is available to all labs, stationary also available, good mess and hostel, sports are held on february and march, various types of events in this pccoe college.
detailed_review.Faculty:
Helpful faculty members and students cooperative, good to have this college
their is 75% attendance criteria. The courses makes the students industry ready, everything is fine and students are helping, hackathons and all is okay, I suggest do admission in this college.
detailed_review.Other: My batch is nice and everything is okay, mixed of CSE and aiml parts of course also various scholarships, sports, connectivity, Training and Placement is nice.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Not satisfied with the current placement scenario, but there is good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Very few students get on-campus internship opportunities starting from the 2nd semester of the 3rd year onwards. Mass hiring companies visit the college for placement, offering 3.5-7 LPA from low-tier companies. Others like PTC, B.M.C., and Barclays may offer 10-13 LPA. The highest off-campus offer is 61 LPA from Uber. It doesn't matter, the median salary range is 4-7 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the IT department is very good.  The library, classrooms, and everything are good. Labs have AC, washrooms are clean, and hygiene is maintained. Other facilities include a lot of electives that are offered to you every semester, wherein you can study topics of your choice. The mess of the hostel is 0/10: unclean and unhygienic. The canteen is good. We have 2 canteens in college. Sports and games provide good exposure, which you will get.
detailed_review.Faculty: Some teachers have good knowledge of their core subjects, while others are not up to the mark. The course curriculum is updated and improved. It does, but you are just given the head start on any concept or topic, then it depends on you how deep you dig into it, as per your area of interest. Semester exams - no need to worry. You are provided with question banks a month before the end-of-semester exam, which is the only written exam that takes place in the entire semester. A relatively grading system is in place, which makes it difficult to score.
detailed_review.Other: It would be better if the unnecessary part of the college course was removed, like the Constitution of India and the community engagement project, which waste a lot of time. Also, the college should not consider attendance for giving internal assessment marks.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Good in the past, bad in present, maybe if proper action is taken, it will be very good in future.

detailed_review.Placements: It is a pretty good college but 1 big major problem is that in placement, the college allows all other colleges to sit in the placements. It's bad that the reputation of the college decreases in the eyes of companies. Companies think they are recruiting only PCCOE College students but that's not the truth so be aware, pick other colleges that don't have this system.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has good hostel, bad food but a costly hostel. Hostel food is absolutely messed up. Hostel has AC and 3 people sharing. All the things related to hostel are absolutely good and great. It's costly but absolutely worth every penny. But mess food is 10/10 absolutely bad.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are very okay. They have relatively grading which is bad actually as it makes it difficult to score for everyone. It's not that great attendance and college uniform is compulsory which is fine but the teachers and students ain't that good personally. All are just bad in the knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: We do not have good campus life, and also not enough campus activities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Satisfied with the college because the placements are pretty good.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement is good in college. The T&P cell is active and comes with activities for students to be industry-ready. The highest package is 65 LPA by Uber, and the average is around 7 LPA-8 LPA for CS IT. Overall, it's a good college, you could consider it.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All buildings across the campus have LAN, and the hostel has Wi-Fi, though it is restricted like social media won't work on it, but browsers work, so it is great for productivity and the hostel is also quiet, as it has air conditioning, and rooms are also pretty good.
detailed_review.Faculty: The Curriculum is designed well, as it is designed according to industry standards, and it is an autonomous college, so it is not very dependent on SPPU's curriculum. Faculty is also good, some faculty are good while some are alright, but that's the case for pretty much all colleges, and the exams are also somewhat chill
detailed_review.Other: I am gonna be passing out in the 2028 batch. The information technology course covers most topics that are required for placements. The timing can be better as it sometimes can be 9:00 AM-5:00 PM, and uniform is compulsory, though not strictly imposed. Events are organized every now and then, both tech and non-tech, so it's pretty good in that case.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Good placements, great faculty, beautiful campus, and informative courses are offered.

detailed_review.Placements: 2025 batch students have been placed for AIML. A total of 83% of students are placed. Out of 90 students, 75 are placed, with the highest salary package of 33 LPA. Average salary package of 6.5 LPA. Capgemini, Accenture, and new private companies are top recruiters.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College have big classrooms which are spacious and also have projectors and big blackboards. Computer labs contain a proper number of computers, Wi-Fi, a mouse, keyboard, and are in working conditions. Also have a library with several books that are related to the syllabus. Which are related to a finance mindset. College has a playground as well as a tennis court. Canteen is good, the price range is normal, and food quality is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is good. Teachers are knowledgeable. They teach properly with a number of examples so that students can relate to that thing. Courses offered are very good, which is important nowadays. Course includes several projects, through which students get industry-ready. If studied properly, then the semester exams are not difficult. To pass, you require a total of 40% of the marks and pass all the subjects. Courses like life skills and universal human values improve the lifestyle of the student.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this branch at the PCCOE college because this is the era of AI. Course offers advanced Python, DSA, and Java, which are required to build AI. The connectivity of the college is good, you can come by train, by bus, and by auto. Metro station is about 1.7 KM from the college, and the Akurdi railway station is at a distance of 500 m from the college. Area around the college is very beautiful. The events like Navratra, Spectrum, and Swartarang are held in the college, which gives the students a chance to enjoy.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college with great faculty and good infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 200 students got selected for ENTC via JEE and CET scores. The average package is good. Top recruiting companies for my domain are Capgemini, Amazon, Wipro, etc. Many unpaid internships are offered initially as college further offers paid internships referred properly with all help provided.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Great facilities and good big campus with continuous development. Medical facilities are great with even a club conducting blood donation camps. Mess food is hygienic and healthy. Overall great infrastructure and facilities for students with all required assistance and help provided properly.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers explain everything in depth also doubts are cleared properly with great teachers. They are highly qualified faculty having immense core knowledge. ENTC being a core course is a must and base for automation and industries. The way it is taught adds more value. The difficulty of exams is moderate and very high if regular lectures are attended no extra tuition is required.
detailed_review.Other: Fascinated by embedded systems and IoT joining this course adds benefits adding value and providing me path for my future goals. More practical knowledge for the first year is needed from ty labs and practicals are best. Events and campus surroundings are very comfortable and people around you are very helpful, join this college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: PCCOE - Good placements, experienced facilities, and excellent infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 240 seats are there for computer engineering course. Top companies recruited are TCS, IBM, Tech Mahindra, Accenture, Cognizant, Patni, Infosys, HP, Wipro, and Capgemini. The highest package is around 61 LPA, and average salary is around 8 LPA. 70-80% of students got internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided here are excellent. All the labs have a working computer with enough network speed. There is a library in which you can read any book according to your subject. There is a large studying place where you can sit and study.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful. They clear all the questions and doubts you asked and complete the syllabus within the time. The course is relevant and it makes students industry-ready. The difficulty level in the semester exams is moderate. Passing percentage is around 40%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: PCCOE Akurdi reviewed by a student.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 80% of students get placed. The highest package to date is 61 LPA offered by Uber. The average package is about 6 LPA. Capgemini, KPIT, Infosys, and Wipro are top recruiters. The criteria for placements are a 6.5 CGPA along with no current backlog.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities are decent, and the same goes for the hostel and the quality of food served in the mess. The food served in the canteen is good. There is a network range problem on campus, especially in the canteens. The classrooms are decent, similar to classrooms in school. The campus has two grounds and a basketball court, which is also used for badminton. One ground is solely used for football, while on the other ground, a variety of sports are played and practiced. Additionally, there are two box nets present for cricket. A gym is also present in the boys' hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality is decent, except for some teachers who teach really well. The course curriculum is relevant and gives a glimpse of the ongoing trends in the industry. Practical projects are included. The difficulty of exams is decent, and one can pass by doing the bare minimum. As the institute is an autonomous institution, question papers are designed and checked by college faculty members, so most of the questions come from the question banks that faculty members provide.
detailed_review.Other: Events take place now and then. The college has an annual fest called Swartarang, a five-day cultural fest, and a sports fest called Sangarsh, which lasts for a month. There is a fest called Spectrum, which is organized by first-year students and is only for first-year students. The campus is in Akurdi, which is one of the nicest localities in PCMC. Akurdi Bus Stop and the railway station are about 700m away from the campus.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Truth of PCCOE college.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 80% of the students are placed in my college. A mediocre package for my college is almost 4 lacs, the lowest is 2 lacs, and the highest is almost 40 lacs. My branch that is mechanical has a package of 4,500,000. My college offers internship and many programmes.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of college and hostel is fairly decent. Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries are good. The faculty members are also good and helpful. The canteen can be a little bit better but it is manageable. Medical facilities are great and sports and games happen.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers and faculty members are helpful and always there for you. Teaching quality is decent. I can understand, but others can't, in my opinion, is relatively relevant to your branch. Making students industry-ready semester exams are moderate, not too hard. The passing percentage is 40%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning
reviews.review_title: Really good college and good placement. TPO of college is sir Shitalkumar Rawandale.

detailed_review.Placements: PCET has placed above 22000 students placed in all over India in the last few years through on/off campus/pool campus drives. Around 600 recruitment drives are generally conducted throughout the year. PCCOE is accredited by reputed companies like TCS, KPIT Technologies, Capgemini, and Wipro for placements. The highest salary package offered is 32 LPA, and the minimum salary package offered is 3.8 LPA. Currently, in 2024, 218 students have been placed in various companies. In 2024, the highest salary package offered is 22 LPA, and the average salary package offered is 6.54 LPA. The median salary package offered is 5.75 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities are available in college like Wi-Fi, labs, and i7 pc. Wi-Fi doesn't connect directly to mobile but we can connect it to our laptop by LAN. For every department, there are different labs. I'm not in the hostel, so I don't know much about it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Passing criteria is 40%. From entire faculty team, around 80% of faculty members are Dr., Ph.D. level. Semester exams are tough. College is autonomous, because of this we fail. After the semester exam in 15-20 days, re-exam is conducted by college. Attendance is mandatory in college. Faculty members are very good at teaching as well as understanding students' problems.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because in the future AI use will increase.

reviews.course: Master of Computer Applications (MCA)
reviews.review_title: I like the teaching quality by teachers and they are quite friendly.

detailed_review.Placements: The internship is provided by college in the 3rd and 4th year of academics. Many companies provide internships in our college, such as Microsoft, DLF, Titles Park, etc. There is no need to worry about internships in our college. Projects are important in the final year because the project decides our good job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has different types of clubs, from dance and music to robotics and coding clubs. there are different types of books in the library, which we can access anytime, both online and offline. College also have student website portals for paying fees and checking attendance.
detailed_review.Faculty: Students are of good quality. They provide better faculty members. The relationship between students and staff is very good. The staff acts friendly to students. Exams are easier to pass because the staff and management provide good education.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied for placements and crowd.

detailed_review.Placements: This college holds a very good placements record, where the maximum placement was up to 62 lakhs per annum, whereas the average placements were about seven to eight lakhs per annum. The top recruiting off-campus were Uber. In computing engineering and information technology, the highest placements showed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Although the overall size of the campus is small, it is close to 16 acres. All the buildings are equipped with Wi-Fi, computers, and various other labs. The library and study hall are also present on the campus. Hostel rooms are also spacious, with medical facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, the teachers are helpful and highly qualified. The course curriculum gets updated every year to be relevant with current market trends. The semester exams include practical exams, viva, as well as theory papers, lab submissions, all combined. And yes, they are difficult.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Great college, excellent placements, and good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: Most students get placed in top companies like TCS, Infosys, and Accenture. Many also secure internships, especially in the top roles in computer engineering. PCCoE is a reputed engineering college in Pune, known for its excellent placement cell, which has successfully navigated economic recessions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Quality of food in mess could improve slightly, but everything else is very good. Hot water is generally available in hostels. Both boys' and girls' hostels, along with their mess facilities, are satisfactory. Wi-Fi is restricted to a few websites but is generally accessible for all essential ones. Classrooms are well-organized and properly arranged.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teaching quality is good, though sometimes strict. Most students pass their exams. Teachers are highly interactive and qualified, with some still pursuing their Masters. Faculty members for Computer Science Engineering are especially highly reputed and excellent.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Civil Engineering
reviews.review_title: Best college in Pune for Civil Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The Civil Department at this college has relatively few students interested in campus placements compared to other departments like CS and IT. About 20% of the 80 students in the batch sought placement assistance, and most of them received offers. The highest salary package in 2023 was 5.5 LPA, offered by a core civil domain company based in Mumbai. Top recruiters were Worley, which offers roles such as junior engineer and others.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The classrooms at this college are equipped with basic computers and projectors for teaching purposes, and green chalkboards are used for teaching most of the time. However, the labs are well-equipped with all the necessary computers and equipment for the various departments, as per their course requirements. The libraries have Wi-Fi, but access is restricted to those with campus IDs. There is no free Wi-Fi, and only academic websites are accessible. The hostel has excellent facilities, including Wi-Fi and regular cleaning services.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are great, as many of them are Ph.D. holders, and some of them are pursuing it. They all know about the civil engineering industry to the core. Their experience adds a lot of depth to the concepts they teach. The curriculum is relevant to the industry standards, but it depends on the students if they really understand it, and then only they can apply it. The semester exams are medium-level difficult, not much of a burden for a student who can study regularly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering .

detailed_review.Placements: The average package offered by Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering is 4–8 LPA, and the highest package offered by PCCOE is 60 LPA. Top recruiting companies are LinkedIn, Google, HSBC, and many more. About 85% of students got placed at PCCOE, which is really nice.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi facility has high security; only educational sites can be viewed through the Wi-Fi. Labs and classrooms are well-developed. Talking about mess food, the PCCOE mess offers the best food as compared to other colleges. The sports facility is also very good. I really like the college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very good, and the curriculum is also nice. Semesters in college are strict. The curriculum is according to the NEP (New Education Policy). The teachers are well-qualified, such as most of the teachers having qualified for a Ph.D. and done their master's at renowned institutes.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is an underrated college, and if you have taken admission in this college, you will enjoy it.

detailed_review.Placements: I don't know much about the placements, but in 2024, a total of 1000+ students were placed with pretty good packages. The highest was 60 lakh, and that was off-campus. I am in the Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning branch, which was formed 4 years ago, so this year's placements are for the first batch, and those results are not announced yet. However, according to the seniors, the placements are really good this year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college has a total area of 13 acres, which is pretty small. We have 4 colleges on one campus (1. Engineering, 2. MBA, 3. Architecture, 4. Polytechnic), but it doesn't affect us, as the campus has all facilities from hostels to playgrounds and the latest teaching technology. For Wi-Fi, we get it on laptops but not on mobile phones, and there are warnings for other SIM cards other than Airtel due to very poor network coverage.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching quality is very good. The teachers are experienced and fully supportive. The college curriculum is focused on the overall development of students in knowledge and industry readiness. Semester exams are not that hard, and the teachers are supportive, so if you have any problems, you can contact them.
detailed_review.Other: I am in the AIML branch, and our college tries to cover all the required skills if you are really willing to learn. Regarding fests, we have clubs for each branch and others related to student development. Small events for coding culture and skill development are carried out throughout the year. The annual fest is also held in January, which is very good. Facilities like transportation, food stalls, D-Mart, and malls are really close, so there are no issues.

college_info.college_name: PCCOE Admission 2025: Fees, Eligibility, Application & Selection

admission.title: PCCOE Admission Overview 2025
admission.overview_text: PCCOE admissions are based on entrance-exam scores of the candidates. The college consides scores in JEE Main, MHT CET, MAH MCA CET, etc. for admission to specific programmes. Pimpri Chinchwad College of Engineering offers seats to candidates through CAP or Common Admission Process conducted by State Common Entrance Test Cell, Government of Maharashtra. The college offers courses at UG and PG levels in Engineering and Computer Applications streams in affiliation with SPPU . Interested candidates can apply for the accepted entrance test and participate in counselling process for a seat in the college.

college_info.college_name: Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology is a private institute, established in 1998 in Vijayawada, Andhra Pradesh. Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology is approved by AICTE and offers a total of 15 courses at UG and PG levels in 10 specialisations such as Aeronautical Engineering, Artificial Intelligence & Machine Learning, Civil Engineering, Communications Engineering and Computer Science Engineering. Furthermore, it offer courses such as B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA in Full Time mode. Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology fee structure includes a total tuition fee ranging from INR 1,20,000 to 4,20,000. Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology has an annual seat intake of 978 for all the programmes. It offers courses, in streams such as Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software. As per the recent Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology placement records, the average median salary at the Institute is around INR 3,53,846. The institute has a safe and well-equipped campus with all the advanced facilities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: I am absolutely satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students got placements in our course. The highest package in our course is like 7LPA, and the lowest package is about 3LPA. Top recruiting companies in our department are like Hyundai, Medha Servo, TCS, etc. Most of the students got an internship in our course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure available in our department are good, Wi-Fi and classrooms are good. No well-stocked library in our college. The quality of the facilities in our hostel is good. The quality of the food available in our canteen is good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and qualified. The teaching quality is also good. The course is curriculum-relevant only. It makes the student industry-ready. The semester exams are not that tough. We can score by reading from textbooks there in the library.
detailed_review.Other: I love to work in the mechanical field.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: My college life, the way I spent it, and things that I know about it.

detailed_review.Placements: Since the placement drive is in process, nearly 30-40% of students who are eligible have been selected for placements. In our college, the main recruitment is done from service-based companies like TCS, Accenture, Cognizant, Wipro, etc. Product-based companies like Amazon, Flipkart, etc., also hire students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are only provided for girls from the college side. There are many PGs at just a walkable distance from the college for boys. There is good availability of Wi-Fi. The library is present. It has basic games like shuttle, throwball, and basketball.
detailed_review.Faculty: Many faculty members working here are pure professionals. They have a lot of experience in this field. They are PhD holders and doctorates. The course curriculum of the college is affiliated with JNTUK, and the syllabus will be based on the JNTUK government board. There are 2 mid exams in a semester and 2 semester exams in a year, with internal and external for labs.
detailed_review.Other: I chose CSE because of my personal interest in this field, and it is good at this college. Maybe the canteen food is not that good, so the canteen needs to be modified. Events and fests are very few when compared to other colleges and universities.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of my college, with honesty.

detailed_review.Placements: From 2023 to 2027, about 85% of students from the Information Technology branch are placed, with packages ranging from 3 to 12 LPA, and an average of ₹3.5 lpa. Top recruiters include TCS, Infosys, Wipro, Accenture, and HTC. Around 60% of students got internships with firms like TCS, Efftronics, and Hexaware. Common roles offered are software developer, data analyst, and testing engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our IT department has Wi-Fi-enabled labs and spacious classrooms with projectors. Students also have access to a well-stocked library. The hostel is clean, but the mess food is average. The canteen has a limited variety of food, and there are general medical facilities available. Additionally, there are sports grounds, courts, and indoor games for students.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most teachers are qualified with M.Tech or Ph.D. degrees and are helpful in clearing doubts. The curriculum is updated and relevant, with a mix of theory and practical applications to build industrial skills. Semester exams are moderately difficult, and the pass percentage is usually above 90% in our branch.
detailed_review.Other: I chose the Information Technology course because of my interest in cybersecurity, problem-solving, and the strong placement record here. The best part is the updated curriculum, good lab facilities, and plenty of coding events. I wish there were more industry-linked workshops and newer equipment. Our main festival, Siddharth, is vibrant, usually held in March, and attracts a lively campus crowd. The campus is well-connected by public transport, and we have scholarships like Jagananna Vidya Deevena.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: PVPSIT Vijayawada has an engaging campus life.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements and training cell really works to connect students with industries. They organize and help us with everything like placement preparation, interviews, and career guidance. The institute is autonomous and actively updates the curriculum to meet the demands of the job market. They also conduct placement-related activities like mock testing and recruitment drives. They provide stipend-based internships for students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in the institute is spread over nearly 19.98 acres of land. The surroundings are a peaceful and green setting. The institute is located only eight kilometers away from the city center. There are many classrooms with projectors and books, and each classroom has a seating capacity of around 60 to 70 students. We have hostel facilities for both boys and girls separately. The girls' hostel is right on the campus with around 68 rooms, which can accommodate nearly 300 students. Strict discipline is maintained, and there is a strict curfew at the institute's hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: My institute has good and experienced faculty members who give their best. The teachers' department is led by Dr. B. V. Subha Rao, Professor and Head of our department. There are 22 experienced faculty members for my course. They are intellectually smart and guide us with the right pathways. An outcome-based dedication approach is followed by students, and classes are a mix of blackboard explanations, labs, and practical projects. Our faculty is not only experienced but also approachable; they walk us through real-life examples for better understanding.
detailed_review.Other: My time at PVPSIT Vijayawada has been both challenging and rewarding. I chose this institute because of its strong placement record, experienced faculty, and active campus life. What I really liked is that this institute not only imparts theoretical knowledge to students but also teaches them how to survive in society, how to build a good character, how to develop personal skills, and how to have good personalities after entering society.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Decent college experience with good opportunities, but room for improvement.

detailed_review.Placements: I am from the 2023-27 B.Tech IT batch and currently in my 3rd year. Based on the senior batches, around 75% to 80% of students from our course got placed. The highest package offered is above 16 LPA, the lowest is around 3 LPA, and the average package is around 4.5 LPA. Major recruiters are TCS, Wipro, Infosys, etc. Along with some product-based companies, around 60% of students managed to get internships, mostly in IT service companies or startups. Common roles are software developer and web developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our department has decent infrastructure with computer labs, smart classrooms, and campus-wide Wi-Fi. The library is well-stocked and quiet for study. The hostel rooms are okay for living with proper maintenance, electricity, and water supply. Mess food is average but clean, and thus, a canteen for extra food options, medical support, and sports facilities like a badminton court, cricket ground, and gym are available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty are qualified and approachable and are willing to clear the doubts. The teaching quality is good, and the curriculum is updated as per industry trends, with good coding practices. The semester exams are moderately difficult, but regular preparation is enough to pass. The pass percentage is generally high.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I am interested in coding and technology. The best part is the practical learning, though I wish there were more industrial projects and workshops. The campus is well-connected, safe, and will offer scholarships to deserving students.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good infrastructure, placements, friendly faculty members, lab facilities, and sports.

detailed_review.Placements: 99% should be placed in our college. The highest package is 44 LPA. The average salary should be 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Amazon, Infosys, Accenture, Cognizant, TCS, and HCL. Almost those who get placed are going to the internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: All facilities should be available like Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and library. There is no complaint about that and water facility is so good. College should be very clean and neat. Medical facilities are good. Canteen food is also good. Sports should be conducted, and the faculty members must be encouraged for that.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers must be helpful and knowledgeable. Teaching quality is excellent. Curriculum is relevant, and coming to the difficult, there is not much difficulty in the semesters. It should be moderate. The pass percentage will be 100% in the college.
detailed_review.Other: I chose computer science and engineering. I am interested in software so that's why I am taking that course. Events and fests should be held.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Absolutely great because of the faculty members and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: 90% of the students get placed at PVPSIT in CSE. The highest salary is 44 LPA, and the lowest salary is 3.4 LPA. The medium salary is 4.5 LPA. Accenture, TCS, Cognizant, and AT&T are the companies that come to PVPSIT, and students are great fit for that.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Great hostel facilities and also good food. We have beds in the hostel. Bus travel is also provided for girls in our college from college to hostel and hostel to college. Food is good for boys, and accommodation is also good. Canteen is also good and PVPSIT is very super college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Good curriculum in college. Faculty members are very experienced and helpful to students in every situation and will be useful for the students. Also, the students learn cutting-edge skills required for the tech and also the medium difficult level of examinations at PVPSIT.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is one of the best colleges for placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Every year, more than 70% of students got placed in different companies in our course. Top recruiting companies of my course were Amazon, Virtusa, Cognizant, Accenture, Capgemini, Wipro, TCS, Epam, HCL, Tech Mahindra, Torry Haris, Hexaware, and Accolite. In our course, more than 80% of students got internship opportunities in different companies. The highest package of the year was 42 LPA. The lowest package of the year was 2.2 LPA. The average package of the year was 3.5 LPA. Top roles offered for my course were programmer analyst, associate software engineer, and java developer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There were facilities available in our college such as auditorium, seminar hall, library, cafeteria, laboratories, playground, hostel, transportation, gym, medical support, parking, and water purifiers. Classrooms were equipped with the latest features such as projectors, Wi-Fi, study chair, and air-conditioners. In library, there were many types of books and journals available. College management will also provide the hostel facility. The food quality was good and the rooms were clean. We had many facilities like geysers, refrigerators, coolers, washing machines, and free bus facility for hostel students.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our college, faculty members were highly talented and experienced professors. They all completed their MBA, masters, and PhDs. They will share their knowledge with us. The faculty members will follow the academic calendar and complete the syllabus on time. We had Java, Python, HTML, XML, data structures, and networking. These will help us in the corporate system. We need to learn coding. The difficulty level of semester examinations was moderate. The pass percentage of students was above 85%.
detailed_review.Other: I wrote the EAMCET exam which I wanted a free seat to study and needed to complete my graduation. So when the counseling was going on there I chose the computer science and engineering course in this college. There were many events and fests held in this college. Events such as annual day, star 2k24 event, techno fests, farewell events, cultural fests, and sports events were held. There were many types of scholarships available in this college. We had sports club, NCC club, NSS club, yoga club, and group discussion club in our college.

reviews.reviewer_name: G S V N S Susheel
reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college taught me many lessons which will help me in my whole life.

detailed_review.Placements: The eligibility criteria for placements were that no student must have more than 2 backlogs and students must have a good CGPA up to the current semester. Top recruiting companies of my course were Cognizant, Capgemini, Wipro, TCS, Accenture, Epam, Virtusa, Torry Haris, HCL, Virtusa, Amazon, and Tech Mahindra. The highest package of the year was 42 LPA. The lowest package of the year was 2.5 LPA. The average package of the year was 3.5 LPA. Many companies visited our college to offer internships to the students. Most of students used the opportunity and joined as interns in different companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities in our college were not so excellent but somewhat better. We had library, playground, auditorium, cafeteria, laboratories, and hostel facilities. The classrooms were very big. More than 60 students could sit in the same class. Classrooms would be cleaned everyday, after the last bell of the college. There was Wi-Fi, projectors, and water facility. The hostel rooms were maintained very clean and neat. The food quality was average. There were many facilities in the hostel such as Wi-Fi, washing machine, water purifiers, and refrigerators. There were medical facilities, sports, and games as well in our college.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were very helpful to the students because they would explain whole concepts without any hesitation. The academic syllabus would be completed according to the schedule. No delay would occur during the sessions. They were very talented and experienced professors. Their teaching levels were too good. The difficulty level of the examination was moderate. We had 2 semesters every year. We had 2 mid-examinations and 3 assignment examinations, and lab practical for every semester. The pass percentage of students was more than 85%.
detailed_review.Other: I am very passionate about my career and goals. I wanted to become a successful person and need respect in society. So I decided to work hard to get a good name and make my parents proud. So to achieve my goals I want to choose the best course and the best college. I chose this course and college. We celebrate many fests and events every year. For every 3 months, we celebrate atleast one event. Cultural fests, sports events, flashmobs, techno fests, ethnic days, farewell events, signature days, freshers day, and annual day were held.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The future of life depends on you.

detailed_review.Placements: More than 70% of students got placed in different companies every year in this college. The highest package of the year was 42 LPA offered by Amazon. The lowest package of the year was 2.5 LPA. The average package of the year was 3.5 LPA. Top recruiting companies for our course were TCS, Wipro, Cognizant, Capgemini, Accenture, HCL Technologies, Epam, Virtusa, Torry Haris, and Amazon. More than 80% of students got internship opportunities from our course in different companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In our college, there were many facilities available such as auditorium, seminar hall, library, cafeteria, laboratories, playground, parking, etc. For every classroom, there will be fans, lights, projector, study chair, and Wi-Fi. We had one big library, and many types of books and journals were available in that library. College provided hostel facilities also for boys and girls. The food quality will be average. They will maintain the hostel rooms very clean and hygienic. In hostel, there were many facilities such as refrigerator, coolers, elevator, air-conditioner, washing machine, and study chair. There will be medical facilities also.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers were highly experienced and qualified professors. They will explain everything to us that was in the academics. They completed their MBA, masters, and PhDs. They were highly knowledgeable people. The teaching quality was perfect. There were semester examinations, mid-examinations, assignments, and lab practicals for every year. More than 85% of students passed in all the subjects. The difficulty level of the examination was moderate.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to become a software engineer. To achieve my goals CSE course was the best one so I chose this course. Nowadays computer science and engineering course play major roles in the corporate system. We had to learn Java, Python, HTML, AI, and many technologies for future. College management will celebrate every event and fest every year. They will encourage the students in all aspects. For every 3 months college will celebrate atleast one event. We celebrate annual day, cultural fests, sports events, flashmobs, freshers day, farewell events, and signature days.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Focus on the process, the result will come automatically.

detailed_review.Placements: Most of the students were placed in this college. More than 80% of the students will get placed in the companies. The highest package of the year is 42 LPA from Amazon. The lowest package of the year is 3.2 LPA from Tech Mahindra. The average package of the year is 3.5 LPA. The top recruiting companies are Cognizant, Capgemini, Accenture, and Wipro. More than 70% of students got internships in different companies such as Capgemini, Cognizant, and Wipro. Some companies like Accenture, TCS, and Torry Harris directly join them in tier companies without any internships.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities and infrastructure in our college are simply awesome. They have the latest technology in the labs. There are solar systems in our college. Electricity is generated from there itself. The classrooms are very clean and neat. We have one big library in our college. Hostel facilities are somewhat okay but not up to high expectations. College canteen food is very good but needs improvement. Medical facilities are there in the college. There are many different types of clubs in our college, such as the sports club, NCC club, NSS club, yoga club, and arts club.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful to the students. They are well-qualified and experienced professors. They will share their knowledge with us. Their teaching skills are very good. We can understand each and every point while they are teaching. There are 2 semester examinations conducted every 6 months. There will be 2 mid examinations conducted every 2 months, and there will be some assignments also conducted every 1 month. These mid and assignment examinations are conducted to reduce the burden and pressure on the students.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Bachelors of Technology, then I chose the Computer Science and Engineering branch. I want to become a Pega Developer. So I want to go to the IT side. Nowadays, it has more demand than any other job. I want to learn the skills regularly and improve my knowledge, which is useful for the company's growth as well as my career growth. There are so many types of events and fests that are celebrated in our college, such as Sankranti events, farewell events, signature days, annual days, and sports events, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Semester papers are difficult.

detailed_review.Placements: The maximum students pass out with 9 plus grades and get the highest packages. Last year, the highest salary package offered in our department was 16 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Everything is good. There is a garden, a canteen, a playground, and a good environment to learn. The experience is good and you can learn new things, make friends, and create many memories. Here everyone is studying well. Above-average students are many here. The competition is also high here.
detailed_review.Faculty: There are very well-experienced and good faculty members. There is good interaction. Improvement is there in students' academics, so don't worry about the faculty. Semester exams are a bit difficult, and I rate 7 out of 10.
detailed_review.Other: You can enjoy a lot here and don't need to worry about academics or grades.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a good choice to choose our college to set life to good.

detailed_review.Placements: About 85% of students got placed. The highest package is 22 LPA, the lowest package is 2 LPA, and the average package is 6.6 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Accenture, TCS, Hexaware, Efftronics, etc. Around 90% of students got internships from Accenture, Efftronics, Indian Railways, Amazon, etc. Top roles offered are Package App Development Associate and Graduate Engineer Trainee.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our college is located in a good environment place surrounded with plants, fields. About college it's a good & also college had a+ certification from NACC. Classroom are spacious and well eccipuced. We had a big library of lot of collection of books.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are well qualified, and mostly all teachers are certified with doctorates in their studies. They use excellent teaching skills. Our course is a balanced course for software & core fields. We do get the knowledge of software skills and core skills. Semester exams are good and relevant to all students. Pass percentage is 95%.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: As there are good training and placements, I say that CSE is the department to join in our college.

detailed_review.Placements: Mostly all the students are placed. The highest package is 16 LPA and the lowest is 2.5 LPA. A good placement training will be conducted. The infrastructure is average, but the level of teaching is very good. Our college encourages participation in hackathons and competitions.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The food is nice and the maintenance of the hostel is good. But the hostel is available only for girls. There is no boys' hostel in our college. The food is okay. The canteen also provides good food. Various competitions will be held for first-year students.
detailed_review.Faculty: The pass percentage is above 90 and good libraries are available. Various competitions will be held for first-year students. DSA will be taught for students who are interested, and various courses will be taken through webinars.

reviews.reviewer_name: Siga Mani Durga Sai Pavan Kumar
reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The life in the college.

detailed_review.Placements: As in the period of recession, there are no lot of companies at this time. But as I have seen in the past, there are companies like Accenture, TCS, Capgemini, Cognizant, Wipro, etc. There is also the highest package of 44 LPA offered by Amazon and an average package of 8.48 LPA by dream companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: As I'm living in Vijayawada, I'm a day scholar and not in the hostel. But there is only a hostel for girls provided by the college, but not for boys. Boys have some PGs on the sides of the college. There are different types of labs like Chemistry, Physical, different types of computer labs, and workshops.
detailed_review.Faculty: For the department of freshman engineering, i.e., 1st year, the faculty is good and friendly and make us habit for the college. There will be a counselor for every section and need to be reported every week. The exam pattern is there will be 2 mid exams and a sem.
detailed_review.Other: I have selected CSE with my interest and the demand in the world. There are also options like sliding after the admission. I think it will be better if the canteen is improved. There are different types of clubs and fests happening in the college, and scholarships will also be provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: I actually dissatisfied with this college I didn't get placement till now

detailed_review.Placements: 65% students will get placement which are good remaining will not get the placement also having great pressure here. The highest is 44 LPA, lowest is 1.5 LPA, average is 3.5 LPA. Every thing is ok but only someone get placement with luck. Companies like Accenture, Cognizant will come.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is in developed in hardware side but under development in software side. The systems and wifi connection is very poor in appropriate wires are there. The sports hostels and everything is available and better food will be given compared to another.
detailed_review.Faculty: Maybe the teachers are very strict sometimes and sometimes friendly with some students only. Everything is good but they just read ppt and attend class in that that's it. The curriculum is sometimes relevant. The faculty do .not get anyone to malpractice.

faqs.question: What is the eligibility to get admission in Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology for UG/PG courses?
faqs.answer:
Prasad V Potluri Siddhartha Institute of Technology has below criteria for taking admissions to it's various courses: Courses Eligibility MCA Candidate must have passed Bachelor degree of 3/4 years duration with Mathematics as one of the subject at Intermediate or Degree level with above mentioned marks from any recognised University/Institute.
45% marks for BC categories.
Candidate who are appearing for the final year degree examination are also be eligible.
Degree obtained by Distance Mode Program should have recognition by Joint Committee of UGC, AICTE and DEC/DEB.
Candidate who passed all the subjects of the three years of any Degree course in one sitting is not eligible for admission. B.E. / B.Tech Candidates who have passed Diploma in Engineering or any other examination recognised as equivalent there to, from a recognised Institute/ University, Andhra Pradesh/ Telangana are also eligible.
Candidates who have appeared in Diploma in Engineering and who are awaiting their results can also apply on provisional basis.
Candidates should belong to the state of Andhra Pradesh/ Telangana.
Candidate should have completed 16 years of age as of 31st December of the year of admission (2023).
There is no upper age limit. M.E./M.Tech Candidate must have passsed B.E./B.Tech. in relevant stream and obtained at least 50% marks (45% in case of reserved category candidates) from an AICTE/UGC
approved institution recognised by the Government of Andhra Pradesh as equivalent thereto.
Final year appearing students may also apply on provisional basis. MBA/PGDM Candidate must have completed Bachelor degree of 3/4 years duration with above mentioned marks from any recognised University/Institute.
45% marks for BC categories.
Candidate who are appearing for the final year degree examination are also be eligible.
Degree obtained by Distance Mode Program should have recognition by Joint Committee of UGC, AICTE and DEC/DEB.
Candidate who passed all the subjects of the three years of any Degree course in one sitting is not eligible for admission. Not satisfied with answer? Ask Shiksha GPT

college_info.college_name: Presidency University Bangalore: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Rankings

highlights.summary:
Presidency University is a private university located in Yelahanaka, Bangalore. The university is recognised by the UGC and is approved by the AICTE. The university is also accredited with NAAC ‘A’ Grade. The university has been ranked 26th in Pan India in the Private University Category - Outlook I Care Best B School - 2024 rankings. Presidency University offers undergraduate, postgraduate and doctoral level courses through seven schools across multiple streams such as Engineering, Management, Science, Law, etc.
Presidency University admission 2025 is both merit and entrance-based. The university accepts national or state-level entrance exams like KCET, MAT, XAT, CAT, CMAT etc. for admission to specific courses. The highest and average package offered during Presidency University Bangalore placement 2025 stood at INR 14.37 LPA and INR 5.98 LPA, respectively. Candidates can check the highlights of Presidency University in the table provided below:
Check out more on Presidency University Highlights in the below videos:

college_info_program.intro:
The flagship programmes offered at Presidency University include BTech and MBA. BTech duration at this university is four years. For the MBA programme, students need to have a bachelor's degree in any discipline with at least 50% aggregate (45% aggregate for reserved category). Students can check the Presidency University Bangalore popular programmes in this space:
Check out more on Presidency University MBA in the below video:
