reviews.course: B.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: College you will never regret.

detailed_review.Placements: I am doing BE Computer Science and Engineering in PSNR College of Engineering and Technology, and it is useful for me to gain my knowledge and accomplish my technical and non-technical skills. Actually, my seniors recommended this college, and many of them have been placed in many big companies. One of my seniors got placed in Google, which is a dream job for many other graduates.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In my college, they provide sufficient room for the hostels and games like football court, tennis court, shuttle court, and they also conduct game competitions and others. They provide healthy food for the hostel, and it is the safest place for girls to stay who are coming from long distances.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are more than enough and they are doing their job well to help us learn new things and gain knowledge and improve our technical and non-technical skills. They support us in many competitions like athlon competitions and some others.

reviews.course: Master of Business Administration (MBA)
reviews.review_title: Good college and well-maintained.

detailed_review.Placements: The top recruiting companies is Flipkart, Amazon, and Wipro. Around 75 to 80% of students in this course get placed. The highest salary package offered is 10 LPA. The lowest salary package offered is 3 LPA. The top roles is analytics manager and business analyst. Around 60% of Students got internship.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The college infrastructure is good. Everyone can use the internet. It has a huge central library, and classrooms are good, clean, and hygienic. The labs are well-equipped. The hostel facility for both boys and girls. Our college has a canteen with some snacks. The medical facilities also available.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teacher are good. Our faculty is strict. They are highly qualified and experienced. They have good knowledge and they will explain well, clearing our doubts. They will help us in our exams. The course curriculum is relevant and it makes students industry-ready. The semester exams are difficult and 65% is the pass percentage.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of PSNA College of Engineering and Technology.

detailed_review.Placements: Even though the college is saying all the students get placed and they are showing 100 percent placement. But the truth is most of the students are placed in local companies that are not even considered startups for the salary of 20k per month. I am sure 20k is not enough to manage food and rent in a corporate city. The average salary package is 3 to 4 LPA, and the highest salary is 15 LPA. The highest placement companies include TCS, Lavendel Consulting, and Zoho, which are the product-based companies. Coming to my course are Texas Instruments, Zoho, TCS, ServiceNow, and Lavendel Consulting.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The Wi-Fi is present and installed everywhere except some places. The Wi-Fi password is kept secret to this date, and only the faculty members and the staff are allowed to use it, but no worries because the network is damn slow and not available inside the classrooms, only available in the lab for the faculty members only. Many of the lab systems are not capable of running a C program. Hostel food is below average; the taste of the hostel food and the canteen foods and drinks is getting even worse than before. Only buffalos and earth, the noodles, and price in the main canteen. I am frustrated about the canteen hygiene and the food quality.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is outdated. The syllabus is not updated to the expected expectation of the industries and the industry experts to date. Considering the improvement of the syllabuses and addition course might help the college to get a decent NIRF ranking. Some of the faculty members are only capable of teaching in a right way and sharing knowledge in all the aspects for the students. Irrespective of the knowledge of the faculty, all the faculty members are friendly. The pass percentage of the course will be 60 to 70 percent. This will vary every semester and the academic course. Coming to the difficulty of the semester exams, I would say that by studying 1 week before the exam, you will be able to get a decent CGPA without fear and full confidence.
detailed_review.Other: No, the biggest cultural festivals will be conducted, and there is no expected dress code like showing in a movie.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Not worth it if you are not interested in self-learning.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost all students get placed, but many are placed at an average of 3-4 LPA. Also, students are ready to join BPOs. Top recruiting companies include Zoho, ServiceNow, Texas Instruments, and Cognizant. The highest salary in my branch is 44 LPA at ServiceNow, which is a SaaS-based company in the IT sector.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is a rare allowance for using the institution's Wi-Fi, and it is very slow. The mess and canteen are more expensive compared to the city market, and some dishes are not worth it. The service is also poor in the main canteen. The lab systems are very slow, even for basic working and functions such as browsing and system administration operations. The systems in the DSP lab are not capable.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is old. Some teachers are only capable of sharing valuable knowledge, but semester exams are easy. The curriculum does not make students ready for industry-level knowledge and training. Qualifications do not assure good teaching skills. They are just reading the PPT which are not even made by themselves.

reviews.course: B.E. in Biomedical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Fees are high, but the quality is good.

detailed_review.Placements: College does not provide placement. Not a single person has been placed from my college. If one want placement, then don’t choose this college, as they do not offer placements. College does not provide internships. In three years, we did not receive any type of internship. College is good for non-attending students.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is below average. There is no library. Classrooms conditions are the worst, with only dim lighting, and sometimes mosquitoes bite us. Wi-Fi is not available. College does not have a hostel. Labs are in very bad condition, and the toilets are also poorly maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: I enrolled in this college because I was preparing for the NEET UG exam. I already knew that the college is good for non-attending students. If someone get the most from a college, then don't choose this one. If my teachers were more attentive towards us, it would have been better. Events and fests happen occasionally.
detailed_review.Other: At first, they collect only 60% of the total fee, but we are expected to pay other fees as well, which are not official payments.

reviews.course: B.E. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology is an Overall Good Engineering College.

detailed_review.Placements: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology is a highly reputed institution. The college has a separate placement training cell, and every year, almost 95% of students are placed in companies like Tata Electronics, Havells, Orient, Finolex, TCS, etc. The highest salary packages range from ₹2.5 to ₹8 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure and campus surroundings of PSNA College of Engineering and Technology are very beautiful. The college is equipped with modern laboratories and library facilities. It also provides free Wi-Fi access and has good hostel accommodations, with the hostel mess food being quite tasty. Additionally, there are numerous sports grounds, and coaching staff is available on campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teaching staff at PSNA College of Engineering and Technology comprises highly experienced professionals. They conduct various extracurricular activities every month and arrange industry visits, allowing students to gain valuable insights into the industry. Approximately 95% of students pass their university exams.
detailed_review.Other: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology offers a wide range of courses and provides numerous scholarships to students. The college also has good transportation facilities and prioritizes security. The management organizes various cultural events every semester.

reviews.course: B.E. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: This college is a very good place.

detailed_review.Placements: About 85% of our college students were placed in top companies like TCS, CTS, and Infosys last year. The highest package in our college is 10 LPA, and the lowest package is 4 LPA. The top recruiting companies are TCS, CTS, Infosys, and Accenture. Almost 90% of students got internships from our course in Accenture. This is one of the best colleges in the southern region of Tamil Nadu.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our hostel is split into two blocks. The A block is for seniors, and the B block is for first-year students. Each block consists of five floors, and there is Wi-Fi connection on every floor. Classrooms are digitalized and equipped with advanced technology. The quality of food provided in our hostel mess is very good. Our college gives equal importance to sports activities as it does to studies. There are well-equipped gym facilities in our hostel, and the playgrounds are in good condition to maintain physical health.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers in our college are very kind and well-qualified, with around 10 years of experience. The quality of teaching is very good, preparing students for the industry. The semester exams conducted in our college are quite difficult, with a pass percentage of around 90%.
detailed_review.Other: I wanted to become a maintenance engineer for aircraft, so I chose mechanical engineering, which has good value at any time. The course content is well developed. The SIP lasted about 10 days, and a symposium is conducted once a year. Scholarships are provided to all students.

reviews.course: M.E. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Very good faculty members in our course .

detailed_review.Placements: My placement experience was very good. The placement department is very good at our college; they help students get the best opportunities. Last year, the placement rate was 70 percent in our course. Internships are also provided at the time of placement. Overall, good placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Classrooms are fully ventilated and comfortable, and labs are also well equipped. There is a big library, which is large and fully stocked. Sports and medical facilities are available on campus. Hostel facilities are good and rooms are large in size. Food for mess is also good.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and friendly in their behavior. They are experienced and have in-depth knowledge of their subjects. The curriculum of our course is based on practical knowledge. Semester exams are easy to pass. Teaching quality is good at our college.
detailed_review.Other: Scholarships are provided for some students .

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Proud of PSNA and its pros and cons .

detailed_review.Placements: ECE students in PSNA College number 244, with 100 students placed. They provide good placements in better companies, offer good internships, and guide us to learn in many ways. They also provide video classes for students and their syllabus.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology's library is the longest library in Tamil Nadu. They provide AC facilities in the lab, and the infrastructure is awesome. They have separate canteens for girls and boys, and the food in the college hostel is very good. They also provide transport facilities for hostel students to reach their hostel.
detailed_review.Faculty: Our facilities are well-experienced; they teach from basic to advanced levels using easy methods to ensure understanding. Overall, the pass percentage is good. However, our college fees are high, and we feel that the exam fees are also high. They do not inform us properly about the fees they are charge.
detailed_review.Other: I choose the ECE which is futuristic course scope students and I have a interest it and many companies need fresh ECE students .

reviews.course: B.E. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: TNEA counseling College fee: Rs. 85,000/annum Management fee: Rs. 115000 Hostel fee-Rs.85000/annum.

detailed_review.Placements:
Students gets placed in various companies, most probably in the IT sectors. 
And the highest salary as of April 2024 was 18 lacs per annum. Nearly 20 students got placed with that salary in Levendale solution, and most of them were from the department of CSE, IT and some from other departments like ECE, AI, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
Non-vegetarian food is provided in the hostel on weekly basis. 
Each of the departments has a separate building. 
And it has a huge common library, which has three floors (including the ground floor). 
Separate cabinets were provided for girls and boys for studying purpose in the library, and library is equipped with Wi-Fi facility.
detailed_review.Faculty:
In 2022, the institution got autonomous status. 
So the curriculum is framed by the college, which is similar to the curriculum provided by Anna university. 
The average pass mark is 50%.
Some of the subjects have integrated lab facilities, which enables students to gain both practical and theoretical knowledge.

faqs.question: Does PSNA College of Engineering and Technology accept JEE score?
faqs.answer: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology does not rely on JEE scores for admission to its B.Tech programs. Instead, the college's admission process for B.Tech is conducted through the Tamil Nadu Engineering Admissions (TNEA), which is overseen by Anna University, Chennai. This indicates that aspiring students seeking admission to B.Tech programs at PSNA College are required to participate in the TNEA process, which involves meeting specific eligibility criteria and adhering to the guidelines set forth by the university. For prospective applicants interested in pursuing B.Tech studies at PSNA College of Engineering and Technology, it is advisable to visit the official website of the college or directly contact the admissions office to obtain detailed information about the admission process, eligibility criteria, important dates, and any other relevant requirements. By consulting official sources, aspiring students can gain clarity on the specific procedures and prerequisites involved in securing admission to their desired B.Tech programme at PSNA College. In summary, while PSNA College of Engineering and Technology does not consider JEE scores for B.Tech admissions, prospective students are encouraged to familiarize themselves with the TNEA process and engage directly with the college's admissions office to ensure a smooth and successful application process.

faqs.question: Is TNEA Counselling required for BTech admission at PSNA College of Engineering and Technology?
faqs.answer: Yes, TNEA Counselling is required for BTech admission. candidates who have completed Class 12 with 50% each in Physics and Chemistry and 100% in Mathematics are eligible to apply for BTech and BE courses. Aspirants are shortlisted based on their merit in the last qualifying exam. The shortlisted candidates need to come for TNEA Counselling for final selection.

faqs.question: What are the cutoff marks required for B.Tech?
faqs.answer: To apply for BTech IT, the applicants must meet the following eligibility requirements.Candidates must pass their 10+2 or equivalent exam with a minimum of 50 percent marks from a recognised institution. They must have majored in Mathematics, Physics, and Chemistry in high school.The JEE Main 2023 cutoff has been released for different categories such as for General Category is 90 percentile while the IIT JEE cut off 2023 for OBC-NCL is 73.611, EWS is 75.622, SC is 51.977. The cut-off of JEE Main is released in two forms i.e., qualifying cut-off and admission cut-off. The qualifying marks for GEN category (common rank list) students is expected to be 89.75, while for GEN (EWS category) students it is 78.21. For OBC-NCL students, the expected cutoff is 74.31, while for SC students it is expected to be 54 and for ST students it is expected to be 44. General Category candidates need to score a minimum of 95+ percentile score to getNITs. For reserved category candidates,  80+ percentile score is enough to get NITs Marks you score in 12th will just be a number to make you eligible for appearing companies during placements. Some of the companies which make it a criteria usually keep it up to 60% or some don't even make it a criteria.

faqs.question: What is the latest cutoff information for MBA at PSNA College of Engineering and Technology?
faqs.answer: Students are only accepted into the institute if they have successfully completed their Bachelors with a minimum aggregate of 45%. As for the 2023 cutoff for MBA at PSNA College of Engineering and Technology, the minimum marks to be scored in TANCET in the fields of MBA Finance, MBA Human Resource Management, MBA Information Technology and MBA Marketing is 43. TANCET is a state level entrance examination conducted for admission for the courses of MBA and MCA inside Tamil Nadu. The maximum mark that can be scored in this examination is 100.

faqs.question: Which entrance exam scores are accepted by PSNA College of Engineering and Technology for admission?
faqs.answer: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology admission 2025 is primarily based on entrance exam. The college accepts state-level entrance exams like TANCET MBA, etc. for admission to specific courses. PSNA College of Engineering and Technology offers 18 courses in affiliation with Anna University at UG and PG levels in multiple streams like Engineering, Management and Computer Applications streams.PSNA College of Engineering & Technology (PSNACET) was established in 1984. It is a premier institution at the outskirts of Dindigul Township in Tamil Nadu. The institute offers 7 undergraduate courses (B.E/B.Tech) and 8 postgraduate courses in Engineering. It also offers two-year MBA and MCA programs. PSNACET is affiliated to Anna University.  Applications for admissions to all the courses have to be submitted online. Candidates must have passed 10+2 in the Science stream for admission to 4-year B.E courses. Applicants who hold Bachelor’s degree are eligible to apply for the PG courses. Admissions to B.E programme will be conducted through the admission process as per the guidelines of Tamil Nadu Engineering Admissions (TNEA). For admission to M.E and MBA courses, the candidates have to qualify Tamil Nadu Common Entrance Test (TANCET), conducted by Anna University. This is the criteria  to get admission.

college_info.college_name: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology Placements 2025: Highest Package, Average Package & Top Recruiters

data.title: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology Placement Report 2025
summary: The placement report from PSNA College of Engineering and Technology recorded a highest package of INR 44 LPA in 2025. The average package offered was INR 4.2 LPA . In total, 104 recruiters participated in the recruitment process, resulting in over 1107 job offers. A total of 1039 students have been placed across various courses. Major recruiters included ICICI, HCL, Cognizant involved in the 2025 placement season.

Earlier in the placement drive held in 2024, the highest and average packages stood at INR 18 LPA and INR 4 LPA , respectively. A total of 1010 job offers were made as of April 2024 as per the official website. A total of 1139 students secured placement from 103 recruiters in 2024.

In 2023, the highest and average package offered was INR 15.14 LPA and INR 3.6 LPA . A total of 1116 students were in reputed companies. 114 recruiters took part in the placement process and made 1401 job offers to the students of the batch 2023 .

placement_faqs.question: How are B.Tech placements at PSNA College of Engineering and Technology?
placement_faqs.answer: Students are allowed to appear for interviews and placement opportunities if and only if they have no arrears or pending papers. TCS employs a majority of the students. The presence of a large number of MNCs including Wipro, Zoho, Maventick, Infosys etc. increase student enthusiasm to participate. About 75-80% students are on average placed. Considering the 2022 Batch, the highest package received was INR 15.14 LPA where the student was placed at Silicon Labs. Other major companies that appeared for campus interviews include Byjus, Cognizant, Tata Elxsi, Accenture, Aspire Systems, MPHASIS, Tech Mahindra, Capegemini, Tiger Analytics, Hexaware Technologies, ICICI etc. About 90% of students of the 2022 batch were placed promising lucrative career opportunities for students.

facilities.name: Library
facilities.description: PSNA College of Engineering and Technology has a central library, in addition to it, there are departmental libraries in each department. The library has 91370 volumes of books on 39298 titles, 5583 back volumes of journals/ magazine, 10274 nonbook materials. It also has the subscription of more than 2628 scholarly journals under the AICTE INDEST Consortium and 124 print versions of the journals. The library provides On-line access to a large number of full-text journals from IEEE, ASME, ASCE, Elsevier, and J-Gate (JSMS). The library has the institutional membership 	British Council Library, American Information Resource Center etc.

facilities.name: Cafeteria
facilities.description: College cafeteria has three spacious sections separately for men students, women students, faculty, and visitors. These three sections together can accommodate 500 members at a time. In addition to this cafeteria, three tea/coffee shops are located on the campus.

facilities.name: Hostel
facilities.description: PSNACET has 8 hostel blocks which include 5Gents Hostels, 2 Ladies Hostel, and 1 PIO-Foreign Students Hostel. All the hostels are offered RO drinking water facility, health care facilities, indoor and outdoor games facilities and other facilities like STD booth, photocopying, stationery and general store.

faculty_reviews.verified_reviews_info: The Verified badge indicates that the reviewer's details have been verified by Shiksha, and reviewers are bona fide students of this college. These reviews and ratings have been given by students. Shiksha does not endorse the same. Out of 161 published reviews , 136 reviews are verified.

highlights.summary: Established in 1984, Pondicherry Engineering College - PEC is located in Pondicherry. The institute offers courses like B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM, M.Sc. and MCA. These courses are offered in Full Time mode. A total of 28 courses offered by the Institute are available across streams such as Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software. The institute has all the necessary facilities to the students.

Pondicherry Engineering College - PEC Reviews on Placements, Faculty & Facilities

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: It's a decent university.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements are very average. On average, only 4-5 students get placed. The package for the placed students is pretty decent. It's mainly up to the students. Their level of understanding of the course and how up-to-date they are plays a major role.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is decent. Some lab equipment needs to be upgraded. The classrooms are spacious and neat. There is a dispensary within the campus grounds with a nurse and a doctor always on call during working hours. The library has a good collection of books that can be used for reference. The sports and games area is also decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members are the best. They are all very well qualified and have a deep understanding of their respective subjects of expertise. The curriculum is good, but it doesn't compare to the NEP curriculum. It, however, does do the job and makes the student industry-ready as long as the student puts in the effort to understand the subjects in the course. The semester exam questions feel fair enough.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Data Science
reviews.review_title: Good college and infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: 5th semester students are eligible for the placements. Not many companies 2 to 4 companies visited our college. They selected a few candidates by interview. Students are doing jobs in corporations. The highest package offered was 3.2LPA and the lowest package offered was 1.8LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure was good for a engineering college. ATM and a bank inside the college. There was a garden that contained a good space for entertainment. Labs were spacious and had a good number of pc. Classrooms were spacious and digitally updated. The hostel was good. Mess food was average. There was a cricket ground volleyball court badminton court and indoor playground available.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members were good. They were highly educated and experienced. The course was unique and good. Teachers use simple language that was easy to understand. There were two semesters in a year. There were presentations and journals in each semester.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Puducherry Technological University.

detailed_review.Placements: The average package is about 6 LPA, but the highest can be up to 18-20 LPA, and you also get an internship in big companies like Qualcomm and more. The rest is up to you, the harder you work, the more you will get. The T&P cell helps you get a job.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostel life is very good. The food is a little bit average because most of the dishes are south indian, but the taste is very decent and much better than the other college hostel and mess. You can request the menu change as the menu is decided by the students only.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty, curriculum, and exams are very good. Some of the faculty are non-cooperative, but the rest are all very good, very helpful, and supportive. They help you in all ways. Exam questions are very easy, but you still have to study very well, and the exams are conducted very strictly.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechatronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfactory college with decent faculty members and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are decent. Most of the students get placed in various companies. The minimum package is 3 LPA, and the median is about 6.5 LPA. The faculty members, especially the training and placement cell help a lot in the placement. Around 45 out of 60 got placed.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Campus has a central Wi-Fi that works all over the campus. The campus is also very big. Library has more than 8,000 books on all streams of engineering. Classrooms are decent.
detailed_review.Faculty: Curriculum is very good. The teaching quality is also very good, except for some teachers who make college life feel like school life, rest are all good. The exams are comparatively medium level. Sometimes the board asks very tough questions but generally easy. Faculty members are also very good and supportive, except for some.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Campus life and hostel life are good.

detailed_review.Placements: Decent companies come here to the Training and Placement Centre. Moreover, you get an above-average salary. But don't expect extraordinary companies to hire you from here. As it is a Tier 2 college, you should not expect any MNCs to visit. All the best.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: In the hostel, the in and out timings are okay, but the food is typical South Indian and below average. Electricity is there most of the time, but it goes off during heavy rain. Still, there is a generator for power backup. Wi-Fi facility is good, but mobile internet is not there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of professors are good, friendly, and well-educated. Most of them are Ph.D. scholars. However, they speak in Tamil most of the time during lectures, as the majority of the class consists of local students. Still, you can ask your doubts, and they will help you. The curriculum and semester exams are on time and well-organized.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: The college is good for day scholars but not for hostellers.

detailed_review.Placements: There is 87% placement in the CSE branch, and sometimes it is said that there is 100% placement in CSE. The highest package is 10 LPA to 15 LPA. The average package is 6 LPA and the lowest package is 3 LPA. Wipro, IBM, TCS, Infosys, and Wipro have 89% placement in the CSE branch, and 70% of students from the civil department are placed in Wipro, I don't know the exact value.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There is no Wi-Fi in the classrooms, but Wi-Fi in the hostel rooms is free. The hostel food is not good yet, and no canteen for hostellers. There are no medical facilities after 5 PM. Sports and games are there, but at night, there are no students on the ground after 7:00 PM, and there is no lighting facility on the ground.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and well-qualified, and the teaching quality is good. Teachers explain in English, I think, in this college. CSE is a good choice for all semester exams are not too hard, 50% is the passing percentage, and the previous year's questions are enough to pass the semester exam.
detailed_review.Other: Because CSE is my dream branch, it has a high chance of getting a job. There are fan and computer fests and events here.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Wireless Communication
reviews.review_title: College has a good ground facility.

detailed_review.Placements: Students become eligible for placements after completion of 2nd year. Our college has collaborated with Microsoft, Capgemini, Amazon, Flipkart, and many other famous companies. The highest package here is 55 LPA and the average package is 6 LPA. Our college is the bossiest and most successful.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has a gym facility but its access is allowed only to hostellers. It has a decent canteen facility. The campus will be open from 9:00 AM- 6:00 PM. College ground is the place I hang out the most and the locality is safe.
detailed_review.Faculty: All faculty members here are helpful, most of the times and they are always willing to help you if you don't understand and topic clearly. Here the exam system is completely dependent on the topics you study in lectures. I would say if you learn everything in the class you can score good marks.
detailed_review.Other: We have a main college function and a main sports event every year and several small department functions every year like Pongal celebration, Holi, etc. College has several clubs for the development of students like the photography club, design club, etc.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Wireless Communication
reviews.review_title: In my college, the education is affordable with good value.

detailed_review.Placements: From the third year onwards, students are eligible for campus placements. Many companies visit our university for placements like TCS, Accenture, Amazon, etc. I do not know the company names very well because I am studying in my first year at this university. The highest package of our university is 60 LPA and the average package is 5 LPA as per company and profile.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Every student will be given a library passbook for the purpose of borrowing books. Sports events are conducted for every sport annually for all departments and the overall champion is chosen.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our university, we have one of the best faculty members. They guide very well and the syllabus is normal for everyone. In each year, there are four mid-exams and two-semester exams. The gap between the mid-exams is one month. Exams are moderate not tough or not easy. The student ratio is greater than the faculty ratio. I like every faculty member. The course curriculum is good.
detailed_review.Other: Rejior or Pecoffes is the main annual and technical symposium which is done in a grand manner. Social groups like NSS are for doing social welfare activities.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Wireless Communication
reviews.review_title: It is a very good college for M.Tech.

detailed_review.Placements: Seventh and eighth-semester students were eligible for the placement drive. For Mechanical Engineering, core companies like Mahindra, Wabag, and Tata visited. The highest package was 12 LPA, and the average was 5 LPA. There was 100% placement in the college. My plan was to get placed through campus recruitment.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The hostel facilities were not good. There was no network for Jio users, and the Wi-Fi stopped working every once in a while. Preparation was not done quickly. The food was not great. Non-veg was provided three times a week, and sometimes the food was good, while other times it was bad. It was a little cheaper compared to staying at rented places. Restrooms were not very clean. Overall, the hostel facilities were not good.
detailed_review.Faculty: I chose Mechanical Engineering as my interest. The course provided in the college has the best syllabus. The curriculum has many improvements that help students perform well in real-world applications. A digital teaching method is practiced in my college, and every classroom has a projector setup. The frequency of exams is every 6 months.

reviews.course: M.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: My honest review on the college.

detailed_review.Placements: There were varity of courses available which offered different types of job opportunities. Job opportunities and placements were good for social work, MBA, library science, law, and related departments. When we look at the trend of science students of Pondicherry University, most of them will opt for Ph.D. and higher studies. We had very good placement activities in my college. Companies like Zoho (4.5 LPA), TCS (3.3 LPA), Tech Mahindra (3.25 LPA), and L&T Infotech (3 LPA) frequently visited my college. Many other companies were yet to come. Till now, 410 students have been placed in my college.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The syllabus will be updated every three years for every course conducted in the university. Course curriculum will cope with the demands of the changing world. Also, for master students, there was an option for choosing soft core courses from other departments to get more credit. Hostel could provide a good environment for the students. In the hostel, four students could share one room. The meal quality was average in the hostel. The hostel cost was little expensive. Overall, the hostel facility was average on our campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Every faculty member at the university was highly qualified. Most of them were post-doctorate. Many of the science faculty members will be available in their respective research labs even at night time due to their dedication towards research. Every faculty member also had a good number of publications in reputed journals and always kept on accounting.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electrical and Electronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: It is a gateway to a wonderful journey and success.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement drive will start in the 7th semester for all final-year students who have registered for the training and placements. Some companies like Toshiba, TCS, L&T, LTTS, Capgemini, CTS, etc., visit our institute for placements. About 80% of the eligible students have been placed till now. Some students also get internships in companies. The highest salary package is 11 LPA and the average salary is 4 LPA.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided by the college are fantastic. There is free Wi-Fi throughout the campus but in some areas, there is restricted access. Classrooms are neat and spacious. There is a good environment to study. I am a day scholar, so I do not know much about the hostel but my friends said it is very normal with average food. The availability of food in the canteen and mess is super. There are medical facilities, sports and games.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful for students' academic progress. They are highly qualified and knowledgeable. Their quality of teaching is simply awesome. This course mainly focuses on curriculum and it does not make students industry-ready. Semester exams are quite simple. There is a high chance of passing in all the subjects. Some of my few friends in my class also get arrears.
detailed_review.Other: I have a main objective to get a college seat in the government college in my nearby location, so I chose this college. I am from the EEE department and it is always special for design and problem-solving. Getting more friendly teaching facilities in the department will be more helpful for us to study the subjects in an engaging way. Cultural events are organised every year in March named Rejouir for all students in the class. It helps in major extracurricular activities and sports.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: PTU (PEC) - (Student review).

detailed_review.Placements: 50-60% of students are placed. Most of the companies are recruiting from courses like mechanical, EEE, ECE, CSE, and IT. The highest package offered is 6.7 LPA, and the average is 3 LPA - 4 LPA. Top recruiting companies are Zoho, Qspyder, Cognizant, TVS, Wabag, TCS, and Wipro. The students who got selected through various contacts do internships and projects in companies.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: College has not done proper renovation and less maintenance services. Wi-Fi is present across each department with low connectivity. Library is outdated and some books are in bad condition. Canteen has less ventilation and decent food is available. The sports ground and equipments are present separately. There is a small complex present for students, staffs, and hostel students. There is a small dispensary and medical equipment with an ambulance.
detailed_review.Faculty: The staffs are well-knowledgeable and experienced with PhDs. The course curriculum is outdated and staffs are well. The students can learn here but they gain skills outside not on our campus. Semester exams are moderate compared to other colleges. The students can pass if they score 50+ (including internals).
detailed_review.Other: This college is better compared to other colleges in Pondicherry. It has low fees and environment is good. Our campus is peaceful. Fun and culturals are held. Rejour is a grand event conducted every year. Sports clubs like design club, photos club, women cell, English literacy club, etc., are present. NSS & NCC are there in our college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechatronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Still in developing stage, bad placements, bad infrastructure and facilities.

detailed_review.Placements: Around 60 percent of people get placed in CSE courses and negligible in other branches. The average package stands at 5L and the highest package is 24L. Very less students get internships. Companies like L&T, Wipro, TCS, etc. Mostly call center roles are offered.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure in this college is still in the developing stage. Classrooms are not equipped with digital equipment or any Wi-Fi requirements. The library is very outdated. Labs are very old and equipped with very old equipment. The hostel is also very basic which is frequently disrupted by water and Wi-Fi.
detailed_review.Faculty: All the teachers here are Ph.D. holders. Teaching quality is not good. The curriculum is still old curriculum. Semester exams are very easy, a one-night study can get you a pass. The pass percentage is 35 percent. The attendance percentage requirement is 75 percent.
detailed_review.Other: College life is very boring and the college is located in a remote area. No good events or fests happen here.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: PEC college review by a 3rd year student .

detailed_review.Placements: If you consider the computer science department out of 120 students in a year, 60 students will get placed. The highest package is around 13 Lacs per annum, and the lowest around 3 Lacs per annum. On average, 4 Lacs per annum, 60 percent of the students get internships in companies like TCS, Wipro, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: When it comes to infrastructure, it is good that you will get decent old-fashioned classroom sets with outdated syllabi. Even the labs aren't modern; they use very old machines. Hostels are decent, but the food is not so good. There is an immediate medical team inside the campus.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are highly qualified; most of the teachers here are Ph.D. holders. They are very helpful, and their teaching style is also very nice. When it comes to curriculum, it's old-fashioned and it is exam-relevant but not industry-relevant. Semester exams are difficult; you need 50 percent to pass the exam.
detailed_review.Other: I want to be a software engineer, so I chose computer science. The best thing about the course is that it was well organised in its manner. It would be better if it was upgraded to meet market needs and infrastructure. It would do much better. A rejouissance is an event conducted once a year and it contains literature and singing .

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: Puducherry Technological University - College life

detailed_review.Placements: Puducherry Technology University has a separate training and placement cell for helping the students to get placed in very good companies. Most of the good companies will hire our students. Some of the good companies are TCS, Cognizant, Zoho. The placement percentage of the Computer Science department is around 80% to 90%. In the technical departments, the probability of getting placed is much higher than the core.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of this college is quite average because this college was built around 30 to 40 years ago, and the restrooms are unclean. The only building with good infrastructure is the admin building where the Mechatronics department is situated. There is a canteen for the students to have their food, and the campus covers an area of 200 acres (approximately). There is a central library which has more than a thousand books.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty members here are well-knowledgeable, and most of them have completed their Ph.D. in their respective fields. They interact with the students very much and provide more knowledge to the students. They provide more freedom to the students, which is usually utilized properly by the students. Their lectures are very good. Their teaching methods are of good quality. Puducherry Technological University has better faculty members than any other college in Pondicherry.
detailed_review.Other: The campus life in Puducherry Technological University is very good. The students here have a lot of free time to explore the college and develop their skills. There is a beach in front of our college, where students go in their free time. There is an annual fest which occurs every year in March called "Rejouir," which is a well-known college fest in Pondicherry.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Chemical Engineering
reviews.review_title: By gaining skills, we can win.

detailed_review.Placements: Nearly 2 to 3 percent, but it depends on how many students join the training and placement. TCL, Infosys, Saint Gobain, solar companies are recruiting. Nearly 6 LPA to 10 LPA are offered by those companies. GATE-related advice, even coaching from any faculty, is provided.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We have India's first and the largest chemical engineering lab in our department. The library is open from 9 a.m. to 8 p.m. for student availability. I am a day scholar, but I went to meet my friends in the hostel. Without security or warden permission, we can't enter the hostel. I also had food from the hostel canteen. Good food is provided by them according to the menu. No worries about food, Wi-Fi, rooms, or students. Student activities are monitored by wardens. Separate hostels for boys and girls. We have two canteens outside the hostel. Many sports and festivals are conducted. The famous festival from our college is the Rejour festival.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our department, faculty members from IIT, IISc, and good knowledge professors are present. We never had guilt about asking anything we needed. Our professors are like our friends and parents. They also teach discipline along with studies. Proper haircut for boys and a presentable dress code are strictly followed.
detailed_review.Other: The best thing is we have less competition, less syllabus, fewer labs, and less stress too. I enjoy my life and my course at PEC. Our professors conduct 25 talks (lectures from different IIT or industrial professors for our knowledge). Good career guidance is given by our faculty members.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechatronics Engineering
reviews.review_title: Puducherry Technological University (PTU) erstwhile Pondicherry Engineering College (PEC).

detailed_review.Placements: Almost half of the students are placed in my college. Some good companies recruit students every year. There is a training and placement cell in my college that arranges placement opportunities for everyone. Placements for CSE, IT, and ECE are better than for other departments like Mechanical, Civil, and Chemical.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: There are three hostels for boys and one for girls. Every hostel has Wi-Fi, and the food quality is above average. There is an open space in the middle of the boys' hostel where students can play indoor games. There is a dispensary for students who are ill and an ambulance facility.
detailed_review.Faculty: Most of the faculty here are knowledgeable, and the curriculum is relevant. Almost 80 to 90% of the faculty members have completed their Ph.D.s, and most are well-experienced in teaching. The university's pass percentage is 50%. There are eight semesters in four years, each lasting six months or half the academic year.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Instrumentation Engineering
reviews.review_title: It a good decision to join this college, where you can enjoy and study with good staff and skills.

detailed_review.Placements: Max. 80% of them were placed, but it's only about individual performance. The highest package is around 10 LPA, the lowest is 4 LPA, and the average is 6 LPA. Companies like Microsoft and TCS recruit students. I am not sure of their roles. Talking about internships, the college has its own incubation center to get interns.
detailed_review.Infrastructure:
We have lot of facilities, like library Wi-Fi labs for each department 
It's eco-friendly hostal with security; each room have own Wi-Fi and hot water available, near hostal we have hospital, daily we can play sport in the hostal; we have separate ground inside the hostal; and also have a separate washing area.
detailed_review.Faculty:
While coming to academics, teachers were too good. All teachers are Ph.D. 
Semester exams are moderate; if we study from day one, it's very easy to get good marks. We have a lot of teachers who will help with our studies, and others are very friendly and will motivate us.
detailed_review.Other: Instrumentation engineering has a good scope in the future, so we can expect a lot of job opportunities with less. Compatetion. Every year we have Pecofest, and every department has its own festival, and scholarships will also be provided.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering
reviews.review_title: A dream college for engineers.

detailed_review.Placements:
60 percent of students were placed in my course. The lowest package is 2 lacs per annum.
The average package is 5 lacs per annum.
The highest package is 12 lacs per annum.
The companies that came for recruitment are TCS, Cognizant, Wipro, Concentrix, Zoho, QUALCOMM, MRF, Delta, CSS Corp, and Tech Mahindra.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Best facilities one could ask for. There are lots of infrastructural facilities available in the hostel, quality food available in the mess and canteen, medical facilities, sports and games. The water-drinking facility is available on all floors. The restrooms are clean, and hygiene and well maintained.
detailed_review.Faculty: Yes, the teaching here is so good. Students can easily access information through the library. This course is curriculum-relevant. Also, this helps students get ready for industry and campus placements. The difficulty of the exams is moderate. The pass percentage is 60/100.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I love exploring computers. I wish to learn lots of skills and go to my dream companies. My college conducts lots of events, such as literary events, presentations, cultural events, hackathons, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Communication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Satisfied by the faculty members and placements.

detailed_review.Placements: HCL, MBIT, Bounteous, Wipro, ZOHO and more companies visited our college last year. 70-80% of students got placed. The highest package offered is 15LPA and the average was 4.5LPA last year. Internships will be provided to all the students in the pre-final year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the ECE department is good, but the overall college infrastructure is average. The devices used in labs will not be working sometimes. Library is good contains nearly 6000 books. In the hostel, nowadays, the food is good, and we can change the menu if we want. Canteen food is delicious at an affordable price but, the infrastructure in the canteen is not that much good.
detailed_review.Faculty: When compared to the overall department of the college, the ECE depth staff are knowledgeable and experienced faculty members, highly involved in students' perspective. If we work hard, we can score great grades, the difficult of exams is moderate, the pass percentage is 50%, and 40 marks for internals.
detailed_review.Other: The main advantage of choosing ECE course is, this is suitable for both core companies and IT companies. Many alumni meeting are conducted also GENESIS event is conducted by ECE depth four years ones. Home state students can get many scholarships.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: What is the expected JEE Main cutoff 2024?
faqs.answer: NIT Manipur JEE Main cutoff 2024 has been released for admission to the BTech courses. faqs.question: How can I get admission in Pondicherry Technological University MBA?
faqs.answer: To secure admission in Pondicherry Technological University MBA course applicants must ensure to adhere to the below-mentioned eligibility criteria before filling out the application form, failing to which the candidature will stand canceled. After the application process candidates must participate in PGAC counselling process which is conducted in two rounds: offline counselling and a mop-up session for admission. During the counselling session, the candidates will be called in their merit order to choose an available seat among their eligible preferences. The final admission is based on the merit rank, category of the candidates, and availability of vacancies at the time of counselling. All admissions made by PGAC are provisional and subject to approval by Puducherry Technological University / Pondicherry University.

faqs.question: How to secure MBA seats at Pondicherry Technological University?
faqs.answer: To secure  MBA seats at Pondicherry Technological University candidates must participate in the PGAC counsellig process. PGAC conducts the counselling process for the MBA course in two rounds: offline counselling and a mop-up session for admission. During the counselling session, the candidates will be called in their merit order to choose an available seat among their eligible preferences.

faqs.question: What is the fee for MBA at Pondicherry Engineering College?
faqs.answer: The MBA fee at Pondicherry Engineering College is around INR 76,100 . Candidates must pay the MBA course fees to confirm the admission. PEC fees might include components other than tuition fees. The above fees are calculated basis first year/ semester. The actual fee may vary.

college_info.college_name: QIS College of Engineering & Technology: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Established in 1998, QIS College of Engineering & Technology is a private institute in Prakasam, Andhra Pradesh. The institute is approved by the AICTE. At the UG and PG levels, the institute offers 24 courses across 12 specialisations in Full Time mode. The popular QIS College of Engineering & Technology programs include B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech, MBA/PGDM and MCA. QIS College of Engineering & Technology courses are provided in several streams including Engineering, Business & Management Studies and IT & Software, etc. The institute has a total seat intake of 2256 students. The fees at QIS College of Engineering & Technology ranges between INR 97,400 to 3,50,400 for the different courses. QIS College of Engineering & Technology placements are vibrant, with the average median salary standing at around INR 5,50,000. The institute has a well-laid infrastructure with multiple facilities.
