college_info.college_name: DJ Sanghvi: Courses, Fees, Admission 2025, Placements, Reviews

highlights.summary: Established in 1994, Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering is a private institute in Mumbai, Maharashtra. Also known as DJ Sanghvi, the institute is approved by the AICTE. At the UG, PG and Doctorate levels, the institute offers 18 courses across 9 specialisations in Full Time mode. The popular DJ Sanghvi programs include B.E. / B.Tech, M.E./M.Tech and Ph.D. DJ Sanghvi courses are provided in several streams including Engineering, etc. The institute has a total seat intake of 1433 students. The fees at DJ Sanghvi ranges between INR 2,56,400 and 7,65,216 for the different courses. DJ Sanghvi placements are vibrant, with the average median salary standing at around INR 7,01,875. The institute has a well-laid infrastructure with multiple facilities.

college_info_program.intro:
Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering provides BTech and MTech as popular programmes at the UG and PG levels, respectively. The specialisations include Computer Engineering, Electronics and Telecommunication, Information Technology, Mechanical, Biomedical, AI and Data Science, Computer Science Engineering, AI and Machine Learning, and Manufacturing Systems Engineering, and others. PhD programmes are also available at DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering.
The college offers respective courses for a duration varying from 2 years to 4 years in affiliation with the University of Mumbai. The fee structure of these courses varies from INR 2.6 L to INR 7.7 L. For admission to these courses, candidates should fulfil the eligibility criteria. summary.college_name: Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: DJ Sanghvi in a nutshell.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement scene is quite good; based on my observations, it’s above 90% with many people placed in JP Morgan, UBS, ZS, and other prominent companies. Furthermore, the placement cell is very helpful and assists in many fields. In addition to placements, there is also an internship fair conducted to give students the opportunity to gain experience.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure consists of a six-story building. There is no ground or any area for sports, but considering the college's location, it is acceptable. The entire college is air-conditioned except for the corridors. There are labs for many subjects, and the canteen is also quite good. As for the hostel, the college doesn’t have one but is affiliated with a nearby option. However, I honestly wouldn’t recommend it as it’s very expensive, and you’ll have a better chance of finding another one.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and offer great assistance in academics, and the curriculum is practical. Exams are also reasonable, and you get enough time to prepare for them. Teachers also help during exams by providing study materials. The passing percentage is reasonable at around 35%, and it's not that difficult to score.
detailed_review.Other: In addition to academics, the college also organizes various activities, including fests, hackathons, and other club activities. The college has a large variety of clubs that will suit your needs. It would have been better if there was an area for sports and other activities, but other than that, it’s pretty good.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The honest review of DJ Sanghvi.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 70% of students get placed this year. Though it was a bit frustrating at first, almost everyone who sat for placements got placed. The main advantage we have over others is that we are allowed to prepare for competitive exams like GATE and GRE while sitting for certain interviews (not for dream jobs and above). This option is not available in most colleges.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Labs all have centralized AC and all the required software. The lab in charge is polite and experienced. Hostels are a bit costly compared to the services they provide. There are many stores and options to eat in the area, so students from outside have many options.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty are very experienced with the required amount of qualifications. Though the exams are hard, they help you in the long run. Even internal marks are hard to get, as teachers are very particular about labs and the assignments given. The course has all the required subjects related to the field you have selected.
detailed_review.Other: The college overall is good, but don't expect much from the cultural fest, as the management is very bad. You can always go to the fests at the neighboring SVKM college, though. It is a great college to study and helps you start your career on the right track.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Mechanical Engineering
reviews.review_title: Review of Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements in our college are great, but only for some branches. In branches like Mechanical and Electronics, placements are little to none. Even students who get placed have packages in the range of 3.5 to 8 LPA. About 45–50% of students receive placements.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Facilities provided are above average, yet not up to the mark. Given the fee that one has to pay, the infrastructure can be much better. Opportunities for students interested in sports are little to none, and the college does not do anything about it.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members for Mechanical Engineering are excellent. Faculty members are quite knowledgeable, friendly, and approachable. The majority of the course curriculum is relevant not as much as to make students industry-ready, but definitely useful. The semester exams are easy.
detailed_review.Other: I chose Mechanical Engineering in this college as it is one of the best in Mumbai for this particular course. The best part about the course is definitely the SAE teams.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Good placement percentage and very good infrastructure.

detailed_review.Placements: In my course (EXTC), around 80% of students were placed through the college. The highest package was 29 LPA, the average was 8 LPA, and the lowest was 4 LPA. Amazon and Google were the top recruiting companies for my course. The top role offered in the course was the tech head.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: You got everything you wanted, from libraries to the gym, but you didn't get a campus. Everything was top-notch here. You wouldn't feel like you were in a college. It would make you feel like you were in a 5-star hotel out of India, too.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty was good and helpful. Everyone was a Ph.D. holder, except for a few, but they had excellent experience in their field. The students passed out from here were industry-ready, of course. Since it was autonomous, exams were tough to pass, which helped students to get to know about knowledge.
detailed_review.Other: EXTC helped students gain knowledge about software and hardware, helping students get jobs in every technical and non-technical field. It was not about improving the course. It was about the education system. We should reach new technologies, not the old ones that have not been updated yet.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: Why you should come to DJ Sanghvi: Personal Review.

detailed_review.Placements: Our college has very good placements. In EXTC, about 80 percent of the students who sat for placements got it. Average 12 LPA, the highest is 42 LPA (so far), and the lowest maybe 4 LPA. Top recruiters are Google, L&T, etc. Internships are also amazing and in fact, Google picked up 4 kids for 1.5 Lacs per month this year.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Our facilities are absolutely amazing. AC is everywhere, classrooms are good, and labs are fully equipped. Our seminar hall is beautiful, we have different departments for different branches. Our canteen is so good that people from different colleges come to sit there.
detailed_review.Faculty: Personally, I love our faculty. They know what they're doing, they're all PhDs and highly educated. And most of all, they really are interested in helping the students. The curriculum is very personalized due to the NEP, we have electives and minor and honors programs now.
detailed_review.Other: I chose this course because I have an inkling of electronics. Something that could be improved is how hard the course is. Events and fests in our college are amazing, mostly in the month of March.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: The best college with the best teachers and environment.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 100% of students get placed in the college in CS and CS-allied branches. The highest package can range from 25-30 LPA and the average package is around 11 LPA. Many top recruiting companies that come to our college, like JP Morgan and Google, provided internships this year and may come for full-time jobs next year. Many job roles from different top companies are provided like SDE, ML engineer, Data Engineer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure of the college is very good. Classrooms are very spacious and fully air conditioned. Labs are also equipped with modern amenities and tools and are fully air conditioned. Libraries are the best part of college. It has many books, journals, and articles from various great publications. All resources are available for postgraduate studies also. Canteen food is average but the infrastructure of the canteen is excellent .
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are very helpful and all of them are highly qualified, experienced and supportive Their experience helps student to ace the subject. The course curriculum keeps on updating every year on the basis of industry required to make the students industry-ready and ace their placements. The exams are not very difficult .
detailed_review.Other: The college promotes a lot of extracurricular activities and the cultural festival is excellent. There are many chances for students to gain more practical experience through competitions and committees in the college, which help students build their network too.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Insights of DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: Placement of the college is not top-notch, but they are decent and increasing day by day. The average package is about 9 LPA, and total placements are about 80%. The highest package offered by the company was 38 LPA, and it was Amazon who offered it. Now, Google has also come for the placement.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good, but there is no campus; it's just a building of 6 floors. Although the labs and classrooms are centralized AC, and Wi-Fi is connected all the time. All the labs and classrooms have smart boards and whiteboards, which enhance the learning experience.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are good and well-educated as well. Some of them hold 15+ years of experience, and some of them have PhDs in their subjects. The curriculum is good, with a mixture of theory and practical in the subjects, and the exams are also well-structured and managed.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: My experience at Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The placement process at Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering is divided into four categories: elite, super dream, dream, and normal. Around 25-40% of the batch received placement offers, with some students receiving multiple offers. The normal companies were open to all students, either for masters (higher study) or placement, while the other companies were available only for placement students. Some students also managed to secure off-campus placements at companies like Google.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Each floor has two departments, which are well equipped with a good amount of labs and classrooms. Each floor is also equipped with Wi-Fi, which, however, has a firewall that seems to work quite effectively. The college also has an auditorium on the third floor, which is mostly used for events and stuff. Also, the college has a cafeteria on the ground floor with options for both indoor and outdoor sitting. The library on the first floor is also good enough but it can get crowded sometimes during the peak exam season.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty in my department are very helpful. They provided lecture notes, presentations, and other resources that were relevant to the course curriculum. The curriculum itself was well-designed, with ample choice in electric forces that were nearly aligned with industry standards. In my fifth semester, I had the option to choose an honours or minors degree. I chose the honours degree, which is an additional degree in addition to my BTech in computer engineering. It spans four semesters. Exams are fairly easy to score well on if we study a week or so before. To get a 10 CGPA, we need a 90% in a particular subject; for a 9 CGPA, we need an 80%. It's quite easy to score a 9 to 9.5 CGPA if we study a week or 10 days before.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of D J Sanghavi  College

detailed_review.Placements: The placement are good especially if you belong to tech branches like information technology and computer science engineering and data science and artificial intelligenceThe average package ranges from 10-12 lakhs which is offered from companies like accenture delloite .
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The facilities are quite average. The classroom are air-conditioned and the labs are air-conditioned too. Each labs has thirty two computers. The lift is not working since one year. The classrooms are decent some class don't have fans so ac not working is a problem
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculties are good. They are well qualified and they have degrees like Mtech and Phd and they are helpful if you go to them. They are helpful and approachable. They also help with research papers and curriculum is well designed it covers all the core subjects

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of D.J Sanghavi College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: IT department has a hundred percent placement. The highest package ranges from 35 to 40 lakhs, which is offered by companies like Microsoft, while the lowest is 5 to 6 lakhs and the average is 6-10 lakhs per annum. Top recruiters are J.P Morgan, Accenture, and Deloitte.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is well maintained. The campus has wifi access throughout. The labs are air-conditioned and have computers of good quality that support various software. The classes are air-conditioned too. The library is also equipped with ample books.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculties are very well-qualified and helpful. They are very approachable. Many faculties hold degrees like M.Tech and PHD. The course curriculum is designed in a way that it covers core subjects of technology as well as subjects like machine learning, artificial intelligence, etc.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: Review of D.J. Sanghavi College of Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The placements of the college are quite good, especially if you belong to the tech branches like IT, computer science, data science, etc. The average package is 8-10 lakhs and is offered by various companies like Accenture, Deloitte, and J.P. Morgan. My department, Information Technology, has a 100 percent placement record.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is good. The laboratory and classrooms are air-conditioned. The computers in the labs are well maintained. Wi-Fi access is available throughout the college. We have two lifts in working condition. We also have a canteen where the food is tasty and hygiene is maintained as well.
detailed_review.Faculty: The curriculum is well designed. It covers various core subjects required in the industry. We have two term tests and end-semester exams in one semester. The teachers are qualified; most of them have M.Tech and Ph.D. degrees. They are helpful and approachable.
detailed_review.Other: The college also has various clubs and committees in which students can participate and develop their soft and technical skills. We can join GDSC, DJCSI, which is the Computer Society of India, Codestars for competitive coding, and the college also has a fest named Trinity, which occurs annually.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: College review of DJ Sanghvi

detailed_review.Placements: DJ Sanghvi College is one of the best engineering colleges. It provides various internships and placement opportunities. More than 90 percent of the students get placed via the college. Companies like Apollo, JP Morgan, General Mills, and others come for software engineering, data analyst, and web developer roles.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is quite good, with air-conditioned rooms and labs that have Wi-Fi and PCs. The library has an extensive collection of different books, and the canteen offers a good variety of food. While it doesn’t include much in terms of sports and games, it has medical facilities and overall good amenities.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers are helpful in all aspects and have in-depth knowledge about the curriculum. The curricula are relevant and make us industry-ready. Examinations are decent enough and easy to pass if we attend lectures, pay attention, and study well in advance.
detailed_review.Other: I chose information technology. The culture and facilities are good, with nothing to improve. There are various fests like Trinity.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Absolutely best infrastructure and faculty.

detailed_review.Placements: Till now, 68% of students who were interested in the placement drive are placed, and others are planning for a master's abroad. College connections and networks for foreign studies are phenomenal. Till now, the highest package offered is 17.65 lakhs. Deloitte, JP Morgan, and companies like Wise have started their drives. A lot of students were given pre-placement offers, and the number of internship opportunities is very good.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Infrastructure is one thing our college is especially very good at. It has all sorts of modern amenities and labs, which are more than enough for a college student. The mess and canteen are clean and affordable for all students, and they provide quality and taste at a reasonable amount.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers here are quite friendly and helpful in all kinds of ways. They take into consideration every student's opinion, and overall, the papers set in our college are a little tough. However, enough content and material are provided to excel in the test, so there is no such problem.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Electronics and Telecommunication Engineering
reviews.review_title: All you need to know about Dwarkadas J Sanghvi College.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 85% of students were placed. The highest CTC was 25 LPA, and the lowest was 4 LPA. The average was around 8–9 LPA. Top recruiting companies were JP Morgan, DOTNET, ISS Governance, Axxela, etc. Almost all student who SAT for internship fair got the opportunity. Top roles included data analyst, SDE, assistant, software engineer, blockchain developer, etc.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi is available throughout campus. Labs are state-of-the-art in college, with high-end PCs and lab equipment. The library is also state-of-the art with thousands of books. The hostel is a bit costly with all its facilities. The canteen is not so good. Medical facilities are available. Sports and games happen at events, not throughout the year.
detailed_review.Faculty: Teachers are very helpful and highly qualified. The teaching quality was overall good. The curriculum designed is very relevant to the industry and it somewhat makes students ready for the industry with more effort. The semester exams are easy as they provide question banks. The pass percentage is 35%.
detailed_review.Other: I chose EXTC as it is a circuit branch of CS IT & also provides knowledge of the electronics and telecom sectors. It should have included more coding and IOT subjects. Events are top-notch. The campus crowd is very good, as all are meritorious students. The college has very reputed alumni so connections are strong. Scholarships are not provided by EBC. Extracurricular activities are provided by clubs.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Placements and crowds are amazing. Everything else is bad.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements were good; the highest package was 40 LPA, and the median is around 11 LPA. Many students are getting 10+ LPA offers. Almost 80% of all registered PPLs for placements are placed. The top MNC is JPMC. The highest package is offered by Adobe (SDE). Most students get roles in software, although some are getting roles in ML.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Hostels are quite expensive (4 lacs per year). Lab batches are for more than 30 people (although the lab has enough space, it is not supposed to have more than 25 PPL in a batch). Wi-Fi is bad and most good websites don't work due to firewalls. The canteen is also bad.
detailed_review.Faculty: faculty isn't helpful, but they are knowledgeable. You can expect 2 out of 5 faculty to be good in each semester. Exam semesters are quite difficult, with a passing percentage of 40%. The course curriculum is amazing, with basic as well as some of the latest technologies happening and it is being updated regularly.
detailed_review.Other:
Considering the fact that everyone is towards web development or software development on computer, I chose this data science branch just to stand out and do something in field of AI. I think, due to amazing course work, it has helped me a lot. absence of good faculty on campus is an issue which needs to be addressed
.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: One of the best colleges for Mumbai students to pursue Civil Engineering.

detailed_review.Placements: The college has a great alumni network with JP Morgan, IBM, Tata, L&T, J Kumar, etc. visiting. The college management give us internships and early guidance from the second year onwards so the students become industry ready. 6 LPA to 15 LPA packages are offered from this college in roles like site engineer and project engineer.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Nice infrastructure and facilities are available with well maintained labs and classrooms in the college. There is a  well maintained library having all the types of reference books with all the facilities for reading available. Best quality facilities are given in the hostel so the other states students can have a good stay.
detailed_review.Faculty: The teachers come after doing MS from foreign Universities so they guide us in manners of representing ourselves in front of the interviewers to get jobs. They also teach us to utilize our knowledge. The course is very beneficial for getting jobs due to number of projects and internships. The exams are or average level.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Information Technology
reviews.review_title: The pros and cons of D J. SANGHVI.

detailed_review.Placements: JMPC is the top recruiter for IT; it is a mass recruiter. Students are recruited mostly on PPOs by JPMC. Many companies visit the college to recruit students. Even Amazon has recruited from this college. There are students who even opt for higher studies, but they do not take part in the placement season.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is world-class, with labs that have the latest technology and an internet connection that is fast enough to do research and development. Every classroom is equipped with smart boards, which makes it easier to understand complex concepts by making the classes interactive.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty is knowledgeable enough and has deep knowledge of the subject they teach. The curriculum is updated regularly so that it is relevant to the ever-evolving industry standards, so as to load students with the right skill set. The exam pattern is like there are two term tests and one end-of-semester exam. You have to get 40% to pass the exams.
detailed_review.Other: Well, the college only has a building in the name of a campus and there is a lack of sports activities but it is compensated by various hackathons organized by various committees of the college.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: Fantastic learning environment and the best placements.

detailed_review.Placements: Almost 50% of students go for higher studies, and the rest who sit for placements are 100% placed at big IT companies based on skills and areas of interest. Companies like J.P. Morgan and Morgan Stanley do visit our campus, and you will also see big companies hiring interns.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: We do have all types of classes with centralized AC. The  of the CSEDS Department is literally the best on the whole D.J. Sanghavi Cinfrastructureampus. I don't know about hostels, but the infrastructure of this department is the best in college now, after the IT department, and HOD is also very supportive.
detailed_review.Faculty: Faculty members are best in their respective fields; mostly all of them are Ph.D.s in their respective fields, and as it is an autonomous college, the syllabus is designed to be the best of all the syllabuses in Mumbai, or, say, Maharashtra. The marking system, which is newly designed, is also very good as per Masters or MS.
detailed_review.Other: DJ Sanghvi is the house of extracurriculars; it gives you the opportunity to learn, earn, and grow.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Engineering
reviews.review_title: Really bad canteen food xD .

detailed_review.Placements: I think most of the students in my course are enrolled in or going for a master's. I don't have any idea about the average package offered for the entire college, but for my branch, it is around INR 10 lakh rupees. We have an internship fair, so 60–70 percent of the students get internships there.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: Wi-Fi, labs, classrooms, and libraries are all air-conditioned. The canteen is not up to par or satisfactory because the fee we are paying for it is way too much. They have an entire list of menu items, but they only serve plain dosa. Horrid! Not that I eat in the canteen.
detailed_review.Faculty: The faculty guides in research papers; they have started taking attendance seriously (I think so), but still, they are very lenient and nice. In exams, they consider that students are bunking, so they are very thoughtful about it. The difficulty of exams can vary.

reviews.course: B.Tech. in Computer Science and Engineering (Data Science)
reviews.review_title: I am not satisfied with this college.

detailed_review.Placements: Placements are good. Many students got placed in top companies. The training and placement cell is average. Around 100 students got placed in our department. Around 36% of students got placed in this course.
detailed_review.Infrastructure: The infrastructure is average. All classrooms are air-conditioned and well-ventilated. Our college has 6-storeyed buildings. There is a decent library in this college. All laboratories are well-equipped with Dell and HP all-in-one desktops. Sitting arrangements are good. Around 3,500 students can accommodate easily in our classrooms. Our college does not provide any residential facilities.
detailed_review.Faculty: In our college, HOD is very good. All faculty members are well-educated. They do not provide in-depth knowledge. This college is being run by industry-failed people who could not make their careers so they are spoiling the lives of innocent students who have been admitted. It is an autonomous college. The course curriculum is not relevant. Two exams are conducted every semester. The pass marks for mid-term exams are 25 and the end-term is 75.
detailed_review.Other: Many students get admission through the MHT and CET exams. The management is good. It provides a lot of money to major publications to make its college appear as number 1 in Maharashtra. Around 75% of attendance is required in this college. DJ night and Sanghvi are conducted in this college.

college_info.college_name: Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering Admission 2026: Fees, Courses, Eligibility and Selection

admission.title: DJ Sanghvi Engineering College Admission Overview 2026
admission.overview_text: DJ Sanghvi Engineering College admission is through qualifying exam scores of the candidates. The institute offers courses at UG, PG and Doctorate levels in the domain of Engineering . DJ Sanghvi admission is granted based on performance of the aspirants in exams, such as JEE Main , GATE, and MHT CET . Candidates must register online on the institute’s website. For the offline availability of the application form, students must check with the college admission department. Candidates have to pay a total tuition fee of INR 2,56,400 - 7,65,216 for UG, PG and PhD level. Besides tuition fee, students also need to pay caution deposit, exam fee, hostel fee, etc. Typically, the duration of the UG level courses is 4 years.

faqs.question: Does DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering conduct its own entrance examination?
faqs.answer: No, DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering does not conduct it's own entrance examination. The College is affiliated to Mumbai University and accepts national examinations scores. The exams are JEE Main, MH CET and GATE, accepted for UG and PG programmes, respectively. PhD admissions are merit based and required no entrance examination.

faqs.question: What is the fee range for all courses at DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The fee range at DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering is INR 2,56,400 to 7,65,216 for UG, PG and PhD level programmes. Besides tuition fee, students also need to pay caution deposit, exam fee, hostel fee, etc.

faqs.question: What is the DJ Sanghvi PhD Mechanical Engineering admission process?
faqs.answer: DJ Sanghvi PhD admissions follow application-based process where eligible candidates submit a prescribed PhD form along with supporting documents via email. Shortlisted applicants are generally called for interaction or evaluation as per university norms.

faqs.question: Will BTech admissions at DJ Sanghvi be conducted through CAP and ILS rounds?
faqs.answer: Yes, BTech at DJ Sanghvi are expected to be conducted through Centralised Admission Process (CAP) rounds as well as Institutional Level Seats (ILS), including vacancy rounds, in line with State CET Cell guidelines.

faqs.question: What is the minimum eligibility for BTech at DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The minimum eligibility for BTech at DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering is passing Class 12 in PCM/ PCMB stream from a recognised board. The selection criteria is entrance based with the college accepting JEE Main and MH CET scores for the same.

faqs.question: Does DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering grant direct admission to its PG programmes?
faqs.answer: DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering does not grant direct admission to its PG courses. The college accepts GATE scores for PG admission. The college does not entertain any other entrance examination score and does not offer merit based admission to the same.

faqs.question: Is document verification mandatory for DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admission?
faqs.answer: Yes, document verification is a must part of the DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admission process. You must present original certificates during reporting. Admission is confirmed only after successful verification of documents.

faqs.question: What to do after JEE Main session 2 result?
faqs.answer: After JEE session 2 is completed, only those candidates who are aiming for IITs need to start preparing for JEE Advanced after clearing JEE Main. Those who are above the 98th percentile should start preparing for JEE Advanced as soon as possible. Those below this, between the 95th and 98th percentile, should focus on attempting more mock tests and previous year question papers so that they have a better chance of clearing JEE Advanced

faqs.question: How can candidates apply for BTech ILS seats at DJ Sanghvi?
faqs.answer: For BTech seats at DJ Sanghvi, candidates will be required to apply separately on the institute's portal, even if they are registered on the State CET Cell website, within the notified deadlines.

faqs.question: What documents will be required for BTech admission at DJ Sanghvi?
faqs.answer: BTech admission at DJ Sanghvi will require original academic certificates, CET/JEE scorecards, category certificates (if applicable), photo ID, and fee payment receipts for verification during reporting.

faqs.question: What entrance exam scores are accepted by Dwarkadas J Sanghvi College of Engineering for admission to M.Tech.?
faqs.answer: Dwarkadas J Sanghvi College of Engineering considers GATE scores of the students for admitting them to their M.Tech. programme. MH M.Tech-CET scores are also used by college for admission in M.Tech. programmes that it offers for students. GATE has a different cutoff score according to the specialization, it varies between 350 and 550. MH-M.Tech-CET stands for Maharashtra Master of Technology Common Entrance Test and the marks percentile for this exam vary between 50 to 80 percent. Admission to MTech is also offered by the college based on class XIIth marks along with percentage in academic and management quotas and other criteria such as academic performance and work experience.

faqs.question: Is there a deadline after which no BTech fee refund is allowed at DJ Sanghvi?
faqs.answer: Yes, for BTech admissions at DJ Sanghvi, cancellation after the prescribed cutoff date (mid-September, based on past schedules) will make the candidate ineligible for any fee refund except security and caution deposits.

faqs.question: When will DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admissions begin?
faqs.answer: DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admissions will most probably begin around July, once the institute releases its official admission notification. The application window usually opens soon after eligibility guidelines are announced. Exact dates will be shared on the college website.

faqs.question: How are DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admissions conducted?
faqs.answer: DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admissions are generally conducted through institute-level rounds. The process follows norms laid down by the University of Mumbai and the State CET Cell. Selection is usually based on eligibility and merit.

faqs.question: Is a GATE score compulsory for DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admission?
faqs.answer: GATE score is preferred for admissions in DJ Sanghvi M.Tech courses. If you do not have a GATE score, you can still be considered when seats remain vacant. Final selection depends on institute-level merit norms.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for DJ Sanghvi M.Tech admission?
faqs.answer: You pay INR 1000 when you are submitting M.Tech application form at DJ Sanghvi. If you fail to pay the fee on time, your application will be rejected by institute.

faqs.question: What is the expected application timeline for DJ Sanghvi PhD courses?
faqs.answer: Currently, DJ Sanghvi PhD admission is not open yet. Application timelines will most probably be announced mid-year, similar to earlier cycles, with deadlines given for form submission and document verification.

faqs.question: What eligibility criteria apply for DJ Sanghvi PhD Mechanical Engineering?
faqs.answer: A postgraduate degree in Mechanical Engineering with at least 55% marks and a valid GATE score or PET qualification is also needed for admission in PhD programme of this institute.

faqs.question: Is GATE or PET mandatory for DJ Sanghvi PhD admissions?
faqs.answer: For the DJ Sanghvi PhD admissions, candidates will most probably be needing a valid GATE or PET score. Sponsored candidates may be considered under specific norms, as per previous records.

faqs.question: Can DJ Sanghvi cancel a PhD admission after selection?
faqs.answer: DJ Sanghvi will cancel admission at any stage if information is false or if you submitted any forged documents during admission. Mention only correct information so that your admission process is smooth.

faqs.question: Is the application process at DJ Sanghvi Engineering College conducted online or offline?
faqs.answer: The application process at DJ Sanghvi College of Engineering is conducted online for UG and PG courses. The process is conducted offline for PhD courses. The application process for the former can be completed via the official Mumbai University website, while the application form for the later has to be downloaded and filled to be submitted offline at the college campus.

faqs.question: What is the application fee for the B.Tech. program at Dwarkadas J Sanghvi College of Engineering?
faqs.answer: The fees to be paid for applying the B.Tech programme offered in Dwarkadas J Sanghvi College of Engineering is the online applications fees of Rs 1500/- and the offline application fees of Rs 1700/-. To cover the cost of moving house, you can pay the application fee through online method of credit/debit cards/NB or demand draft mode. In most cases, the college admits students to B.Tech. programs during the period of April and June annually. The application fee may vary and candidates are kindly advised to perform a website check to determine the fee charged by the college. There is also a provision in the application fee of INR 500 for all females and SC/ST/OBC candidates.

review_summarisation.heading: What students say about Dwarkadas J. Sanghvi College of Engineering

likes.text: There is a range of companies that visit the campus - Morgan Stanley, JP Morgan, Quantiphi, Mu Sigma, BrowserStack, L&T Infotech, Infosys, etc.
As many people from the college prefer to go for MS or MBA, the placement record is quite good.

Placements.info_text: These insights are automatically extracted from student reviews, without any manual intervention

likes.text: The canteen is the best and looks amazing, but the food is offered at a bit high price.
It has air-conditioned classrooms, good quality benches and desks and high-speed Wi-Fi in every corner of the college along with a fully functional library with PCs.

Infrastructure.info_text: These insights are automatically extracted from student reviews, without any manual intervention

likes.text: Teachers and faculty is best thing about this college, well qualified and more than sufficient experienced teachers with Ph.Ds in tier respective streams.
The course curriculum is well designed with many optional subjects so that students can study some subjects in which they are interested.
